Lines.Text: the motherboard is a segmented three piece construction .
use tweezers to first lift up , with a moderate amount of force , and free each ends of the motherboard from the assembly .
be sure to use esd safe tweezers to prevent static discharge from zapping your device .

Steps.Text_raw: The motherboard is a segmented three piece construction. Use tweezers to first lift up, with a moderate amount of force, and free each ends of the motherboard from the assembly. Be sure to use ESD safe tweezers to prevent static discharge from zapping your device.

Lines.Text: the motherboard should now be removable from the assembly .
use tweezers to lightly pry , lift , and remove the board by its middle section .
if the motherboard is stuck it may be caught on the assembly . wiggle it around to free it . you may also need to pull the edges of the assembly away from the motherboard to create space .

Steps.Text_raw: The motherboard should now be removable from the assembly. Use tweezers to lightly pry, lift, and remove the board by its middle section. If the motherboard is stuck it may be caught on the assembly.  Wiggle it around to free it.  You may also need to pull the edges of the assembly away from the motherboard to create space.

Lines.Text: with the motherboard removed , the battery is exposed .
a small metal strut protects the battery .
remove the small metal strut by prying it out of both sides of the enclosure .

Steps.Text_raw: With the  motherboard removed, the battery is exposed. A small metal strut protects the battery. Remove the small metal strut by prying it out of both sides of the enclosure.

Lines.Text: use caution when handling the battery . if damaged or punctured , it can release hazardous chemicals or catch fire .
remove the battery by pulling on the pull tab .
don't be afraid to use force , the battery is tightly packed into the plastic enclosure .

Steps.Text_raw: Use caution when handling the battery.  If damaged or punctured, it can release hazardous chemicals or catch fire. Remove the battery by pulling on the pull tab. Don't be afraid to use force, the battery is tightly packed into the plastic enclosure.

Title: How to Darn a Hole in a Knitted Garment

Lines.Text: inspect the damage . clean any dirt or debris from the area .
tie off any loose threads from the hole .

Steps.Text_raw: Inspect the damage. Clean any dirt or debris from the area. Tie off any loose threads from the hole.

Lines.Text: cut a length of thread .

we're using contrasting thread in our guide so that you can see it . however , when it comes time for your repair , you'll want to use thread that matches the color of your garment's fabric so that your stitching is less visible .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut a length of thread. We're using contrasting thread in our guide so that you can see it. However, when it comes time for your repair, you'll want to use thread that matches the color of your garment's fabric so that your stitching is less visible.

Lines.Text: insert one end of the thread through the eye of the needle .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert one end of the thread through the eye of the needle.

Lines.Text: align the two ends of the thread .
your needle should be threaded between these two ends .
tie the ends off in an overhand knot .
tie a second overhand knot to make the knot in the thread larger .

Steps.Text_raw: Align the two ends of the thread. Your needle should be threaded between these two ends. Tie the ends off in an overhand knot. Tie a second overhand knot to make the knot in the thread larger.

Lines.Text: starting about a centimeter to the side of the hole , and half a centimeter below , insert the needle from the back of the garment .
you should only push the needle through one layer of the garment as you work . if you go through both layers , you will sew the garment shut .

Steps.Text_raw: Starting about a centimeter to the side of the hole, and half a centimeter below, insert the needle from the back of the garment. You should only push the needle through one layer of the garment as you work. If you go through both layers, you will sew the garment shut.

Lines.Text: pull the needle through to the front of the garment until the thread is taut and the knot catches in the back .
take a single guide going into a single layer of fabric and coming back up one row of the knit closer to the hole .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the needle through to the front of the garment until the thread is taut and the knot catches in the back. Take a single [guide|21032|straight stitch] going into a single layer of fabric and coming back up one row of the knit closer to the hole.

Lines.Text: pull the needle through until the thread is taut , but not scrunching or gathering the fabric .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the needle through until the thread is taut, but not scrunching or gathering the fabric.

Lines.Text: take another straight stitch towards the hole , going in and out of a single layer of the garment , passing the thread under a single row of the knit .
try to work perpendicular to the grain of the knit , creating a straight row of stitches .
pull the needle through until the thread is taut , but not pulling or scrunching the fabric .

Steps.Text_raw: Take another straight stitch towards the hole, going in and out of a single layer of the garment, passing the thread under a single row of the knit. Try to work perpendicular to the grain of the knit, creating a straight row of stitches. Pull the needle through until the thread is taut, but not pulling or scrunching the fabric.

Lines.Text: continue working across the hole taking stitches under every other row of the knit .
this photo illustrates how the needle should go under every other row of stitches . if you are new to sewing , it is better to take one stitch at a time .
when you get about a centimeter past the hole , pull the needle through until the thread is taut , but not gathering or scrunching the fabric .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue working across the hole taking stitches under every other row of the knit. This photo illustrates how the needle should go under every other row of stitches. If you are new to sewing, it is better to take one stitch at a time. When you get about a centimeter past the hole, pull the needle through until the thread is taut, but not gathering or scrunching the fabric.

Lines.Text: turn the needle around and take a stitch going the opposite direction ( towards where you started ) just above your last row of stitches .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the needle around and take a stitch going the opposite direction (towards where you started) just above your last row of stitches.

Lines.Text: pull the thread through until it is taut .
you should see the thread loop around to go the other direction .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the thread through until it is taut. You should see the thread loop around to go the other direction.

Lines.Text: stitch this second row the same way you did the first , but in the opposite direction . this time , go under the rows of knit you previously went over , and vice versa .
when you reach the end of this second row , turn around and continue stitching in the previous direction . stitch rows back and forth until you have worked about a centimeter past the hole .
don't forget to pull the thread taut after each stitch . if you are new to sewing , take your time , slowly completing each stitch .

Steps.Text_raw: Stitch this second row the same way you did the first, but in the opposite direction. This time, go under the rows of knit you previously went over, and vice versa. When you reach the end of this second row, turn around and continue stitching in the previous direction. Stitch rows back and forth until you have worked about a centimeter past the hole. Don't forget to pull the thread taut after each stitch. If you are new to sewing, take your time, slowly completing each stitch.

Lines.Text: when you have finished sewing rows , take the needle and insert it across the top corner of your stitching at a forty-five degree angle , taking a stitch .
as you begin to pull the needle through you will see a loop form . catch the loop with your finger .
do not pull the thread taut yet .

Steps.Text_raw: When you have finished sewing rows, take the needle and insert it across the top corner of your stitching at a forty-five degree angle, taking a stitch. As you begin to pull the needle through you will see a loop form. Catch the loop with your finger. Do not pull the thread taut yet.

Lines.Text: insert the needle into the loop .
pull the needle through the loop .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the needle into the loop. Pull the needle through the loop.

Lines.Text: pull the thread taut , closing the loop and creating a knot .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the thread taut, closing the loop and creating a knot.

Lines.Text: insert the needle at a forty-five degree angle to your previous stitching , taking the needle under one row of the knit .
you will begin to stitch over your previous stitches at a forty-five degree angle , just as before . remember to only stitch through one layer of the garment .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the needle at a forty-five degree angle to your previous stitching, taking the needle under one row of the knit. You will begin to stitch over your previous stitches at a forty-five degree angle, just as before. Remember to only stitch through one layer of the garment.

Lines.Text: pull the needle through until the thread is taut .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the needle through until the thread is taut.

Lines.Text: take another stitch crossing your previous stitching at forty-five degrees .
pull the needle through until the thread is taut .
continue stitching in this manner until you come to the edge of your previous rows of stitching .

Steps.Text_raw: Take another stitch crossing your previous stitching at forty-five degrees. Pull the needle through until the thread is taut. Continue stitching in this manner until you come to the edge of your previous rows of stitching.

Lines.Text: when you come to the edge of your stitches , turn the needle around and begin stitching another line of stitches at a forty-five degree angle alongside the line you just made .

Steps.Text_raw: When you come to the edge of your stitches, turn the needle around and begin stitching another line of stitches at a forty-five degree angle alongside the line you just made.

Lines.Text: continue stitching , alternating under and over the rows of knit .
don't forget to pull the thread taut after each stitch .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue stitching, alternating under and over the rows of knit. Don't forget to pull the thread taut after each stitch.

Lines.Text: when you have covered all your rows of stitching with lines of stitching at forty-five degrees , check your work to make sure that the fabric is not pulling or gathered anywhere .
if you have a pull or gather , you can flatten it with your finger , allowing the thread to loosen .

Steps.Text_raw: When you have covered all your rows of stitching with lines of stitching at forty-five degrees, check your work to make sure that the fabric is not pulling or gathered anywhere. If you have a pull or gather, you can flatten it with your finger, allowing the thread to loosen.

Lines.Text: drive the needle into the bottom corner of your stitching .
pull the needle through to the backside ( inside ) of the garment .

Steps.Text_raw: Drive the needle into the bottom corner of your stitching. Pull the needle through to the backside (inside) of the garment.

Lines.Text: on the backside , take a small stitch very close to where the needle came through .
slowly pull the needle through the fabric , creating a loop .
catch the loop in your fingers .
put the needle through the loop .

Steps.Text_raw: On the backside, take a small stitch very close to where the needle came through. Slowly pull the needle through the fabric, creating a loop. Catch the loop in your fingers. Put the needle through the loop.

Lines.Text: pull the needle through the loop , creating a knot .
pull the thread taut , tightening the knot .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the needle through the loop, creating a knot. Pull the thread taut, tightening the knot.

Lines.Text: drive the needle under the knot you just created , catching a small bit of the garment in the stitch .
slowly pull the needle through , creating another loop .
put the needle through the loop .

Steps.Text_raw: Drive the needle under the knot you just created, catching a small bit of the garment in the stitch. Slowly pull the needle through, creating another loop. Put the needle through the loop.

Lines.Text: pull the needle through the loop creating a knot .
pull the thread taut , creating a knot on top of the knot you previously made .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the needle through the loop creating a knot. Pull the thread taut, creating a knot on top of the knot you previously made.

Lines.Text: clip the dangling threads and admire your handiwork .
this image illustrates how the darning will look when you use matching thread .

Steps.Text_raw: Clip the dangling threads and admire your handiwork. This image illustrates how the darning will look when you use matching thread.

Title: How to Wash and Dry a Patagonia Down Jacket

Lines.Text: lay your jacket out and zip up all the zippers .
if your jacket has hook-and-loop tape , fasten it closed .
don't forget to check the pockets for any treasures or love notes you may have forgotten .
place the jacket in your washing machine .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay your jacket out and zip up all the zippers. If your jacket has hook-and-loop tape, fasten it closed. Don't forget to check the pockets for any treasures or love notes you may have forgotten. Place the jacket in your washing machine.

Lines.Text: add technical wash specifically designed for down garments .
each brand of technical wash is different , so you'll need to read the label on your bottle to know how much to add .

Steps.Text_raw: Add technical wash specifically designed for down garments. Each brand of technical wash is different, so you'll need to read the label on your bottle to know how much to add.

Lines.Text: set the load size on the washing machine to small .
set the water temperature on the washing machine to cold/cold .
run the washing machine on a gentle or normal wash cycle .

Steps.Text_raw: Set the load size on the washing machine to small. Set the water temperature on the washing machine to cold/cold. Run the washing machine on a gentle or normal wash cycle.

Lines.Text: leave the jacket in the washing machine and run the rinse cycle a second time .

Steps.Text_raw: Leave the jacket in the washing machine and run the rinse cycle a second time.

Lines.Text: remove the jacket from the washing machine and place it in the dryer .
if you don't have a dryer , or would like to go a more environmentally friendly route , guide .
add a couple of tennis balls to the dryer .
the tennis balls will bounce around as the dryer tumbles , preventing the down from clumping .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the jacket from the washing machine and place it in the dryer. If you don't have a dryer, or would like to go a more environmentally friendly route, [guide|27465|line dry your jacket]. Add a couple of tennis balls to the dryer. The tennis balls will bounce around as the dryer tumbles, preventing the down from clumping.

Lines.Text: set the dryer on a low-heat setting with a normal dry-cycle time .
start the dryer .
it may take more than one cycle on the dryer to completely dry your jacket . if so , leave the heat on low and dry for a second cycle .

Steps.Text_raw: Set the dryer on a low-heat setting with a normal dry-cycle time. Start the dryer. It may take more than one cycle on the dryer to completely dry your jacket. If so, leave the heat on low and dry for a second cycle.

Lines.Text: position your garment along the clothesline with the bottom edge of the garment facing up .
fold the bottom inch or so of the garment over the line .

Steps.Text_raw: Position your garment along the clothesline with the bottom edge of the garment facing up. Fold the bottom inch or so of the garment over the line.

Lines.Text: grip the ends of a clothespin to hold it open .
position the clothespin over the folded fabric so that the gap in the clothespin sits on the clothesline and the open end pinches the two layers of the garment .
put one clothespin on each side of the garment .

Steps.Text_raw: Grip the ends of a clothespin to hold it open. Position the clothespin over the folded fabric so that the gap in the clothespin sits on the clothesline and the open end pinches the two layers of the garment. Put one clothespin on each side of the garment.

Lines.Text: allow the garment to stay on the clothesline until it is dry .

your clothes can become stiff or crunchy feeling if you leave them on the line too long . instead of adding fabric softener , which is full of chemicals ( not to mention bad for your garments ) , check the clothes regularly to prevent them from over-drying .

Steps.Text_raw: Allow the garment to stay on the clothesline until it is dry. Your clothes can become stiff or crunchy feeling if you leave them on the line too long. Instead of adding fabric softener, which is full of chemicals (not to mention bad for your garments), check the clothes regularly to prevent them from over-drying.

Lines.Text: before disassembling your gear , be sure it is powered off .
to remove each strap , locate the metal latches on both sides of the back of the gear .
press down on the metal latch while pulling the strap away from the gear until it is completely off .

Steps.Text_raw: Before disassembling your Gear, be sure it is powered off. To remove each strap, locate the metal latches on both sides of the back of the Gear. Press down on the metal latch while pulling the strap away from the Gear until it is completely off.

Lines.Text: remove the four 4.0 mm screws on the back of the gear using a t5 torx screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 4.0 mm screws on the back of the Gear using a T5 Torx Screwdriver.

Lines.Text: firmly holding the gear , insert the flat side of the spudger at an angle to pry the back casing off of the device . move the spudger along the sides of the gear to completely detach the back and front components .
pry the device open from the other side also if it does not fully disassemble from one side .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly holding the Gear, insert the flat side of the spudger at an angle to pry the back casing off of the device. Move the spudger along the sides of the Gear to completely detach the back and front components. Pry the device open from the other side also if it does not fully disassemble from one side.

Lines.Text: use tweezers to grab and then gently lift up the metal plate of the safety belt .
when removing the metal plate , be sure to remove them carefully as to not rip the orange tape that is attached to them .
during reassembly , be sure to line up the pins of the metal plate in order to reattach correctly .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers to grab and then gently lift up the metal plate of the safety belt. When removing the metal plate, be sure to remove them carefully as to not rip the orange tape that is attached to them. During reassembly, be sure to line up the pins of the metal plate in order to reattach correctly.

Lines.Text: once the safety belt is removed , use tweezers to take the motherboard out of the gear 2.

Steps.Text_raw: Once the safety belt is removed, use tweezers to take the motherboard out of the Gear 2.

Lines.Text: once the motherboard is out of the way , take your plastic spudger and apply gentle pressure to the back of the lcd . it should pop free at one corner allowing you to work your opening tool between the display and the frame . carefully remove the screen from the frame as you apply slight pressure from the back of the screen .

after separating the screen from the frame , thread the display flex cable back through the opening it is routed through . remove screen . you should end up with the frame and the adhesive ring . ( see photo )
'''note''' be careful not to tear the black adhesive ring on the display .
you will need the original adhesive ring to hold your new screen in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the motherboard is out of the way, take your plastic spudger and apply gentle pressure to the back of the lcd. It should pop free at one corner allowing you to work your opening tool between the display and the frame. Carefully remove the screen from the frame as you apply slight pressure from the back of the screen. After separating the screen from the frame, thread the display flex cable back through the opening it is routed through. Remove screen. You should end up with the frame and the adhesive ring. (see photo) '''NOTE''' Be careful not to tear the black adhesive ring on the display. You will need the original adhesive ring to hold your new screen in place.

Title: Repair a Hole in Patagonia Waders

Lines.Text: set up a ladder in a level place outside that you don't mind getting wet .
turn the waders inside out .
clip the waders to the ladder .

Steps.Text_raw: Set up a ladder in a level place outside that you don't mind getting wet. Turn the waders inside out. Clip the waders to the ladder.

Lines.Text: put the hose into the waders .
slide the hose into one leg of the waders .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the hose into the waders. Slide the hose into one leg of the waders.

Lines.Text: turn on the hose and begin to fill the waders .
be sure to pay attention because the large amount of water may tip the ladder . if needed , weigh the back side of the ladder down to prevent it from tipping .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn on the hose and begin to fill the waders. Be sure to pay attention because the large amount of water may tip the ladder. If needed, weigh the back side of the ladder down to prevent it from tipping.

Lines.Text: watch for leaks . when you find a leak , mark it with a permanent marker .
repeat this process for the other leg , marking all the leaks you find .
dump the water out and allow the waders to dry completely before you continue .

Steps.Text_raw: Watch for leaks. When you find a leak, mark it with a permanent marker. Repeat this process for the other leg, marking all the leaks you find. Dump the water out and allow the waders to dry completely before you continue.

Lines.Text: wipe your marked areas down with an alcohol wipe to clean them .
wait for the area to completely dry before continuing .

Steps.Text_raw: Wipe your marked areas down with an alcohol wipe to clean them. Wait for the area to completely dry before continuing.

Lines.Text: add a drop of seam grip to the marked area .
you need enough seam grip to thinly cover a one-inch square .

Steps.Text_raw: Add a drop of Seam Grip to the marked area. You need enough Seam Grip to thinly cover a one-inch square.

Lines.Text: use the paintbrush to spread the seam grip thinly and evenly over the area .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the paintbrush to spread the Seam Grip thinly and evenly over the area.

Lines.Text: rotate your brush 90 degrees and spread the glue evenly over the area .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate your brush 90 degrees and spread the glue evenly over the area.

Lines.Text: apply the thin film ( included in your wader repair kit ) on top of the seam grip .
smooth out the film with your finger , pushing out any air bubbles .
allow the waders to sit undisturbed for 12 hours .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply the thin film (included in your wader repair kit) on top of the Seam Grip. Smooth out the film with your finger, pushing out any air bubbles. Allow the waders to sit undisturbed for 12 hours.

Lines.Text: peel the thin film off of the waders .

Steps.Text_raw: Peel the thin film off of the waders.

Lines.Text: set up a ladder in a level place outside that you don't mind getting wet .
turn the waders inside out .
clip the waders to the ladder .

Steps.Text_raw: Set up a ladder in a level place outside that you don't mind getting wet. Turn the waders inside out. Clip the waders to the ladder.

Lines.Text: put the hose into the waders .
slide the hose into one leg of the waders .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the hose into the waders. Slide the hose into one leg of the waders.

Lines.Text: turn on the hose and begin to fill the waders .
be sure to pay attention because the large amount of water may tip the ladder . if needed , weigh the back side of the ladder down to prevent it from tipping .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn on the hose and begin to fill the waders. Be sure to pay attention because the large amount of water may tip the ladder. If needed, weigh the back side of the ladder down to prevent it from tipping.

Lines.Text: watch for leaks . when you find a leak , mark it with a permanent marker .
repeat this process for the other leg , marking all the leaks you find .
dump the water out and allow the waders to dry completely before you continue .

Steps.Text_raw: Watch for leaks. When you find a leak, mark it with a permanent marker. Repeat this process for the other leg, marking all the leaks you find. Dump the water out and allow the waders to dry completely before you continue.

Lines.Text: you will need :
cr 2032 battery
phillips 0 screwdriver
something to pop the battery out , like a thin spudger , or a 2 slot screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: You will need: CR 2032 Battery Philips #0 screwdriver Something to pop the battery out, like a thin spudger, or a #2 slot screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove these four screws . they're all the same size .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove these four screws. They're all the same size.

Lines.Text: lift off the case back .

underneath , you'll see a sheet of plastic film . it should be possible to remove the battery without removing the film , if you're careful , but i didn't want to risk bending or tearing the plastic .

if you do take the plastic off , beware of maneuvering it over the three springs in the upper left , and the small prong that sticks out over the battery . you'll need to be sure to arrange the plastic carefully over these obstructions when re-assembling .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift off the case back. Underneath, you'll see a sheet of plastic film. It should be possible to remove the battery without removing the film, if you're careful, but I didn't want to risk bending or tearing the plastic. If you do take the plastic off, beware of maneuvering it over the three springs in the upper left, and the small prong that sticks out over the battery. You'll need to be sure to arrange the plastic carefully over these obstructions when re-assembling.

Lines.Text: insert spudger or flat screwdriver in the notch indicated by the arrow , and lever out the battery .
the new battery should insert the same way the old one came out , and snap into place .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert spudger or flat screwdriver in the notch indicated by the arrow, and lever out the battery. The new battery should insert the same way the old one came out, and snap into place.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four 6.35 mm torx t5 screws securing the backing of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four 6.35 mm Torx T5 screws securing the backing of the watch.

Lines.Text: pull the backing off the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the backing off the watch.

Lines.Text: pull the battery wires out from the motherboard slowly .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the battery wires out from the motherboard slowly.

Lines.Text: unscrew one 4 mm phillips screw that attaches the motherboard using a 000 screwdriver .
lift the motherboard out of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew one 4 mm philips screw that attaches the motherboard using a PH000 screwdriver. Lift the motherboard out of the watch.

Lines.Text: push button in and pinch silver clip with tweezers .
pull silver clip off the pin it is on .
pull out button and replace .

Steps.Text_raw: Push button in and pinch silver clip with tweezers. Pull silver clip off the pin it is on. Pull out button and replace.

Lines.Text: locate corroded contacts on the back side of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate corroded contacts on the back side of the watch.

Lines.Text: wipe both contacts with force using an isopropyl alcohol wipe .

Steps.Text_raw: Wipe both contacts with force using an isopropyl alcohol wipe.

Lines.Text: use a rough brush to scrape the contacts clean .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a rough brush to scrape the contacts clean.

Lines.Text: spring bars attach the two halves of the wristband to the watch body . the spring bar has a shoulder on either end .
be prepared to apply some pressure with your fingers to perform the following action .
first , slide the wristband down on the spring bar to expose the shoulder of the spring bar .
grasp the exposed shoulder with the tweezers to perform the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: Spring bars attach the two halves of the wristband to the watch body. The spring bar has a shoulder on either end. Be prepared to apply some pressure with your fingers to perform the following action. First, slide the wristband down on the spring bar to expose the shoulder of the spring bar. Grasp the exposed shoulder with the tweezers to perform the next step.

Lines.Text: this is a challenging step . do it carefully to prevent the spring bar from flying out of the wristband .
use the tweezer to depress the spring bar so that it collapses by a few millimeters and pops out of the hole that was holding it in place .
now carefully pull the other end of the spring bar to detach the wristband from the watch face .
repeat steps 1 and 2 for the other wristband .

Steps.Text_raw: This is a challenging step. Do it carefully to prevent the spring bar from flying out of the wristband. Use the tweezer to depress the spring bar so that it collapses by a few millimeters and pops out of the hole that was holding it in place. Now carefully pull the other end of the spring bar to detach the wristband from the watch face. Repeat steps 1 and 2 for the other wristband.

Steps.Text_raw: Use the T5 Torx screwdriver to unscrew the four silver 2mm x 3mm T5 screws that hold the back cover in place.

gently pull the two halves apart .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a pair of tweezers to gently lift the metal retaining clip up and out of the way.

Title: Samsung Gear Live Heart Rate Monitor Replacement

Lines.Text: lay the watch face-down on a flat , stable surface .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the watch face-down on a flat, stable surface.

Lines.Text: press the watchband down against the work surface .
press the tip of a flathead screwdriver against the edge of the spring-loaded holding pin .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the watchband down against the work surface. Press the tip of a flathead screwdriver against the edge of the spring-loaded holding pin.

Lines.Text: with the spring-loaded pin pressed in , the watch band should release easily .
gently pull the band away from the body of the watch .
repeat steps 2 and 3 for the opposite side .

Steps.Text_raw: With the spring-loaded pin pressed in, the watch band should release easily. Gently pull the band away from the body of the watch. Repeat steps 2 and 3 for the opposite side.

Lines.Text: with the watch laying face-down , locate the four screws . they are located on the back of the watch , at the four corners .

Steps.Text_raw: With the watch laying face-down, locate the four screws. They are located on the back of the watch, at the four corners.

Lines.Text: using a torx-t5 screwdriver , remove each of the four 4 mm screws and set them aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Torx-T5 screwdriver, remove each of the four 4mm screws and set them aside.

Lines.Text: gently work the plastic opening tool under the top edge of the watchs back cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently work the plastic opening tool under the top edge of the watch’s back cover.

Lines.Text: with the watchs back cover pried loose , gently lift it away from the front half of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: With the watch’s back cover pried loose, gently lift it away from the front half of the watch.

Lines.Text: lay both halves of the watch body assembly face down ( with internal components facing up ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay both halves of the watch body assembly face down (with internal components facing up).

Lines.Text: locate the ribbon cable connector near the edge of the watch's case .
using the plastic opening tool , gently pry the connector from the motherboard

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the ribbon cable connector near the edge of the watch's case. Using the plastic opening tool, gently pry the connector from the motherboard

Lines.Text: using the plastic opening tool , gently pry away the red spacers .
set the spacers aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the plastic opening tool, gently pry away the red spacers. Set the spacers aside.

Lines.Text: insert the end of the plastic opening tool under the motherboard .
gently pry up the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the end of the plastic opening tool under the motherboard. Gently pry up the motherboard.

Lines.Text: set the motherboard on a flat , stable surface .
using the plastic opening tool , gently pry the heart rate sensor cable from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Set the motherboard on a flat, stable surface. Using the plastic opening tool, gently pry the heart rate sensor cable from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: once the cable is disconnected , run the plastic opening tool under the heart rate sensor from all sides , gently prying up as you go along .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the cable is disconnected, run the plastic opening tool under the heart rate sensor from all sides, gently prying up as you go along.

Lines.Text: to avoid burning your hands , make sure to hold only the thin edges of the iopener .
heat the iopener . instructions on how to do this can be found here : guide
firmly press the frame of the band against the iopener , and hold it in place for about 90 seconds .
when using the iopener , make sure to wrap it partially around the sides .

Steps.Text_raw: To avoid burning your hands, make sure to hold only the thin edges of the iOpener. Heat the iOpener. Instructions on how to do this can be found here: [guide|11677|iOpener Instructions] Firmly press the frame of the band against the iOpener, and hold it in place for about 90 seconds. When using the iOpener, make sure to wrap it partially around the sides.

Lines.Text: using a spudger , lightly press upwards against one corner of the frame , then the other along the corner of the short edge .
alternating between the same two corners , continue pressing until there's about a 1-2 mm gap between that end of the frame and the body .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger, lightly press upwards against one corner of the frame, then the other along the corner of the short edge. Alternating between the same two corners, continue pressing until there's about a 1-2 mm gap between that end of the frame and the body.

Lines.Text: do not pull the frame away too quickly . the screen may be stuck to the frame , and pulling on it could cause damage . if the screen is still attached , lightly push on the screen with a finger and it should pop out .
insert the spudger into the gap under the frame , and lightly slide it about 3 /4 of the way down one of the long edges , then repeat with the other .
if the frame doesn't simply pop off , try sliding the spudger the rest of the way down the long edges , and lightly lift the frame with your fingers .
when re-assembling , make sure the frame's microphone hole is on the same side as the sensor board underneath .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not pull the frame away too quickly. The screen may be stuck to the frame, and pulling on it could cause damage. If the screen is still attached, lightly push on the screen with a finger and it should pop out. Insert the spudger into the gap under the frame, and lightly slide it about 3/4 of the way down one of the long edges, then repeat with the other. If the frame doesn't simply pop off, try sliding the spudger the rest of the way down the long edges, and lightly lift the frame with your fingers. When re-assembling, make sure the frame's microphone hole is on the same side as the sensor board underneath.

Title: How to Prevent a Run or Tear in Tights from Spreading

Lines.Text: put the ripped tights on for easier repair , or leave them on if youre already wearing them .
gather clear nail polish and a pair of scissors .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the ripped tights on for easier repair, or leave them on if you’re already wearing them. Gather clear nail polish and a pair of scissors.

Lines.Text: locate all potential runs or directions that the rip can expand .
runs will not usually expand horizontally , but be sure to check both vertical ends of the run .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate all potential runs or directions that the rip can expand. Runs will not usually expand horizontally, but be sure to check both vertical ends of the run.

Lines.Text: gently tug the tights away from your skin to prevent the nail polish from affixing to your body .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently tug the tights away from your skin to prevent the nail polish from affixing to your body.

Lines.Text: brush a dollop of clear nail polish on all potential runs .
small runs will require just a dab of nail polish while larger holes may require a thin coat .
repeat these steps to all potential runs and loose threads .

Steps.Text_raw: Brush a dollop of clear nail polish on all potential runs. Small runs will require just a dab of nail polish while larger holes may require a thin coat. Repeat these steps to all potential runs and loose threads.

Lines.Text: once the nail polish has dried , you may cut any hanging pieces of thread .
the nail polish will take about 1 minute to dry .
be sure to complete this step after applying the nail polish and letting it dry or a new run will form .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the nail polish has dried, you may cut any hanging pieces of thread. The nail polish will take about 1 minute to dry. Be sure to complete this step after applying the nail polish and letting it dry or a new run will form.

Subject: Run or Tear in Tights

Title: How to Hand Sew a Tear in Clothing

Lines.Text: lay out your piece of clothing with the tear facing up and in sight on a flat surface .
a table is a good place for a work surface rather than your lap or the ground .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay out your piece of clothing with the tear facing up and in sight on a flat surface. A table is a good place for a work surface rather than your lap or the ground.

Lines.Text: cut a long piece of thread with the scissors .

cut the length of the thread according to how long the tear is . for a 5 inch tear , cut about a 1.5 foot piece of thread . if you have excess thread at the end of the task , you can always cut the extra off . you cannot do so if you do not have enough thread to finish sewing .
choose thread that matches the color of the material so that the thread blends in with the material , hiding the tear .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut a long piece of thread with the scissors. Cut the length of the thread according to how long the tear is. For a 5 inch tear, cut about a 1.5 foot piece of thread. If you have excess thread at the end of the task, you can always cut the extra off. You cannot do so if you do not have enough thread to finish sewing. Choose thread that matches the color of the material so that the thread blends in with the material, hiding the tear.

Lines.Text: tie a knot at one end of the thread .

Steps.Text_raw: Tie a knot at one end of the thread.

Lines.Text: put the un-knotted end of the thread through the eye of the needle ( the hole in the needle ) .
this step can be frustrating , but be patient . to make it easier , wet the end you are putting through the hole and flatten the thread with your fingers . now try again .
be careful while using the needle . it is pointy and sharp .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the un-knotted end of the thread through the eye of the needle (the hole in the needle). This step can be frustrating, but be patient. To make it easier, wet the end you are putting through the hole and flatten the thread with your fingers. Now try again. Be careful while using the needle. It is pointy and sharp.

Lines.Text: to begin stitching :
take the threaded needle in your fingers and place under one end of the tear with the needle pointing up .
poke the needle through the left side of the tear and pull on the needle upward until the knot reaches the material and stops the thread from going any further upward .

Steps.Text_raw: To begin stitching: Take the threaded needle in your fingers and place under one end of the tear with the needle pointing up. Poke the needle through the left side of the tear and pull on the needle upward until the knot reaches the material and stops the thread from going any further upward.

Lines.Text: turn the needle downward on the right side of the tear , poke a hole making the needle go through the hole with the thread following .
poke hole on the underside of the left side of the tear .
pull the needle slowly until the knot won't allow you to pull anymore .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the needle downward on the right side of the tear, poke a hole making the needle go through the hole with the thread following. Poke hole on the underside of the left side of the tear. Pull the needle slowly until the knot won't allow you to pull anymore.

Lines.Text: continue to stitch until the needle reaches the other end of the tear , making sure that the stitches are close enough together that the material from one end of the tear and the other end are sewn tightly together with little to no gaps .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue to stitch until the needle reaches the other end of the tear, making sure that the stitches are close enough together that the material from one end of the tear and the other end are sewn tightly together with little to no gaps.

Lines.Text: when you get to the end of the tear , prepare to make a knot .
make a small stitch but this time pull the needle upward through the loop formed and pull up until the loop closes . do at least twice .

Steps.Text_raw: When you get to the end of the tear, prepare to make a knot. Make a small stitch but this time pull the needle upward through the loop formed and pull up until the loop closes. Do at least twice.

Lines.Text: cut the leftover thread off with the scissors so you are left with about an inch of thread dangling after the knot .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut the leftover thread off with the scissors so you are left with about an inch of thread dangling after the knot.

Lines.Text: your tear is now sewn together !

Steps.Text_raw: Your tear is now sewn together!

heat the iopener . instructions on how to do this can be found here : guide
firmly press the frame of the band against the iopener , and hold it in place for about 90 seconds .
when using the iopener , make sure to wrap it partially around the sides .

alternating between the same two corners , continue pressing until there's about a 1-2 mm gap between that end of the frame and the body .

insert the spudger into the gap under the frame , and lightly slide it about 3 /4 of the way down one of the long edges , then repeat with the other .
if the frame doesn't simply pop off , try sliding the spudger the rest of the way down the long edges , and lightly lift the frame with your fingers .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not pull the frame away too quickly. The screen may be stuck to the frame, and pulling on it could cause damage. Lines.Text: do not rip the yellow ribbon cable from the motherboard .
gently lift the lcd screen from the components using your fingertips .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not rip the yellow ribbon cable from the motherboard. Gently lift the LCD screen from the components using your fingertips.

Lines.Text: lightly pry up the black connector from the motherboard using a spudger .
pull the entire lcd screen gently upward to detach the yellow ribbon cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Lightly pry up the black connector from the motherboard using a spudger. Pull the entire LCD screen gently upward to detach the yellow ribbon cable.

Lines.Text: using the spudger or the plastic opening tool , gently lift the sensor ribbon .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the spudger or the plastic opening tool, gently lift the sensor ribbon.

Lines.Text: using the spudger or the tweezers , gently detach the golden connector from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the spudger or the tweezers, gently detach the golden connector from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: using the t3 torx screwdriver , remove the two 2 mm t3 screws .
when you are reassembling , lift the sensor ribbon so that it's not in the way .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the T3 Torx screwdriver, remove the two 2 mm T3 screws. When you are reassembling, lift the sensor ribbon so that it's not in the way.

Lines.Text: be gentle . make sure not to rip apart the cord underneath that connects the heart-rate monitor to the motherboard .
using the spudger and your fingers , gently lift the motherboard from the band socket .
you should feel a pop .

Steps.Text_raw: Be gentle. Make sure not to rip apart the cord underneath that connects the heart-rate monitor to the motherboard. Using the spudger and your fingers, gently lift the motherboard from the band socket. You should feel a "pop."

Lines.Text: gently flip the motherboard so that you are viewing the motherboard from underneath .
using the tweezers , gently detach the golden connector from the back of the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently flip the motherboard so that you are viewing the motherboard from underneath. Using the tweezers, gently detach the golden connector from the back of the motherboard.

Lines.Text: uncoil the wire coat hanger into a straight line .

Steps.Text_raw: Uncoil the wire coat hanger into a straight line.

Lines.Text: tape the end of the uncoiled coat hanger to one end of your sweatshirt string .
make sure the clothes hanger is securely taped to ensure that the string doesn't detach during the re-stringing process .
when taping , make sure no adhesive is felt over the outside of the apparatus . this will make the re-stringing process easier because the tape won't be sticking to the sweatshirt .

Steps.Text_raw: Tape the end of the uncoiled coat hanger to one end of your sweatshirt string. Make sure the clothes hanger is securely taped to ensure that the string doesn't detach during the re-stringing process. When taping, make sure no adhesive is felt over the outside of the apparatus. This will make the re-stringing process easier because the tape won't be sticking to the sweatshirt.

Lines.Text: insert the wire and string apparatus into the left opening of the hoodie .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the wire and string apparatus into the left opening of the hoodie.

Lines.Text: feed the wire through the hoodie until it reaches the top of the hood .

Steps.Text_raw: Feed the wire through the hoodie until it reaches the top of the hood.

Lines.Text: curve the wire to the right so that the wire can follow the curve of the hood .

Steps.Text_raw: Curve the wire to the right so that the wire can follow the curve of the hood.

Lines.Text: continue feeding the wire through the hood towards the other opening of the hoodie .
pull the wire and string out of the opening .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue feeding the wire through the hood towards the other opening of the hoodie. Pull the wire and string out of the opening.

Lines.Text: remove the tape from the end of the wire and string .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the tape from the end of the wire and string.

Lines.Text: remove the wire from the hoodie by pushing the left end of the wire through the hoodie , while pulling the right end out .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the wire from the hoodie by pushing the left end of the wire through the hoodie, while pulling the right end out.

Lines.Text: tie each end of the string in a knot to prevent the string from coming out of the hoodie .

Steps.Text_raw: Tie each end of the string in a knot to prevent the string from coming out of the hoodie.

place the heated guide on the face of the rear cover to loosen the adhesive underneath .

then continue with step 5. or don't use needles and just continue with the next steps .

the rear cover is extremely fragile . be very delicate when using the opening pick .
work your way entirely around the rear cover .
it may take several attempts of reheating the adhesive to get the rear cover loose enough to pull off .

the o-ring is delicate and is easily severed . use care around sharp objects .

place the guide on the face of the device screen .

work your way around the face of the screen , loosening the adhesive .

Lines.Text: once the battery is separate from the back of the battery casing , disconnect the red and black wire by prying or pulling it straight up from the board ( perpendicular to the board surface ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the battery is separate from the back of the battery casing, disconnect the red and black wire by prying or pulling it straight up from the board (perpendicular to the board surface).

Lines.Text: unscrew both side panel 2 mm screws using the t3 torx screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew both side panel 2mm screws using the T3 Torx screwdriver.

Lines.Text: firmly pry up the side panel using the plastic spudger to break the waterproof seal and lift the battery panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly pry up the side panel using the plastic spudger to break the waterproof seal and lift the battery panel.

Lines.Text: gently pry up one edge of the battery with the plastic spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pry up one edge of the battery with the plastic spudger.

Lines.Text: remove battery from its compartment with your fingers .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove battery from its compartment with your fingers.

Title: How To Dye Faded Canvas Shoes

Lines.Text: mix a few drops of detergent with water in the bucket . you should add about 3 drops of detergent for every 10 oz of water .
do not add too much detergent . if the solution becomes too bubbly or overly soapy , there is too much detergent in the solution .

Steps.Text_raw: Mix a few drops of detergent with water in the bucket. You should add about 3 drops of detergent for every 10 oz of water. Do not add too much detergent. If the solution becomes too bubbly or overly soapy, there is too much detergent in the solution.

Lines.Text: dip entire scrubbing device ( toothbrush or sponge ) into solution .
lightly scrub the faded material with the scrubbing device .
be gentle . do not scrub too hard . this will damage the suede shoe .

Steps.Text_raw: Dip entire scrubbing device (toothbrush or sponge) into solution. Lightly scrub the faded material with the scrubbing device. Be gentle. Do not scrub too hard. This will damage the suede shoe.

Lines.Text: lightly tap the faded canvas carefully with a towel or paper towel to dry it
again , be gentle with the material so you do not damage it .
leave the shoe out to air dry . it should take about 1-2 hours to completely dry .

Steps.Text_raw: Lightly tap the faded canvas carefully with a towel or paper towel to dry it Again, be gentle with the material so you do not damage it. Leave the shoe out to air dry. It should take about 1-2 hours to completely dry.

Lines.Text: dip the utensil into the dye . completely cover the utensil in dye .

Steps.Text_raw: Dip the utensil into the dye. Completely cover the utensil in dye.

Lines.Text: apply the dye to the faded area of the shoe .
apply lightly over the entire surface of faded area in a circular motion .
be careful not to get any dye on your skin .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply the dye to the faded area of the shoe. Apply lightly over the entire surface of faded area in a circular motion. Be careful not to get any dye on your skin.

Lines.Text: allow the dye to dry .
refer to the canvas dye directions for drying time . it should take about 1-2 hours to be completely dry .

Steps.Text_raw: Allow the dye to dry. Refer to the canvas dye directions for drying time. It should take about 1-2 hours to be completely dry.

Lines.Text: cut of the excess frayed shoelace .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut of the excess frayed shoelace.

Lines.Text: slip the entire heat shrink tube over the frayed part of the lace .
make sure to clump the frayed part of the lace together when inserting the tubing .
do not cover too much of the lace that is not frayed with tubing as that could result in unwanted indents in the shoelace .

Steps.Text_raw: Slip the entire heat shrink tube over the frayed part of the lace. Make sure to clump the frayed part of the lace together when inserting the tubing. Do not cover too much of the lace that is not frayed with tubing as that could result in unwanted indents in the shoelace.

Lines.Text: after slipping the tube on , grab the scissors and trim the excess tubing to the length of your satisfaction .
remember not to go beyond the frayed part of the lace with tubing .

Steps.Text_raw: After slipping the tube on, grab the scissors and trim the excess tubing to the length of your satisfaction. Remember not to go beyond the frayed part of the lace with tubing.

Lines.Text: now use the lighter and heat the heat shrink tube , about an inch away from the lace , until the tube becomes compressed all the way around .
make sure to heat the heat shrink tube all the way around , heating the entire tube
when heating , always keep moving the lighter all around and not staying on one part of the tube for too long .

Steps.Text_raw: Now use the lighter and heat the heat shrink tube, about an inch away from the lace, until the tube becomes compressed all the way around. Make sure to heat the heat shrink tube all the way around, heating the entire tube When heating, always keep moving the lighter all around and not staying on one part of the tube for too long.

Lines.Text: repeat these steps on all the other frayed shoelaces .

Steps.Text_raw: Repeat these steps on all the other frayed shoelaces.

Title: How To Fix a Hole in the Sole of a Shoe

Lines.Text: to begin , clean the adidas gazelles with some water on a towel .
be careful not to use too much water or you could further damage your shoes .

Steps.Text_raw: To begin, clean the Adidas Gazelles with some  water on a  towel. Be careful not to use too much water or you could further damage your shoes.

Lines.Text: carefully use the utility knife to free the hole of any excess material .
make sure and clear the gazelles of any debris that that could be stuck under the loose squares of the sole .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully use the utility knife to free the hole of any excess material. Make sure and clear the Gazelles of any debris that that could be stuck under the loose squares of the sole.

Lines.Text: use 100 grit sandpaper to roughen the inside surface of the hole .
this will help the shoe goo grip the surface of the shoe , and produce a more lasting fix .

Steps.Text_raw: Use 100 grit sandpaper to roughen the inside surface of the hole. This will help the shoe goo grip the surface of the shoe, and produce a more lasting fix.

Lines.Text: apply shoe goo to the inside of the hole in the sole of your adidas gazelles .
make sure to apply evenly to avoid making your gazelles off balance .
if there is anywhere else on your gazelle's sole that could use additional protection , apply shoe goo to those surfaces as well .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply shoe goo to the inside of the hole in the sole of your Adidas Gazelles. Make sure to apply evenly to avoid making your Gazelles off balance. If there is anywhere else on your Gazelle's sole that could use additional protection, apply shoe goo to those surfaces as well.

Lines.Text: take your putty knife and smooth the shoe goo flush to the surface of the sole .
try to spread the shoe goo in one direction to increase surface smoothness .

Steps.Text_raw: Take your putty knife and smooth the shoe goo flush to the surface of the sole. Try to spread the shoe goo in one direction to increase surface smoothness.

Lines.Text: now place your gazelles in a safe and clean place to dry for 24 hours .

Steps.Text_raw: Now place your Gazelles in a safe and clean place to dry for 24 hours.

Lines.Text: after 24 hours , use 150 grit sandpaper to rub down the surface of your filled hole to create a smooth surface .

Steps.Text_raw: After 24 hours, use 150 grit sandpaper to rub down the surface of your filled hole to create a smooth surface.

Title: How to Fix a Broken Necklace

Lines.Text: lay your chain necklace flat on the table from one end to another .
this way the chain will not get tangled up .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay your chain necklace flat on the table from one end to another. This way the chain will not get tangled up.

Lines.Text: grab one end of your chain necklace and place the pliers on the right of the small opening on the chain .
be very careful that you do not hurt yourself with the pliers or the end of the metal chain .
keep your hand a few centimeters lower than the opening of the chain .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab one end of your chain necklace and place the pliers on the right of the small opening on the chain. Be very careful that you do not hurt yourself with the pliers or the end of the metal chain. Keep your hand a few centimeters lower than the opening of the chain.

Lines.Text: using your pliers , pull down slightly as to make the gap in the chain larger .
this opens up the chain allowing you to work with it easily .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your pliers, pull down slightly as to make the gap in the chain larger. This opens up the chain allowing you to work with it easily.

Lines.Text: do the same thing with the chain on the opposite side .

Steps.Text_raw: Do the same thing with the chain on the opposite side.

Lines.Text: grab both ends of the chain and hook them together .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab both ends of the chain and hook them together.

Lines.Text: once they're hooked together , grab the pliers and place them on the right side of one of the chains .
using the pliers , push the chain back to its original position .

Steps.Text_raw: Once they're hooked together, grab the pliers and place them on the right side of one of the chains. Using the pliers, push the chain back to its original position.

Lines.Text: do the same thing on the other chain to close it all together .

Steps.Text_raw: Do the same thing on the other chain to close it all together.

Lines.Text: the jewelry piece should now be good as new .

Steps.Text_raw: The jewelry piece should now be good as new.

Title: How to Repair Scratched Eyeglass Lenses

Lines.Text: place the eyeglasses , wax , and cloth on a flat surface .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the eyeglasses, wax, and cloth on a flat surface.

Lines.Text: remove any dirt or debris stuck to the lenses with a soft cleaning cloth .
clean glasses gently ; using excessive force can grind dirt into lenses and cause more scratches .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove any dirt or debris stuck to the lenses with a soft cleaning cloth. Clean glasses gently; using excessive force can grind dirt into lenses and cause more scratches.

Lines.Text: dab some vehicle wax on the scratched area of the lens .

Steps.Text_raw: Dab some vehicle wax on the scratched area of the lens.

Lines.Text: buff wax into lens with a lint-free cloth using small , circular motions until the scratch is gone . this can take up to 5 minutes .
for especially deep scratches , you may need to re-apply wax and buff multiple times .
you may need multiple cloths , as the wax sticks to the cloth easily .

Steps.Text_raw: Buff wax into lens with a lint-free cloth using small, circular motions until the scratch is gone. This can take up to 5 minutes. For especially deep scratches, you may need to re-apply wax and buff multiple times. You may need multiple cloths, as the wax sticks to the cloth easily.

Lines.Text: using lukewarm water , rinse off glasses for 10-15 seconds to remove any additional wax .
to dry off glasses and remove any remaining wax on the lenses , wipe them off using a clean cloth .

Steps.Text_raw: Using lukewarm water, rinse off glasses for 10-15 seconds to remove any additional wax. To dry off glasses and remove any remaining wax on the lenses, wipe them off using a clean cloth.

Lines.Text: measure out two feet of thread and cut it .

Steps.Text_raw: Measure out two feet of thread and cut it.

Lines.Text: the needle is sharp . be careful when working .
put the thread through the eye of the needle .
pull the thread through so that both ends are even .
tie both strings into a knot , closing the loop

Steps.Text_raw: The needle is sharp. Be careful when working. Put the thread through the eye of the needle. Pull the thread through so that both ends are even. Tie both strings into a knot, closing the loop

Lines.Text: begin sewing by putting the needle through the back of the fabric , out to the front , and through a hole in the button .
make sure the button is facing the correct direction .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin sewing by putting the needle through the back of the fabric, out to the front, and through a hole in the button. Make sure the button is facing the correct direction.

Lines.Text: put the needle through the hole diagonal and feed through to the back of the shirt
repeat this process for the other diagonal .
repeat the process of sewing through the diagonals multiple times .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the needle through the hole diagonal and feed through to the back of the shirt Repeat this process for the other diagonal. Repeat the process of sewing through the diagonals multiple times.

Lines.Text: when there is about 4 inches of thread yet , push the thread so that it is on the back side of the fabric .
then push the needle back through making sure to not go through the button again .

Steps.Text_raw: When there is about 4 inches of thread yet, push the thread so that it is on the back side of the fabric. Then push the needle back through making sure to not go through the button again.

Lines.Text: wrap the thread around the button 4-6 times .

Steps.Text_raw: Wrap the thread around the button 4-6 times.

Lines.Text: push the thread back through to the back side of the fabric .
tie the knot off and cut .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the thread back through to the back side of the fabric. Tie the knot off and cut.

Lines.Text: we recommend that you clean your microwave before proceeding , as any nasty gunk on the bottom may end up stuck to the iopener .
place the iopener in the center of the microwave .
for carousel microwaves : make sure the plate spins freely . if your iopener gets stuck , it may overheat and burn .

Steps.Text_raw: We recommend that you clean your microwave before proceeding, as any nasty gunk on the bottom may end up stuck to the iOpener. Place the iOpener in the center of the microwave. For carousel microwaves: Make sure the plate spins freely. If your iOpener gets stuck, it may overheat and burn.

Lines.Text: heat the iopener for '''thirty seconds''' .
throughout the repair procedure , as the iopener cools , reheat it in the microwave for an additional thirty seconds at a time .
be careful not to overheat the iopener during the repair . overheating may cause the iopener to burst .
never touch the iopener if it appears swollen .

if the iopener is still too hot in the middle to touch , continue using it while waiting for it to cool down some more before reheating . a properly heated iopener should stay warm for up to 10 minutes .

Steps.Text_raw: Heat the iOpener for '''thirty seconds'''. Throughout the repair procedure, as the iOpener cools, reheat it in the microwave for an additional thirty seconds at a time. Be careful not to overheat the iOpener during the repair. Overheating may cause the iOpener to burst. Never touch the iOpener if it appears swollen. If the iOpener is still too hot in the middle to touch, continue using it while waiting for it to cool down some more before reheating. A properly heated iOpener should stay warm for up to 10 minutes.

Lines.Text: remove the iopener from the microwave , holding it by one of the two flat ends to avoid the hot center .
the iopener will be very hot , so be careful when handling it . use an oven mitt if necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the iOpener from the microwave, holding it by one of the two flat ends to avoid the hot center. The iOpener will be very hot, so be careful when handling it. Use an oven mitt if necessary.

Lines.Text: place the heated iopener on the face of the watch .
leave the iopener on the watch for at least a minute to heat the screen and soften the adhesive holding it to the case .
you may need to reheat the iopener , or move it around on the screen as sections cool , to heat the screen enough to pry it off .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the heated iOpener on the face of the watch. Leave the iOpener on the watch for at least a minute to heat the screen and soften the adhesive holding it to the case. You may need to reheat the iOpener, or move it around on the screen as sections cool, to heat the screen enough to pry it off.

Lines.Text: because the gap between the screen and watch body is so thin , a sharp blade is required to separate the two . '''read the following warnings carefully before proceeding . '''
always '''keep your fingers completely clear''' of the knife .
be careful '''not to apply too much pressure , ''' as this might cause the knife to slip and cut you , or damage the watch .
'''wear eye protection . ''' the knife or glass may break , sending pieces flying .

Steps.Text_raw: Because the gap between the screen and watch body is so thin, a sharp blade is required to separate the two. '''Read the following warnings carefully before proceeding.''' Always '''keep your fingers completely clear''' of the knife. Be careful '''not to apply too much pressure,''' as this might cause the knife to slip and cut you, or damage the watch. '''Wear eye protection.''' The knife or glass may break, sending pieces flying.

Lines.Text: using a curved blade minimizes the chance of scratching the case or cracking the glass . only pry with the curved section of the blade , and not the tip or flat section .
place the curved section of the blade in the gap between the glass and case on the lower edge of the watch face , and press firmly down into the gap .
be very careful to maintain complete control over the knifeonce the gap opens , if you're pressing too hard on the knife it may slip in and cut the battery .
this should wedge the gap open and cause the glass to lift slightly up from the case .
when the glass has lifted , gently rotate the knife down , opening the gap more by pushing the glass up .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a curved blade minimizes the chance of scratching the case or cracking the glass. Only pry with the curved section of the blade, and not the tip or flat section. Place the curved section of the blade in the gap between the glass and case on the lower edge of the watch face, and press firmly down into the gap. Be very careful to maintain complete control over the knife—once the gap opens, if you're pressing too hard on the knife it may slip in and cut the battery. This should wedge the gap open and cause the glass to lift slightly up from the case. When the glass has lifted, gently rotate the knife down, opening the gap more by pushing the glass up.

Lines.Text: once you've opened the gap enough , insert the tip of an opening pick under the glass .
slide the pick along the bottom edge to separate adhesive holding the screen to the case .
be careful not to insert the opening pick too far . only about 1 /8 ( about 3 mm ) is necessary , any deeper and you may damage cables .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you've opened the gap enough, insert the tip of an opening pick under the glass. Slide the pick along the bottom edge to separate adhesive holding the screen to the case. Be careful not to insert the opening pick too far. Only about 1/8" ( about 3 mm) is necessary, any deeper and you may damage cables.

Lines.Text: roll the opening pick up the side of the button side of the watch , gently pushing in to separate the adhesive and widening the gap as you go .
remember not to push the pick in too farit's easier to avoid this by rolling the pick , rather than dragging a tip along .

Steps.Text_raw: Roll the opening pick up the side of the button side of the watch, gently pushing in to separate the adhesive and widening the gap as you go. Remember not to push the pick in too far—it's easier to avoid this by rolling the pick, rather than dragging a tip along.

Lines.Text: work the pick around the top right corner , and roll it along the top edge of the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Work the pick around the top right corner, and roll it along the top edge of the screen.

Lines.Text: continue working the pick around the perimeter of the screen , rolling down along the left side to cut the last of the adhesive .
leave the pick in place to keep the adhesive from resealing the screen in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue working the pick around the perimeter of the screen, rolling down along the left side to cut the last of the adhesive. Leave the pick in place to keep the adhesive from resealing the screen in place.

Lines.Text: while holding the first pick in place , use a second to check that all of the adhesive is separated around the entire perimeter of the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: While holding the first pick in place, use a second to check that all of the adhesive is separated around the entire perimeter of the screen.

Lines.Text: there are two cables connecting the screen to the inside of the watch , near the top left corner . be careful when prying or you may damage these cables .
pry slightly up on the right side of the screen , to free it from any remaining adhesive .
pry up on the left to free it as wellbut '''do not attempt to remove the screen''' as it is still held in place by two cables .

Steps.Text_raw: There are two cables connecting the screen to the inside of the watch, near the top left corner. Be careful when prying or you may damage these cables. Pry slightly up on the right side of the screen, to free it from any remaining adhesive. Pry up on the left to free it as well—but '''do not attempt to remove the screen''' as it is still held in place by two cables.

Lines.Text: if you can see the top layer of your force touch sensor among the display adhesive , it means the two layers of the sensor separated and you're going to need to replace or repair it .
the top layer of the sensor may be adhered to the back of the screenpush it down to separate it , and '''switch to our guide from this point on . '''

Steps.Text_raw: If you can see the top layer of your Force Touch sensor among the display adhesive, it means the two layers of the sensor separated and you're going to need to replace or repair it. The top layer of the sensor may be adhered to the back of the screen—push it down to separate it, and '''switch to our [guide|41084|Force Touch Sensor guide] from this point on.'''

Lines.Text: lift the screen up and shift it to the left , minding the display data and digitizer cables .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the screen up and shift it to the left, minding the display data and digitizer cables.

Lines.Text: place the watch on an elevated surface , at least 1 /2 or 1 cm talla small box or the edge of a book will work great . this will allow the screen to hang down vertically and give better access to the battery .
be careful not to bump the screen or strain the cables while you work .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the watch on an elevated surface, at least 1/2" or 1 cm tall—a small box or the edge of a book will work great. This will allow the screen to hang down vertically and give better access to the battery. Be careful not to bump the screen or strain the cables while you work.

Lines.Text: wedge a plastic opening tool between the right side of the battery and the case .
pry the battery up to separate it from the adhesive securing it to the system board .
'''do not''' attempt to remove the battery as it is still connected .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge a plastic opening tool between the right side of the battery and the case. Pry the battery up to separate it from the adhesive securing it to the system board. '''Do not''' attempt to remove the battery as it is still connected.

Lines.Text: rotate the battery counterclockwise to expose its connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the battery counterclockwise to expose its connector.

Lines.Text: hold the battery up and out of the way , to expose the battery cable connector .
use a plastic opening tool , prying against the bottom of the case to separate the battery cable connector from the watch's battery cable .
remove the battery from the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Hold the battery up and out of the way, to expose the battery cable connector. Use a plastic opening tool, prying against the bottom of the case to separate the battery cable connector from the watch's battery cable. Remove the battery from the watch.

place the iopener in the center of the microwave .
for carousel microwaves : make sure the plate spins freely . if your iopener gets stuck , it may overheat and burn .
