Steps.Text_raw: If you can see the top layer of your Force Touch sensor among the display adhesive, it means the two layers of the sensor separated and you're going to need to replace or repair it. The top layer of the sensor may be adhered to the back of the screen—push it down to separate it, and '''switch to our [guide|41084|Force Touch Sensor guide] from this point on.'''

Lines.Text: lift the screen up and shift it to the left , minding the display data and digitizer cables .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the screen up and shift it to the left, minding the display data and digitizer cables.

Lines.Text: place the watch on an elevated surface , at least 1 /2 or 1 cm talla small box or the edge of a book will work great . this will allow the screen to hang down vertically and give better access to the battery .
be careful not to bump the screen or strain the cables while you work .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the watch on an elevated surface, at least 1/2" or 1 cm tall—a small box or the edge of a book will work great. This will allow the screen to hang down vertically and give better access to the battery. Be careful not to bump the screen or strain the cables while you work.

Lines.Text: wedge a plastic opening tool between the right side of the battery and the case .
pry the battery up to separate it from the adhesive securing it to the system board .
'''do not''' attempt to remove the battery as it is still connected .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge a plastic opening tool between the right side of the battery and the case. Pry the battery up to separate it from the adhesive securing it to the system board. '''Do not''' attempt to remove the battery as it is still connected.

Lines.Text: rotate the battery counterclockwise to expose its connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the battery counterclockwise to expose its connector.

Lines.Text: hold the battery up and out of the way , to expose the battery cable connector .
use a plastic opening tool , prying against the bottom of the case to separate the battery cable connector from the watch's battery cable .
remove the battery from the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Hold the battery up and out of the way, to expose the battery cable connector. Use a plastic opening tool, prying against the bottom of the case to separate the battery cable connector from the watch's battery cable. Remove the battery from the watch.

Lines.Text: fold the screen up and over to the right , to expose the cables underneath .

Steps.Text_raw: Fold the screen up and over to the right, to expose the cables underneath.

Lines.Text: the display and digitizer cable connectors are secured beneath a small metal bracket that is adhered to the speaker .
use a plastic opening tool to flip the bracket toward the display and up from the speaker .
if you simply pry toward the watch band you may tear the cables .

Steps.Text_raw: The display and digitizer cable connectors are secured beneath a small metal bracket that is adhered to the speaker. Use a plastic opening tool to flip the bracket toward the display and up from the speaker. If you simply pry toward the watch band you may tear the cables.

Lines.Text: the bracket that contains the display and digitizer cable connections is made up of an upper and lower piece . the connectors are secured to the lower , and the upper must be removed to disconnect them .
use fine-tipped tweezers to grasp the lower half of the bracket .
there is a small metal tab that protrudes downward from the upper metal bracket .
insert a small ( 1 mm ) flathead screwdriver between the tab and the lower bracket , and rotate the screwdriver to spread the gap .
this will release two tabs that hold the upper bracket to the lower , and should free the upper bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: The bracket that contains the display and digitizer cable connections is made up of an upper and lower piece. The connectors are secured to the lower, and the upper must be removed to disconnect them. Use fine-tipped tweezers to grasp the lower half of the bracket. There is a small metal tab that protrudes downward from the upper metal bracket. Insert a small (1 mm) flathead screwdriver between the tab and the lower bracket, and rotate the screwdriver to spread the gap. This will release two tabs that hold the upper bracket to the lower, and should free the upper bracket.

Lines.Text: the upper half of the display connector bracket is held at the upper end by a metal tab that fits into a slot in the lower bracket .
grab the upper bracket with your tweezers and slide it toward the top of the watch to disengage this tab and free the bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: The upper half of the display connector bracket is held at the upper end by a metal tab that fits into a slot in the lower bracket. Grab the upper bracket with your tweezers and slide it toward the top of the watch to disengage this tab and free the bracket.

Lines.Text: disconnect the display data and digitizer cables .
be careful not to touch any of the contacts directly , as your finger oils may impede connectivity .
remove the display .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the display data and digitizer cables. Be careful not to touch any of the contacts directly, as your finger oils may impede connectivity. Remove the display.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to scrape adhesive off the back of the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to scrape adhesive off the back of the screen.

Lines.Text: you may be able to peel up the adhesive with tweezers .
once you have all of the pieces of adhesive removed , you may want to use an alcohol soaked q-tip to clean any residue off the back of the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: You may be able to peel up the adhesive with tweezers. Once you have all of the pieces of adhesive removed, you may want to use an alcohol soaked q-tip to clean any residue off the back of the screen.

Lines.Text: use tweezers to peel the outer ring off of one of the adhesive strip pads .
be sure to get both the double-sided adhesive and the brown backing paper .
be very careful not to fold , bend , or stretch the adhesive tape , as this will make it too thick to seal the screen without a ridge between the screen and the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers to peel the outer ring off of one of the adhesive strip pads. Be sure to get both the double-sided adhesive and the brown backing paper. Be very careful not to fold, bend, or stretch the adhesive tape, as this will make it too thick to seal the screen without a ridge between the screen and the case.

Lines.Text: lay the backed adhesive tape down on the force touch sensor , around the edge of the case where the screen rests .
start in a corner with the tape as close to the corner wall as possible .
press on the brown backing paper with a plastic opening tool to secure the adhesive around the entire perimeter .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the backed adhesive tape down on the Force Touch sensor, around the edge of the case where the screen rests. Start in a corner with the tape as close to the corner wall as possible. Press on the brown backing paper with a plastic opening tool to secure the adhesive around the entire perimeter.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to reconnect the display data and digitizer cable connectors .
be careful not to touch any of the contacts directly , as your finger oils may impede connectivity .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to reconnect the display data and digitizer cable connectors. Be careful not to touch any of the contacts directly, as your finger oils may impede connectivity.

Lines.Text: to reinstall the metal bracket , line up the single tab with the slot in the top of the lower half , and slide the bracket down .
snap the upper bracket in place .

Steps.Text_raw: To reinstall the metal bracket, line up the single tab with the slot in the top of the lower half, and slide the bracket down. Snap the upper bracket in place.

Lines.Text: line the battery connector up with its mate on the cable inside the watch body .
use tweezers to press the two connectors together .

Steps.Text_raw: Line the battery connector up with its mate on the cable inside the watch body. Use tweezers to press the two connectors together.

Lines.Text: rotate the battery down into its slot , and press it into position .
press the battery down against the s1 to re-adhere it in place .
now is the best time to test powering on your watchif it doesn't turn on , double check all three connectors and try again .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the battery down into its slot, and press it into position. Press the battery down against the S1 to re-adhere it in place. Now is the best time to test powering on your watch—if it doesn't turn on, double check all three connectors and try again.

Lines.Text: use tweezers to peel off the adhesive backing strip .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers to peel off the adhesive backing strip.

Lines.Text: move the screen back to the right , folding the display data and digitizer cables neatly .
center the screen over the case and press it down firmly onto the adhesive .

Steps.Text_raw: Move the screen back to the right, folding the display data and digitizer cables neatly. Center the screen over the case and press it down firmly onto the adhesive.

Title: Apple Watch Force Touch Sensor Replacement

Lines.Text: we recommend that you clean your microwave before proceeding , as any nasty gunk on the bottom may end up stuck to the iopener .
place the iopener in the center of the microwave .
for carousel microwaves : make sure the plate spins freely . if your iopener gets stuck , it may overheat and burn .

Steps.Text_raw: We recommend that you clean your microwave before proceeding, as any nasty gunk on the bottom may end up stuck to the iOpener. Place the iOpener in the center of the microwave. For carousel microwaves: Make sure the plate spins freely. If your iOpener gets stuck, it may overheat and burn.

Lines.Text: heat the iopener for '''thirty seconds''' .
throughout the repair procedure , as the iopener cools , reheat it in the microwave for an additional thirty seconds at a time .
be careful not to overheat the iopener during the repair . overheating may cause the iopener to burst .
never touch the iopener if it appears swollen .

if the iopener is still too hot in the middle to touch , continue using it while waiting for it to cool down some more before reheating . a properly heated iopener should stay warm for up to 10 minutes .

Steps.Text_raw: Heat the iOpener for '''thirty seconds'''. Throughout the repair procedure, as the iOpener cools, reheat it in the microwave for an additional thirty seconds at a time. Be careful not to overheat the iOpener during the repair. Overheating may cause the iOpener to burst. Never touch the iOpener if it appears swollen. If the iOpener is still too hot in the middle to touch, continue using it while waiting for it to cool down some more before reheating. A properly heated iOpener should stay warm for up to 10 minutes.

Lines.Text: remove the iopener from the microwave , holding it by one of the two flat ends to avoid the hot center .
the iopener will be very hot , so be careful when handling it . use an oven mitt if necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the iOpener from the microwave, holding it by one of the two flat ends to avoid the hot center. The iOpener will be very hot, so be careful when handling it. Use an oven mitt if necessary.

Lines.Text: place the heated iopener on the face of the watch .
leave the iopener on the watch for at least a minute to heat the screen and soften the adhesive holding it to the case .
you may need to reheat the iopener , or move it around on the screen as sections cool , to heat the screen enough to pry it off .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the heated iOpener on the face of the watch. Leave the iOpener on the watch for at least a minute to heat the screen and soften the adhesive holding it to the case. You may need to reheat the iOpener, or move it around on the screen as sections cool, to heat the screen enough to pry it off.

Lines.Text: because the gap between the screen and watch body is so thin , a sharp blade is required to separate the two . '''read the following warnings carefully before proceeding . '''
always '''keep your fingers completely clear''' of the knife .
be careful '''not to apply too much pressure , ''' as this might cause the knife to slip and cut you , or damage the watch .
'''wear eye protection . ''' the knife or glass may break , sending pieces flying .

Steps.Text_raw: Because the gap between the screen and watch body is so thin, a sharp blade is required to separate the two. '''Read the following warnings carefully before proceeding.''' Always '''keep your fingers completely clear''' of the knife. Be careful '''not to apply too much pressure,''' as this might cause the knife to slip and cut you, or damage the watch. '''Wear eye protection.''' The knife or glass may break, sending pieces flying.

Lines.Text: using a curved blade minimizes the chance of scratching the case or cracking the glass . only pry with the curved section of the blade , and not the tip or flat section .
place the curved section of the blade in the gap between the glass and case on the lower edge of the watch face , and press firmly down into the gap .
be very careful to maintain complete control over the knifeonce the gap opens , if you're pressing too hard on the knife it may slip in and cut the battery .
this should wedge the gap open and cause the glass to lift slightly up from the case .
when the glass has lifted , gently rotate the knife down , opening the gap more by pushing the glass up .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a curved blade minimizes the chance of scratching the case or cracking the glass. Only pry with the curved section of the blade, and not the tip or flat section. Place the curved section of the blade in the gap between the glass and case on the lower edge of the watch face, and press firmly down into the gap. Be very careful to maintain complete control over the knife—once the gap opens, if you're pressing too hard on the knife it may slip in and cut the battery. This should wedge the gap open and cause the glass to lift slightly up from the case. When the glass has lifted, gently rotate the knife down, opening the gap more by pushing the glass up.

Lines.Text: once you've opened the gap enough , insert the tip of an opening pick under the glass .
slide the pick along the bottom edge to separate adhesive holding the screen to the case .
be careful not to insert the opening pick too far . only about 1 /8 ( about 3 mm ) is necessary , any deeper and you may damage cables .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you've opened the gap enough, insert the tip of an opening pick under the glass. Slide the pick along the bottom edge to separate adhesive holding the screen to the case. Be careful not to insert the opening pick too far. Only about 1/8" ( about 3 mm) is necessary, any deeper and you may damage cables.

Lines.Text: roll the opening pick up the side of the button side of the watch , gently pushing in to separate the adhesive and widening the gap as you go .
remember not to push the pick in too farit's easier to avoid this by rolling the pick , rather than dragging a tip along .

Steps.Text_raw: Roll the opening pick up the side of the button side of the watch, gently pushing in to separate the adhesive and widening the gap as you go. Remember not to push the pick in too far—it's easier to avoid this by rolling the pick, rather than dragging a tip along.

Lines.Text: work the pick around the top right corner , and roll it along the top edge of the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Work the pick around the top right corner, and roll it along the top edge of the screen.

Lines.Text: continue working the pick around the perimeter of the screen , rolling down along the left side to cut the last of the adhesive .
leave the pick in place to keep the adhesive from resealing the screen in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue working the pick around the perimeter of the screen, rolling down along the left side to cut the last of the adhesive. Leave the pick in place to keep the adhesive from resealing the screen in place.

Lines.Text: while holding the first pick in place , use a second to check that all of the adhesive is separated around the entire perimeter of the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: While holding the first pick in place, use a second to check that all of the adhesive is separated around the entire perimeter of the screen.

Lines.Text: there are two cables connecting the screen to the inside of the watch , near the top left corner . be careful when prying or you may damage these cables .
pry slightly up on the right side of the screen , to free it from any remaining adhesive .
pry up on the left to free it as wellbut '''do not attempt to remove the screen''' as it is still held in place by two cables .

Steps.Text_raw: There are two cables connecting the screen to the inside of the watch, near the top left corner. Be careful when prying or you may damage these cables. Pry slightly up on the right side of the screen, to free it from any remaining adhesive. Pry up on the left to free it as well—but '''do not attempt to remove the screen''' as it is still held in place by two cables.

Lines.Text: if you can see the top layer of your force touch sensor among the display adhesive , it means the two layers of the sensor separated and you're going to need to replace or repair it .
the top layer of the sensor may be adhered to the back of the screenpush it down to separate it , and '''switch to our guide from this point on . '''

Steps.Text_raw: If you can see the top layer of your Force Touch sensor among the display adhesive, it means the two layers of the sensor separated and you're going to need to replace or repair it. The top layer of the sensor may be adhered to the back of the screen—push it down to separate it, and '''switch to our [guide|41084|Force Touch Sensor guide] from this point on.'''

Lines.Text: lift the screen up and shift it to the left , minding the display data and digitizer cables .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the screen up and shift it to the left, minding the display data and digitizer cables.

Lines.Text: place the watch on an elevated surface , at least 1 /2 or 1 cm talla small box or the edge of a book will work great . this will allow the screen to hang down vertically and give better access to the battery .
be careful not to bump the screen or strain the cables while you work .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the watch on an elevated surface, at least 1/2" or 1 cm tall—a small box or the edge of a book will work great. This will allow the screen to hang down vertically and give better access to the battery. Be careful not to bump the screen or strain the cables while you work.

Lines.Text: wedge a plastic opening tool between the right side of the battery and the case .
pry the battery up to separate it from the adhesive securing it to the system board .
'''do not''' attempt to remove the battery as it is still connected .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge a plastic opening tool between the right side of the battery and the case. Pry the battery up to separate it from the adhesive securing it to the system board. '''Do not''' attempt to remove the battery as it is still connected.

Lines.Text: rotate the battery counterclockwise to expose its connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the battery counterclockwise to expose its connector.

Lines.Text: hold the battery up and out of the way , to expose the battery cable connector .
use a plastic opening tool , prying against the bottom of the case to separate the battery cable connector from the watch's battery cable .
remove the battery from the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Hold the battery up and out of the way, to expose the battery cable connector. Use a plastic opening tool, prying against the bottom of the case to separate the battery cable connector from the watch's battery cable. Remove the battery from the watch.

Lines.Text: fold the screen up and over to the right , to expose the cables underneath .

Steps.Text_raw: Fold the screen up and over to the right, to expose the cables underneath.

Lines.Text: the display and digitizer cable connectors are secured beneath a small metal bracket that is adhered to the speaker .
use a plastic opening tool to flip the bracket toward the display and up from the speaker .
if you simply pry toward the watch band you may tear the cables .

Steps.Text_raw: The display and digitizer cable connectors are secured beneath a small metal bracket that is adhered to the speaker. Use a plastic opening tool to flip the bracket toward the display and up from the speaker. If you simply pry toward the watch band you may tear the cables.

Lines.Text: the bracket that contains the display and digitizer cable connections is made up of an upper and lower piece . the connectors are secured to the lower , and the upper must be removed to disconnect them .
use fine-tipped tweezers to grasp the lower half of the bracket .
there is a small metal tab that protrudes downward from the upper metal bracket .
insert a small ( 1 mm ) flathead screwdriver between the tab and the lower bracket , and rotate the screwdriver to spread the gap .
this will release two tabs that hold the upper bracket to the lower , and should free the upper bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: The bracket that contains the display and digitizer cable connections is made up of an upper and lower piece. The connectors are secured to the lower, and the upper must be removed to disconnect them. Use fine-tipped tweezers to grasp the lower half of the bracket. There is a small metal tab that protrudes downward from the upper metal bracket. Insert a small (1 mm) flathead screwdriver between the tab and the lower bracket, and rotate the screwdriver to spread the gap. This will release two tabs that hold the upper bracket to the lower, and should free the upper bracket.

Lines.Text: the upper half of the display connector bracket is held at the upper end by a metal tab that fits into a slot in the lower bracket .
grab the upper bracket with your tweezers and slide it toward the top of the watch to disengage this tab and free the bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: The upper half of the display connector bracket is held at the upper end by a metal tab that fits into a slot in the lower bracket. Grab the upper bracket with your tweezers and slide it toward the top of the watch to disengage this tab and free the bracket.

Lines.Text: disconnect the display data and digitizer cables .
be careful not to touch any of the contacts directly , as your finger oils may impede connectivity .
remove the display .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the display data and digitizer cables. Be careful not to touch any of the contacts directly, as your finger oils may impede connectivity. Remove the display.

Lines.Text: remove the single triwing screw securing the force touch sensor connector cable .
this screw is very small and strips easily , take care to operate at a proper angle and push as you turn .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the single triwing screw securing the Force Touch sensor connector cable. https://www.ifixit.com/Store/Tools/Tri-point-Y000-Screwdriver-for-Apple-Watch-and-iPhone-7/IF145-309 This screw is very small and strips easily, take care to operate at a proper angle and push as you turn.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to flip the force touch sensor cable connector straight down , disconnecting it .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to flip the Force Touch sensor cable connector straight down, disconnecting it.

Lines.Text: microwave your iopener for another 30 seconds , and apply it to the front of the watch case to soften the adhesive securing the force touch sensor .

Steps.Text_raw: Microwave your iOpener for another 30 seconds, and apply it to the front of the watch case to soften the adhesive securing the Force Touch sensor.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening pick and tweezers to remove the force touch sensor from the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening pick and tweezers to remove the Force Touch sensor from the case.

Lines.Text: use tweezers to peel up any adhesive left behind on the lower case . also remove any adhesive that stuck to the force touch sensor .
you may want to use an alcohol-soaked q-tip to clean any residue off the case . be sure to let it dry before proceeding .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers to peel up any adhesive left behind on the lower case. Also remove any adhesive that stuck to the Force Touch sensor. You may want to use an alcohol-soaked q-tip to clean any residue off the case. Be sure to let it dry before proceeding.

Lines.Text: use tweezers to peel the outer ring off of one of the adhesive strip pads .
be sure to get both the double-sided adhesive and the brown backing paper .
be very careful not to fold , bend , or stretch the adhesive tape , as this will make it too thick to seal the screen without a ridge between the screen and the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers to peel the outer ring off of one of the adhesive strip pads. Be sure to get both the double-sided adhesive and the brown backing paper. Be very careful not to fold, bend, or stretch the adhesive tape, as this will make it too thick to seal the screen without a ridge between the screen and the case.

Lines.Text: lay the backed adhesive tape down on the case , around the edge where the screen rests .
start in a corner with the tape as close to the corner wall as possible .
press on the brown backing paper with a plastic opening tool to secure the adhesive around the entire perimeter .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the backed adhesive tape down on the case, around the edge where the screen rests. Start in a corner with the tape as close to the corner wall as possible. Press on the brown backing paper with a plastic opening tool to secure the adhesive around the entire perimeter.

Lines.Text: the following steps detail repairing a force touch sensor with separated layers . if you're replacing your force touch sensor with a new part , ignore these steps .
the remaining adhesive sticker backing makes a great work surface .
open the gap between the two layers , but do not peel apart any more of the original adhesive .
apply super-glue to the lower half of the sensor and press the upper half down into the glue . press hard to squeeze out any excess glue and make the sensor as thin as possible .

Steps.Text_raw: The following steps detail repairing a Force Touch sensor with separated layers. If you're replacing your Force Touch sensor with a new part, ignore these steps. The remaining adhesive sticker backing makes a great work surface. Open the gap between the two layers, but do not peel apart any more of the original adhesive. Apply super-glue to the lower half of the sensor and press the upper half down into the glue. Press hard to squeeze out any excess glue and make the sensor as thin as possible.

Lines.Text: before the sensor gets glued to the paper , lift it up and let it complete its drying in the air .
you will likely have a few small extrusions of glueonce they've dried , you can break these off with tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Before the sensor gets glued to the paper, lift it up and let it complete its drying in the air. You will likely have a few small extrusions of glue—once they've dried, you can break these off with tweezers.

Lines.Text: peel the backing off of the adhesive you applied earlier .

Steps.Text_raw: Peel the backing off of the adhesive you applied earlier.

Lines.Text: set the force touch sensor on top of the adhesive , back in the case . be sure to properly orient it , with the connector in the lower left corner , facing up .
use a plastic opening tool to press it against the adhesive and make a tight seal .

Steps.Text_raw: Set the Force Touch sensor on top of the adhesive, back in the case. Be sure to properly orient it, with the connector in the lower left corner, facing up. Use a plastic opening tool to press it against the adhesive and make a tight seal.

Lines.Text: use tweezers to fold the force touch sensor cable connector back up onto its socket .
then use a plastic opening tool to press the cable connector into the socket .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers to fold the Force Touch sensor cable connector back up onto its socket. Then use a plastic opening tool to press the cable connector into the socket.

Lines.Text: replace the triwing screw securing the force touch sensor connector cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Replace the triwing screw securing the Force Touch sensor connector cable.

Subject: Force Touch Sensor

Title: Fossil Speedway Watch TI-5061 Replacement of the Back

Lines.Text: keep clasp in open position .
push one of the spring-loaded pins out of the hole with a push-pin .
wiggle watch band and clasp till free from each other .

Steps.Text_raw: Keep clasp in open position. Push one of the spring-loaded pins out of the hole with a Push-pin. Wiggle watch band and clasp till free from each other.

Lines.Text: fit the blades of a pair of scissors into the grooves of the screw back .
twist the screw back counter clockwise with the scissors .
once the back is loose enough , you can use your fingers to twist it off .

Steps.Text_raw: Fit the blades of a pair of scissors into the grooves of the screw back. Twist the screw back counter clockwise with the scissors. Once the back is loose enough, you can use your fingers to twist it off.

Subject: Back

Title: Fossil Speedway Watch TI-5061 Band Link Replacement

Lines.Text: locate the link on the band with arrows pointing in opposite directions .
place push pin into the hole on one side of the link .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the link on the band with arrows pointing in opposite directions. Place push pin into the hole on one side of the link.

Lines.Text: hit the push pin with the blunt object ( we used scissors ) until the small metal rod sticks out from the link .
pull the rod out using your fingers .
repeat on the other side to remove the entire link .

Steps.Text_raw: Hit the push pin with the blunt object (we used scissors) until the small metal rod sticks out from the link. Pull the rod out using your fingers. Repeat on the other side to remove the entire link.

Lines.Text: to replace the link , insert the open end of one of the connected links into the open end of the new link .
place the rod into the aligning holes and use the blunt object to hammer the rod into the link .

Steps.Text_raw: To replace the link, insert the open end of one of the connected links into the open end of the new link. Place the rod into the aligning holes and use the blunt object to hammer the rod into the link.

wiggle watch band and clasp till free from each other .

twist the screw back counter clockwise with the scissors .
once the back is loose enough , you can use your fingers to twist it off .

push one of the spring-loaded pins out of the hole with a push-pin .
wiggle watch band and clasp till free from each other .

twist the screw back counter clockwise with the scissors .
once the back is loose enough , you can use your fingers to twist it off .

firmly grip the battery with the tweezers .
pull the battery out and replace it with a new 371 renata watch battery .

Title: LG G Watch Rear Case Replacement

Lines.Text: spring bars attach the two halves of the wristband to the watch body . the spring bar has a shoulder on either end .
be prepared to apply some pressure with your fingers to perform the following action .
first , slide the wristband down on the spring bar to expose the shoulder of the spring bar .
grasp the exposed shoulder with the tweezers to perform the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: Spring bars attach the two halves of the wristband to the watch body. The spring bar has a shoulder on either end. Be prepared to apply some pressure with your fingers to perform the following action. First, slide the wristband down on the spring bar to expose the shoulder of the spring bar. Grasp the exposed shoulder with the tweezers to perform the next step.

Lines.Text: this is a challenging step . do it carefully to prevent the spring bar from flying out of the wristband .
use the tweezer to depress the spring bar so that it collapses by a few millimeters and pops out of the hole that was holding it in place .
now carefully pull the other end of the spring bar to detach the wristband from the watch face .
repeat steps 1 and 2 for the other wristband .

Steps.Text_raw: This is a challenging step. Do it carefully to prevent the spring bar from flying out of the wristband. Use the tweezer to depress the spring bar so that it collapses by a few millimeters and pops out of the hole that was holding it in place. Now carefully pull the other end of the spring bar to detach the wristband from the watch face. Repeat steps 1 and 2 for the other wristband.

Lines.Text: use the t5 torx screwdriver to unscrew the four silver 2 mm x 3 mm t5 screws that hold the back cover in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the T5 Torx screwdriver to unscrew the four silver 2mm x 3mm T5 screws that hold the back cover in place.

Lines.Text: slide the opening pick between the rear case and the rest of the device to separate the two halves .
gently pull the two halves apart .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the opening pick between the rear case and the rest of the device to separate the two halves. Gently pull the two halves apart.

Subject: Rear Case

Lines.Text: on a flat surface , use the 00 screwdriver to remove the four screws from each corner , and set them in a safe place .

Steps.Text_raw: On a flat surface, use the PH00 screwdriver to remove the four screws from each corner, and set them in a safe place.

Lines.Text: gently lift the back plate , and be careful to not damage the rubber gasket .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the back plate, and be careful to not damage the rubber gasket.

Lines.Text: use the 1.5 flathead , and carefully pry the battery out of the housing .
the battery is under spring tension and may fly out .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the 1.5 flathead, and carefully pry the battery out of the housing. The battery is under spring tension and may fly out.

Lines.Text: place the new battery in the battery housing . ensure the positive side is facing up .
ensure the battery is firmly seated . a faint click can be heard when it is firmly seated .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the new battery in the battery housing. Ensure the positive side is facing up. Ensure the battery is firmly seated. A faint click can be heard when it is firmly seated.

Lines.Text: remove the rubber gasket from the back plate .
use an alcohol wipe to clean the back plate and the watch housing where the gasket will sit . this will ensure a clean and an airtight fit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the rubber gasket from the back plate. Use an alcohol wipe to clean the back plate and the watch housing where the gasket will sit. This will ensure a clean and an airtight fit.

Lines.Text: seat the gasket back onto the back plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Seat the gasket back onto the back plate.

Lines.Text: place the back plate back onto the main watch housing . ensure the notch in the back plate is line up with the crown .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the back plate back onto the main watch housing. Ensure the notch in the back plate is line up with the crown.

Lines.Text: tighten screws in a star pattern until the backplate is tight .

Steps.Text_raw: Tighten screws in a star pattern until the backplate is tight.

Lines.Text: pull the crown away from the watch and then turn the knob to set the time .
pull the crown away from the watch and then turn the knob to set the time .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the crown away from the watch and then turn the knob to set the time. Pull the crown away from the watch and then turn the knob to set the time.

Title: How to Resole a Shoe With a Used Tire

Lines.Text: cut across the tire using a knife creating a groove approximately the width of the tread .
do not cut completely through the tire .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut across the tire using a knife creating a groove approximately the width of the tread. Do not cut completely through the tire.

Lines.Text: remove the tread from the tire while scraping underneath the top layer with a knife .
peel back the layer , cut the tread , and remove it from the tire .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the tread from the tire while scraping underneath the top layer with a knife. Peel back the layer, cut the tread, and remove it from the tire.

Lines.Text: lay the tire tread flat .
external side of tread facing down on the table .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the tire tread flat. External side of tread facing down on the table.

Lines.Text: clean the bottom of the sandal with a damp cloth to ensure the surface is free of debris .

Steps.Text_raw: Clean the bottom of the sandal with a damp cloth to ensure the surface is free of debris.

Lines.Text: place the sandal with the sole facing down on the tire tread .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the sandal with the sole facing down on the tire tread.

Lines.Text: outline the sandal with a bright colored marker .
remove the sandal .

Steps.Text_raw: Outline the sandal with a bright colored marker. Remove the sandal.

Lines.Text: apply adhesive on the inside of the marker drawn .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply adhesive on the inside of the marker drawn.

Lines.Text: place the sandal in the outline .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the sandal in the outline.

Lines.Text: insert a wood block into the sandal .
clamp the wood block to the tire tread .
allow adhesive to cure according to manufacturer recommendations .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert a wood block into the sandal. Clamp the wood block to the tire tread. Allow adhesive to cure according to manufacturer recommendations.

Lines.Text: remove the clamps and wood block .
cut the excess tread from the sandal with a utility knife .
never cut toward yourself .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the clamps and wood block. Cut the excess tread from the sandal with a utility knife. Never cut toward yourself.

Lines.Text: smooth edges of the tread , and remove excess tread/adhesive .

Steps.Text_raw: Smooth edges of the tread, and remove excess tread/adhesive.

Subject: Outer Sole

Toolbox.Name: heavy duty denim sewing machine needle

Lines.Text: while wearing your jeans , have a friend help you fold the cuffs of each pant leg to your desired length .
have your friend safety pin the folded cuff to the pant leg to hold the fold in place .
be careful that your friend only catches the fabric and doesn't stab you with a pin in the process .
using safety pins as opposed to straight pins allows you to change out of the jeans without getting stabbed by a pin .
you only need to do one pant leg , as you will measure to make them even . if you have legs that are slightly different lengths , you can do this on both sides .

Steps.Text_raw: While wearing your jeans, have a friend help you fold the cuffs of each pant leg to your desired length. Have your friend safety pin the folded cuff to the pant leg to hold the fold in place. Be careful that your friend only catches the fabric and doesn't stab you with a pin in the process. Using safety pins as opposed to straight pins allows you to change out of the jeans without getting stabbed by a pin. You only need to do one pant leg, as you will measure to make them even. If you have legs that are slightly different lengths, you can do this on both sides.

Lines.Text: measure the length from the cuff of the jeans to the fold . this is the length you want to remove from the jeans .
unpin the cuff of the jeans .

Steps.Text_raw: Measure the length from the cuff of the jeans to the fold. This is the length you want to remove from the jeans. Unpin the cuff of the jeans.

Lines.Text: unfold the cuff of the jeans and turn them so that the hem faces you .

Steps.Text_raw: Unfold the cuff of the jeans and turn them so that the hem faces you.

Lines.Text: use the measurement from 2 to measure from the cuff of the jean and make a mark with tailor's chalk .
move over a few inches and measure from the cuff again , making a second mark in line with the first .
continue marking your measurement all the way around the pant leg .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the measurement from [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+to+Hem+Jeans/44388#s99463|Step 2] to measure from the cuff of the jean and make a mark with tailor's chalk. Move over a few inches and measure from the cuff again, making a second mark in line with the first. Continue marking your measurement all the way around the pant leg.

Lines.Text: add an inch to the measurement you took , and use tailor's chalk to mark this new measurement as a second line one inch above the first line you made .

we need to double the hem length , so we'll be adding one inch to our measurement since a standard jean hem is half an inch . if you have a different size hem , simply add double the hem length to your measurement .
continue marking all the way around the pant leg .

Steps.Text_raw: Add an inch to the measurement you took, and use tailor's chalk to mark this new measurement as a second line one inch above the first line you made. We need to double the hem length, so we'll be adding one inch to our measurement since a standard jean hem is half an inch. If you have a different size hem, simply add double the hem length to your measurement. Continue marking all the way around the pant leg.

Lines.Text: insert a row of straight pins along the marks of your second line , which sits one inch above the amount you want to remove .
be sure to only catch one layer of the jeans , as you don't want to pin the pant leg shut !
the pins should lay along the length of the line , not perpendicular to it .
insert pins all the way around the pant leg .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert a row of straight pins along the marks of  your second line, which sits one inch above the amount you want to remove. Be sure to only catch one layer of the jeans, as you don't want to pin the pant leg shut! The pins should lay along the length of the line, not perpendicular to it. Insert pins all the way around the pant leg.

Lines.Text: fold the cuff of the pant leg up to meet the line of pins , matching the edge of the jeans with the row of pins .
insert a row of pins perpendicular to the bottom of the cuff , catching the fold and holding it in place .
be careful not to pin the pant leg shut . you only need to pin the cuff to a single layer of the pant leg .
insert pins all the way around the pant leg .
remove the first horizontal row of pins .

Steps.Text_raw: Fold the cuff of the pant leg up to meet the line of pins, matching the edge of the jeans with the row of pins. Insert a row of pins perpendicular to the bottom of the cuff, catching the fold and holding it in place. Be careful not to pin the pant leg shut. You only need to pin the cuff to a single layer of the pant leg. Insert pins all the way around the pant leg. Remove the first horizontal row of pins.

Lines.Text: up your sewing machine with thread that matches your jeans and a heavy-duty/denim needle .
insert the pant leg into the sewing machine , sliding the cuff around the arm of the sewing machine .
you may want to remove the table on your sewing machine to make it easier to get around the arm .

make sure the pant leg is around the arm of the sewing machine so that you don't sew the pant leg shut . there should only be the two layers of the fold between the presser foot and the sewing machine arm .

Steps.Text_raw: [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/Thread+a+Sewing+Machine/19463|Set up your sewing machine|new_window=true] with thread that matches your jeans and a heavy-duty/denim needle. Insert the pant leg into the sewing machine, sliding the cuff around the arm of the sewing machine. You may want to remove the table on your sewing machine to make it easier to get around the arm. Make sure the pant leg is around the arm of the sewing machine so that you don't sew the pant leg shut. There should only be the two layers of the fold between the presser foot and the sewing machine arm.

Lines.Text: align the center of the presser foot ( and needle ) with the edge of the hem on the jeans .
this is where the dark bottom edge of the jeans meets the light inside color of the jeans .
lower the presser foot and take a few stitches , keep the line of stitches right at the edge of the hem .

Steps.Text_raw: Align the center of the presser foot (and needle) with the edge of the hem on the jeans. This is where the dark bottom edge of the jeans meets the light inside color of the jeans. Lower the presser foot and take a few stitches, keep the line of stitches right at the edge of the hem.
Tools_extracted: heavy duty denim sewing machine needle

Lines.Text: when you come to the first pin , stop sewing .
without lifting the presser foot , remove the pin .
never sew over pins . if the needle of the sewing machine hits a pin it can bend or break .
continue sewing around the pant leg , at the edge of the hem , stopping to remove pins as you go .

Steps.Text_raw: When you come to the first pin, stop sewing. Without lifting the presser foot, remove the pin. Never sew over pins. If the needle of the sewing machine hits a pin it can bend or break. Continue sewing around the pant leg, at the edge of the hem, stopping to remove pins as you go.

Lines.Text: when you come back to where you started sewing , continue sewing , overlapping the first few stitches .
in this photo we've sewn slightly off of the edge of the hem for visibility . when you sew your jeans , you will want to sew as close to that edge as possible .

Steps.Text_raw: When you come back to where you started sewing, continue sewing, overlapping the first few stitches. In this photo we've sewn slightly off of the edge of the hem for visibility. When you sew your jeans, you will want to sew as close to that edge as possible.

Lines.Text: lift the presser foot and slide the jeans out .
clip the threads that attach the jeans to the sewing machine .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the presser foot and slide the jeans out. Clip the threads that attach the jeans to the sewing machine.

Lines.Text: unfold the jeans , tucking the fold you just sewed inside the pant leg .
insert the pant leg back into the sewing machine , right-side out , around the arm of the machine .

make sure the pant leg is around the arm of the sewing machine , so that you don't sew the pant leg shut . there should only be the two layers of the fold between the presser foot and the sewing machine arm .
align the presser foot along the edge of the side seam of the pants .

Steps.Text_raw: Unfold the jeans, tucking the fold you just sewed inside the pant leg. Insert the pant leg back into the sewing machine, right-side out, around the arm of the machine. Make sure the pant leg is around the arm of the sewing machine, so that you don't sew the pant leg shut. There should only be the two layers of the fold between the presser foot and the sewing machine arm. Align the presser foot along the edge of the side seam of the pants.

Lines.Text: lower the presser foot and take a couple of stitches .
use the reverse function on your sewing machine to backstitch a couple of stitches .

Steps.Text_raw: Lower the presser foot and take a couple of stitches. Use the reverse function on your sewing machine to backstitch a couple of stitches.

Lines.Text: sew along the edge of the hem for about a dozen stitches .
use the reverse function on your sewing machine to backstitch a couple of stitches .

Steps.Text_raw: Sew along the edge of the hem for about a dozen stitches. Use the reverse function on your sewing machine to backstitch a couple of stitches.

Lines.Text: remove the pant leg from the sewing machine and clip any threads .
repeat 13-16 of this guide , sewing the side seam on the other side of the pants .

you can trim the excess fabric of the fold on the inside of the pants if you want , or you can leave it folded inside the jeans . if you leave it , you can always remove the stitching to restore the original length to the jeans , which can be useful for growing kids .
repeat 2-16 of this guide for the other pant leg of your jeans .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the pant leg from the sewing machine and clip any threads. Repeat [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+to+Hem+Jeans/44388#s99479|Steps 13]-16 of this guide, sewing the side seam on the other side of the pants. You can trim the excess fabric of the fold on the inside of the pants if you want, or you can leave it folded inside the jeans. If you leave it, you can always [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+to+Rip+a+Seam/19500| remove the stitching|new_window=true] to restore the original length to the jeans, which can be useful for growing kids. Repeat [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+to+Hem+Jeans/44388#s99463|Steps 2]-16 of this guide for the other pant leg of your jeans.

Lines.Text: to remove the gear 2 neo's watch band , start by locating the small metal levers on either end of the band .
using your finger , push downward on the lever to release the band locking mechanism .
note : if you have especially short fingernails , it may be easier to use a spudger to depress the levers .
continue to hold the lever down and pull the end of the band away from the watch to completely detach it .
repeat this process for the other side of the band to fully release it .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the Gear 2 Neo's watch band, start by locating the small metal levers on either end of the band. Using your finger, push downward on the lever to release the band locking mechanism. Note: If you have especially short fingernails, it may be easier to use a Spudger to depress the levers. Continue to hold the lever down and pull the end of the band away from the watch to completely detach it. Repeat this process for the other side of the band to fully release it.

Lines.Text: start by removing the four torx t5 security screws from the back panel of the watch assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Start by removing the four Torx T5 Security Screws from the back panel of the Watch Assembly.

Lines.Text: once the four torx screws have been removed from the watch assembly , using a spudger , gently pry the front and back halves of the watch away from each other . this is best accomplished by placing the head of the spudger in the space between the two halves and rotating the head until the two halves split apart .
be careful not to let the spudger slip into the casing too far ; doing so could damage the internal components .
once the two halves have separated simply lift the back half up and away from the front half to complete this step .
there are no cables connecting the front and back halves of the watch together ; there is no need to worry about pulling any cables or connectors out in this step .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the four Torx screws have been removed from the Watch Assembly, using a spudger, gently pry the front and back halves of the watch away from each other. This is best accomplished by placing the head of the spudger in the space between the two halves and  rotating the head until the two halves split apart. Be careful not to let the spudger slip into the casing too far; doing so could damage the internal components. Once the two halves have separated simply lift the back half up and away from the front half to complete this step. There are no cables connecting the front and back halves of the watch together; there is no need to worry about pulling any cables or connectors out in this step.

Lines.Text: once separated , the back half of the device is easily distinguished from the front by the large white battery . take a moment to familiarize yourself with the important components presented in this half of the device before continuing .
300 mah battery
battery connector ( attached by way of adhesive )
device speaker .

be aware that the orange lining around the edge of the device forms part of the seal that prevents moisture from entering the main assembly . be careful to not disturb this lining or the gear 2 neo will become dramatically less water resistant .

Steps.Text_raw: Once separated, the back half of the device is easily distinguished from the front by the large white battery. Take a moment to familiarize yourself with the important components presented in this half of the device before continuing. 300 mAh Battery Battery Connector (attached by way of adhesive) Device Speaker. Be aware that the orange lining around the edge of the device forms part of the seal that prevents moisture from entering the main assembly. Be careful to not disturb this lining or the Gear 2 Neo will become dramatically less water resistant.

Lines.Text: to remove the battery , simply use the provided tab labeled pull to separate the battery from the casing . do not pull the battery all the way out quite yet ; there is still the matter of detaching the battery connector .

there is a small application of adhesive on the underside of the battery . when lifting the battery away , if you feel a bit of resistance , feel free to press down on the casing to give yourself a bit of leverage .
caution : be very careful not to puncture the battery in this step or while recycling ; doing so can result in the release of dangerous gases and an explosive reaction .
finally , using a spudger , separate the end of the battery connector cable , ( held in place by another small application of adhesive and a plastic pin ) from the casing .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the battery, simply use the provided tab labeled "pull" to separate the battery from the casing. Do not pull the battery all the way out quite yet; there is still the matter of detaching the battery connector. There is a small application of adhesive on the underside of the battery. When lifting the battery away, if you feel a bit of resistance, feel free to press down on the casing to give yourself a bit of leverage. Caution: Be very careful not to puncture the battery in this step or while recycling; doing so can result in the release of dangerous gases and an explosive reaction. Finally, using a spudger, separate the end of the battery connector cable, (held in place by another small application of adhesive and a plastic pin) from the casing.

Lines.Text: installing the new battery is as easy as setting the new battery in the indent made for it and re-seating the connector around the pin . with this done , the repair is complete !
be sure to recycle the old rechargeable battery in a safe manner . please check nearby for recycling centers and drop-offs for electronic waste .

Steps.Text_raw: Installing the new battery is as easy as setting the new battery in the indent made for it and re-seating the connector around the pin. With this done, the repair is complete! Be sure to recycle the old rechargeable battery in a safe manner. Please check nearby for recycling centers and drop-offs for electronic waste.

using your finger , push downward on the lever to release the band locking mechanism .
note : if you have especially short fingernails , it may be easier to use a spudger to depress the levers .
continue to hold the lever down and pull the end of the band away from the watch to completely detach it .
repeat this process for the other side of the band to fully release it .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the Gear 2 Neo's watch band, start by locating the small metal levers on either end of the band. Using your finger, push downward on the lever to release the band locking mechanism. Note: If you have especially short fingernails, it may be easier to use a spudger to depress the levers. Continue to hold the lever down and pull the end of the band away from the watch to completely detach it. Repeat this process for the other side of the band to fully release it.

Lines.Text: start by removing the four torx t5 security screws from the back panel of the watch assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Start by removing the four Torx T5 Security Screws from the back panel of the Watch Assembly.

Lines.Text: once the four torx screws have been removed from the watch assembly , using a spudger , gently pry the front and back halves of the watch away from each other . this is best accomplished by placing the head of the spudger in the space between the two halves and rotating the head until the two halves split apart .
be careful not to let the spudger slip into the casing too far ; doing so could damage the internal components .
once the two halves have separated simply lift the back half up and away from the front half to complete this step .
there are no cables connecting the front and back halves of the watch together ; there is no need to worry about pulling any cables or connectors out in this step .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the four Torx screws have been removed from the Watch Assembly, using a spudger, gently pry the front and back halves of the watch away from each other. This is best accomplished by placing the head of the spudger in the space between the two halves and  rotating the head until the two halves split apart. Be careful not to let the spudger slip into the casing too far; doing so could damage the internal components. Once the two halves have separated simply lift the back half up and away from the front half to complete this step. There are no cables connecting the front and back halves of the watch together; there is no need to worry about pulling any cables or connectors out in this step.

Lines.Text: once separated , the front half of the device is easily distinguished from the back by the blue mainboard . take a moment to familiarize yourself with the important components presented in this half of the device before continuing .
amoled display connector
heart rate sensor
front button assembly
infrared blaster

be aware that the small red rings seated on the four screw mounting points form part of the seal that prevents moisture from entering the main assembly . be careful to replace these if they fall off during the repair process or the gear 2 neo will become dramatically less water resistant .

Steps.Text_raw: Once separated, the front half of the device is easily distinguished from the back by the blue mainboard. Take a moment to familiarize yourself with the important components presented in this half of the device before continuing. AMOLED display connector Heart Rate Sensor Front button assembly Infrared Blaster Be aware that the small red rings seated on the four screw mounting points form part of the seal that prevents moisture from entering the main assembly. Be careful to replace these if they fall off during the repair process or the Gear 2 Neo will become dramatically less water resistant.

Lines.Text: using a pair of precision tweezers , gently grip and disconnect the amoled display connector from the mainboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a pair of precision tweezers, gently grip and disconnect the AMOLED display connector from the mainboard.

Lines.Text: the mainboard is secured in place by a shaped snap-fit plastic bracket . simply apply pressure under the mainboard using a spudger to free it .
once the mainboard is released from the bracket , use a pair of precision tweezers to remove the mainboard completely .
the mainboard is an esd sensitive device and should be handled with care to avoid static discharge . it is recommend you use an anti-static wrist strap when handling this component .

Steps.Text_raw: The mainboard is secured in place by a shaped snap-fit plastic bracket. Simply  apply pressure under the mainboard using a spudger to free it. Once the mainboard is released from the bracket, use a pair of precision tweezers to remove the mainboard completely. The mainboard is an ESD sensitive device and should be handled with care to avoid static discharge. It is recommend you use an anti-static wrist strap when handling this component.

Lines.Text: the amoled display is secured to the front watch assembly with adhesive in two different ways ; one being an adhesive ring around the edge , and two being a small adhesive application between the display and front watch assembly .
in order to free the display , use a spudger to gently apply pressure to the back of the amoled panel until the top half the the display separates from the front panel .

do not attempt to force the display all the way off of the front assembly in this step . doing so will likely flex the amoled display enough to shatter it . the adhesive application on the backside of the display must first be removed .
once the top half of the display has been separated from the front panel , use a spudger to clear the adhesive from the underside of the display .
when the underside of the display has been cleared of adhesive , continue to apply pressure with the spudger until the display comes free of the front watch assembly .
be sure to leave the adhesive ring in place once the display has been removed ; it is critical for installing the new amoled display .

Steps.Text_raw: The AMOLED display is secured to the front watch assembly with adhesive in two different ways; one being an adhesive ring around the edge, and two being a small adhesive application between the display and front watch assembly. In order to free the display, use a spudger to gently apply pressure to the back of the AMOLED panel until the top half the the display separates from the front panel. Do not attempt to force the display all the way off of the front assembly in this step. Doing so will likely flex the AMOLED display enough to shatter it. The adhesive application on the backside of the display must first be removed. Once the top half of the display has been separated from the front panel, use a spudger to clear the adhesive from the underside of the display. When the underside of the display has been cleared of adhesive, continue to apply pressure with the spudger until the display comes free of the front watch assembly. Be sure to leave the adhesive ring in place once the display has been removed; it is critical for installing the new AMOLED display.

Lines.Text: with the amoled display removed , the device is now ready for the replacement .
when installing the new screen , be sure to feed the display cable back through the hole provided for reconnection to the mainboard .

Steps.Text_raw: With the AMOLED display removed, the device is now ready for the replacement. When installing the new screen, be sure to feed the display cable back through the hole provided for reconnection to the mainboard.

Title: Apple Watch 42mm Glass Digitizer Only Replacement

Lines.Text: heat the screen up so that the entire display and watch are warm . be sure to turn the device off first by holding down the crown then sliding to power off . using a sharp blade start at the bottom right corner and lift the glass up enough to create a gap , once you have a large enough gap use a plastic tool to break the adhesive bond around the edges

Steps.Text_raw: Heat the screen up so that the entire display and watch are warm. Be sure to turn the device off first by holding down the crown then sliding to power off. Using a sharp blade start at the bottom right corner and lift the glass up enough to create a gap, once you have a large enough gap use a plastic tool to break the adhesive bond around the edges

Lines.Text: when inserting the knife plastic tools around the edges be sure not to go further than 1 mm into the amoled . the force touch gasket lies directly underneath the glass and is easily damaged if pushed on too hard with a knife or other metal object . the fpc clip is tricky but is easily removed using sharp point tweezers on the battery edge .

Steps.Text_raw: When inserting the knife & plastic tools around the edges be sure not to go further than 1mm into the AMOLED. The force touch gasket lies directly underneath the glass and is easily damaged if pushed on too hard with a knife or other metal object. The FPC clip is tricky but is easily removed using sharp point tweezers on the battery edge.

Lines.Text: i used a solder iron tip that was larger than the solder pads . turn your soldering iron up to a high temperature , 350 c is where i kept mine at . do not add any solder , just use the heat tweezers to pull back the tabs . after unsoldering pull the flex cable out of the way and use tweezers to peel back the proximity sensor from the amoled . carefully .

Steps.Text_raw: I used a solder iron tip that was larger than the solder pads. Turn your soldering iron up to a high temperature, 350C is where I kept mine at. DO NOT add any solder, just use the heat & tweezers to pull back the tabs. After unsoldering pull the flex cable out of the way and use tweezers to peel back the proximity sensor from the AMOLED. CAREFULLY.

Lines.Text: after desoldering use a plastic spudger in the exact area as the picture shows to loosen up the adhesive holding the digi flex in place . it's best if you use a small amount of heat , around 150 f , to help soften the adhesive bond . fold the digi cable back as shown in the second picture .

Steps.Text_raw: After desoldering use a plastic spudger in the exact area as the picture shows to loosen up the adhesive holding the digi flex in place. It's best if you use a small amount of heat, around 150F, to help soften the adhesive bond. Fold the digi cable back as shown in the second picture.

Lines.Text: begin by preheating the entire screen to a uniform temp , letting it sit under warm air for 10 minutes . i keep my heat gun on 300 f-350 f while holding the screen 3-6 away from the nozzle to vary the temperature . carefully insert a business card under the screen on the dig flex side . use alcohol to weaken the oca tape bond then move the card in slow

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by preheating the entire screen to a uniform temp, letting it sit under warm air for 10 minutes. I keep my heat gun on 300F-350F while holding the screen 3"-6" away from the nozzle to vary the temperature. Carefully insert a business card under the screen on the dig flex side. Use alcohol to weaken the OCA tape bond then move the card in slow

Lines.Text: keep inserting the card slowly while using alcohol as a de-bonder and lubricant as well as keeping uniform hot air blowing on the screen . while holding the outside of the glass continue rocking the card back and forth until the amoled is completely separated .

Steps.Text_raw: Keep inserting the card slowly while using alcohol as a de-bonder and lubricant as well as keeping uniform hot air blowing on the screen. While holding the outside of the glass continue rocking the card back and forth until the AMOLED is completely separated.

Lines.Text: the amoled screen is extremely thin , but not as fragile as you might expect , remember to be gentle and use heat through the entire separation process . to remove the old oca adhesive use your finger and roll the glue off , pure isopropyl alcohol also helps to de-bond the adhesive . the screen is waterproof alcohol seeping into the edges is okay .

Steps.Text_raw: The AMOLED screen is extremely thin, but not as fragile as you might expect, remember to be gentle and use heat through the entire separation process. To remove the old OCA adhesive use your finger and "roll" the glue off, pure isopropyl alcohol also helps to de-bond the adhesive. The screen is "waterproof" alcohol seeping into the edges is okay.

Lines.Text: be careful of the force touch flex cable that sticks into the frame on the bottom left of the display while removing the display assembly from the frame . the force touch gasket sits around the entire edge of the watch and is a thin silicone membrane . test your amoled after separation before proceeding to the next steps .

Steps.Text_raw: Be careful of the force touch flex cable that sticks into the frame on the bottom left of the display while removing the display assembly from the frame. The force touch gasket sits around the ENTIRE edge of the watch and is a thin silicone membrane. Test your AMOLED after separation before proceeding to the next steps.

Title: How to Wash and Dry Jeans

Toolbox.Name: seventh generation natural liquid laundry soap

Lines.Text: lay your jeans out .
zip up the fly on your jeans .
don't forget to remove anything you may have left in the pockets .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay your jeans out. Zip up the fly on your jeans. Don't forget to remove anything you may have left in the pockets.

Lines.Text: button up your jeans .
if your jeans have buttons or any other fasteners , be sure to close those as well .

Steps.Text_raw: Button up your jeans. If your jeans have buttons or any other fasteners, be sure to close those as well.

Lines.Text: put your arm through the pant leg of your jeans and grasp the hem .
turn the jeans inside out by pulling the hem of each leg through the waistband .

Steps.Text_raw: Put your arm through the pant leg of your jeans and grasp the hem. Turn the jeans inside out by pulling the hem of each leg through the waistband.

Lines.Text: place your jeans in the washer .
you can wash other clothes with your jeans , if they are dark colored .

Steps.Text_raw: Place your jeans in the washer. You can wash other clothes with your jeans, if they are dark colored.

Lines.Text: set the load size .
you can adjust this to whatever size load of laundry you are doing . just be sure not to overload the washer , which not only is bad for your machine but creates additional wear on your clothes .
not sure what overloaded is ? check the guidelines in your user manual . a good rule of thumb is to only fill your washer 2 /3 full .
set the water temperature on the washing machine to cold/cold .
hot water can damage the fibers of your jeans and cause them to shrink . never wash your jeans in hot water .
start the washing machine on a gentle or normal wash cycle .

Steps.Text_raw: Set the load size. You can adjust this to whatever size load of laundry you are doing. Just be sure not to overload the washer, which not only is bad for your machine but creates additional wear on your clothes. Not sure what overloaded is? Check the guidelines in your user manual. A good rule of thumb is to only fill your washer 2/3 full. Set the water temperature on the washing machine to cold/cold. Hot water can damage the fibers of your jeans and cause them to shrink. Never wash your jeans in hot water. Start the washing machine on a gentle or normal wash cycle.

Lines.Text: with the water running , pour in your laundry soap , following the instructions on the bottle .
never pour laundry detergent directly on clothing ; always pour it into the water . pouring soap directly onto the clothes may cause discoloration .
we recommend generation free and clear liquid laundry detergent .

Steps.Text_raw: With the water running, pour in your laundry soap, following the instructions on the bottle. Never pour laundry detergent directly on clothing; always pour it into the water. Pouring soap directly onto the clothes may cause discoloration. We recommend [http://www.amazon.com/Seventh-Generation-Conc-Clear-32-Ounce/dp/B001FA1O3G/ref=br_lf_m_1000490281_2_32_ttl?ie=UTF8&m=ATVPDKIKX0DER&s=hpc&pf_rd_p=1260581682&pf_rd_s=center-2&pf_rd_t=1401&pf_rd_i=1000490281&pf_rd_m=ATVPDKIKX0DER&pf_rd_r=071ZQYR1GHQFFEZKYAGN|Seventh Generation Free and Clear|new_window=true ] liquid laundry detergent.
Tools_extracted: seventh generation natural liquid laundry soap

Lines.Text: after the washer has stopped , remove your jeans from the washing machine and take them out to your laundry line .
never dry jeans in the dryer . the heat and tumbling can damage the fibers and shrink the jeans . instead , hang your jeans up to dry using a laundry line , towel rack or even your shower head .
you'll want to leave your jeans inside out to prevent color fading as they dry .
take one pant leg and fold the cuff over the line , overlapping the back side of the pant leg by a few inches .

Steps.Text_raw: After the washer has stopped, remove your jeans from the washing machine and take them out to your laundry line. Never dry jeans in the dryer. The heat and tumbling can damage the fibers and shrink the jeans. Instead, hang your jeans up to dry using a laundry line, towel rack or even your shower head. You'll want to leave your jeans inside out to prevent color fading as they dry. Take one pant leg and fold the cuff over the line, overlapping the back side of the pant leg by a few inches.
Tools_extracted: seventh generation natural liquid laundry soap

Lines.Text: grab a clothespin and clip it in the middle of the pant leg , securing it to the laundry line .
always place your clothespins vertically . placing clothespins at an angle can cause warping in the clothes or can cause the clothespin to fall apart .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab a clothespin and clip it in the middle of the pant leg, securing it to the laundry line. Always place your clothespins vertically. Placing clothespins at an angle can cause warping in the clothes or can cause the clothespin to fall apart.

Lines.Text: take the second pant leg and fold the cuff over the line , as you did before . space this cuff so that the jeans hang as flat as possible .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the second pant leg and fold the cuff over the line, as you did before. Space this cuff so that the jeans hang as flat as possible.

Lines.Text: apply a second clothespin to the middle of the second pant leg , catching the line between two layers .
allow your pants to dry completely before removing the clothespins and taking them down .
to prevent your jeans from getting stiff , don't leave them out in the hot sun after they have dried . as soon as they are dry , take them down .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply a second clothespin to the middle of the second pant leg, catching the line between two layers. Allow your pants to dry completely before removing the clothespins and taking them down. To prevent your jeans from getting stiff, don't leave them out in the hot sun after they have dried. As soon as they are dry, take them down.
