Lines.Text: using your tweezers again , place the minute hand in the center of the face .
align the minute hand with the 12 o'clock position .
press down on the hand until the minute hand is firmly in place .
look to make sure there is a small amount of space between the hour hand and the face , as well as between the minute hand and the face .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your tweezers again, place the minute hand in the center of the face. Align the minute hand with the 12 O'clock position. Press down on the hand until the minute hand is firmly in place. Look to make sure there is a small amount of space between the hour hand and the face, as well as between the minute hand and the face.

Lines.Text: carefully pick up and place the second hand in the center of the watch .
press down firmly so that the second hand stays in place .
the position of the second hand is not extremely important , but to get the most accuracy ; place it in line with the minute hand .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pick up and place the second hand in the center of the watch. Press down firmly so that the second hand stays in place. The position of the second hand is not extremely important, but to get the most accuracy; place it in line with the minute hand.

Title: How to Fix a Ripped Shirt Hem

Lines.Text: turn your shirt inside out .
find your shirt's ripped hem .
if the shirt has any loose strings , trim them .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn your shirt inside out. Find your shirt's ripped hem. If the shirt has any loose strings, trim them.

Lines.Text: iron the area of the shirt where the hem is ripped .
if the hem is ripped several inches , you might want to insert sewing pins to keep the fabric in place .
it's important to iron because it allows for easier sewing when the shirt stays folded the same way as the non-ripped part of the hem .
the iron will be very hot . be careful as to not burn yourself .

Steps.Text_raw: Iron the area of the shirt where the hem is ripped. If the hem is ripped several inches, you might want to insert sewing pins to keep the fabric in place. It's important to iron because it allows for easier sewing when the shirt stays folded the same way as the non-ripped part of the hem. The iron will be very hot. Be careful as to not burn yourself.

Lines.Text: acquire a sewing needle and thread .
take your thread and loop it through the eye of the needle , the hole at the end of the needle .
you'll want the thread to be the same color and shade as the original thread . for visual purposes , i will use red in place of black .
the needle is sharp .

Steps.Text_raw: Acquire a sewing needle and thread. Take your thread and loop it through the eye of the needle, the hole at the end of the needle. You'll want the thread to be the same color and shade as the original thread. For visual purposes, I will use red in place of black. The needle is sharp.

Lines.Text: pull the thread through the needle so that there is an equal length on each side of the needle .
tie the end of the thread together by making a knot .
making an additional knot over the first makes it more secure .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the thread through the needle so that there is an equal length on each side of the needle. Tie the end of the thread together by making a knot. Making an additional knot over the first makes it more secure.

Lines.Text: starting on the inside of the shirt , poke the needle through toward the side that is right-side-out .
sew over the original thread for about half an inch to ensure that it's thread won't rip again .

Steps.Text_raw: Starting on the inside of the shirt, poke the needle through toward the side that is right-side-out. Sew over the original thread for about half an inch to ensure that it's thread won't rip again.

Lines.Text: once the needle and thread is pulled through the side that is right-side-out , you will push it back through as close to the original hole as you can .
doing this will make the visible hem as hidden as possible .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the needle and thread is pulled through the side that is right-side-out, you will push it back through as close to the original hole as you can. Doing this will make the visible hem as hidden as possible.

Lines.Text: when you're back on the inside of the hem , make the next stitch a couple millimeters over and diagonal from the first .

Steps.Text_raw: When you're back on the inside of the hem, make the next stitch a couple millimeters over and diagonal from the first.

Lines.Text: continue this pattern so that the inside has diagonal stitches , and the outside has small , staggered dots .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue this pattern so that the inside has diagonal stitches, and the outside has small, staggered dots.

Lines.Text: finish sewing the hem . make sure the last stitch is on the inside of the shirt .
make a knot where you intend for the pattern to stop .
it's important to tie the knot as close to the fabric as possible . doing this secures the stitching .

Steps.Text_raw: Finish sewing the hem. Make sure the last stitch is on the inside of the shirt. Make a knot where you intend for the pattern to stop. It's important to tie the knot as close to the fabric as possible. Doing this secures the stitching.

Lines.Text: cut off excess thread .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut off excess thread.

Title: LG G Watch R Power Button

Lines.Text: power off your watch before disassembling it .
place the watch upside down on a hard surface so that its back case is facing upright .
use a t4 torx star screwdriver to remove the four 4.0 mm torx screws from the corners of the back case .

Steps.Text_raw: Power off your watch before disassembling it. Place the watch upside down on a hard surface so that its back case is facing upright. Use a T4 Torx Star screwdriver to remove the four 4.0 mm Torx screws from the corners of the back case.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to pry open the back case from both sides of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to pry open the back case from both sides of the watch.

Lines.Text: remove the back case .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the back case.

Lines.Text: with a plastic opening tool , disconnect the four connectors on the top of the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: With a plastic opening tool, disconnect the four connectors on the top of the motherboard.

Lines.Text: remove three 3.0 mm phillips screws on the edges of the motherboard with a phillips 000 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove three 3.0 mm Phillips screws on the edges of the motherboard with a  Phillips #000 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: grasp the edges of the motherboard and slide it slightly towards the right to remove it from its case .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp the edges of the motherboard and slide it slightly towards the right to remove it from its case.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to pry the battery out of the device .
you may need to use a stronger prying force due to the adhesive that secures the battery to the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to pry the battery out of the device. You may need to use a stronger prying force due to the adhesive that secures the battery to the case.

Lines.Text: pry the battery housing from the top right corner using a spudger .
once loosened , remove the battery housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry the battery housing from the top right corner using a spudger. Once loosened, remove the battery housing.

Lines.Text: on the power button , locate a small grey washer on the interior side of the watch .
use a pair of tweezers or another pointed object to push the washer out of its socket , and remove the power button .

Steps.Text_raw: On the power button, locate a small grey washer on the interior side of the watch. Use a pair of tweezers or another pointed object to push the washer out of its socket, and remove the power button.

Subject: Power Button

Lines.Text: grab the pair of jordans you would like to repaint and wipe the midsole with a toothbrush or cotton ball to remove any dirt or dust ( midsoles are already clean in this picture ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the pair of Jordans you would like to repaint and wipe the midsole with a toothbrush or cotton ball to remove any dirt or dust (midsoles are already clean in this picture).

Lines.Text: using a metal file , carefully scratch off the paint closest to the leather .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a metal file, carefully scratch off the paint closest to the leather.

Lines.Text: wet a cotton ball with acetone and lightly scrub the leftover paint until the surface is smooth and most or all the paint is removed .
i recommend using rubber gloves to protect your skin from the acetone , but it's not necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Wet a cotton ball with acetone and lightly scrub the leftover paint until the surface is smooth and most or all the paint is removed. I recommend using rubber gloves to protect your skin from the acetone, but it's not necessary.

Lines.Text: remove any dust , dirt , and excess paint with your fingers or cotton balls and water .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove any dust, dirt, and excess paint with your fingers or cotton balls and water.

Lines.Text: carefully place painter's tape along the edges of the part of the shoe you would like to paint .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully place painter's tape along the edges of the part of the shoe you would like to paint.

Lines.Text: grab your paint and paint brush and thinly coat the desired area .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab your paint and paint brush and thinly coat the desired area.

Lines.Text: wait until your paint dries and apply another coat . repeat this step 2-4 more times or until you're content with the shade of your color . this picture depicts the shade of white after 5 coats .
for best results , wait 24 hours between each paint coat .

Steps.Text_raw: Wait until your paint dries and apply another coat. Repeat this step 2-4 more times or until you're content with the shade of your color. This picture depicts the shade of white after 5 coats. For best results, wait 24 hours between each paint coat.

Lines.Text: after applying your final coat , allow 24-48 hours for the paint to dry before wearing . once your paint is dry , remove the tape and you're good to go !

Steps.Text_raw: After applying your final coat, allow 24-48 hours for the paint to dry before wearing. Once your paint is dry, remove the tape and you're good to go!

Title: How To Fix A Hole In Khaki Pants

Lines.Text: examine the damaged area .
make sure to clean all the debris from the tear .

Steps.Text_raw: Examine the damaged area. Make sure to clean all the debris from the tear.

Lines.Text: flip your pants inside out .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip your pants inside out.

Lines.Text: pinch hole together .
make sure there is no gaps showing .

Steps.Text_raw: Pinch hole together. Make sure there is no gaps showing.

Lines.Text: pin needle and thread through pants .
use more thread than needed so you will have enough .
make sure your hand is not directly behind the needle where you are poking . this will prevent you from pricking yourself .

Steps.Text_raw: Pin needle and thread through pants. Use more thread than needed so you will have enough. Make sure your hand is not  directly behind the needle where you are poking. This will prevent you from pricking yourself.

Lines.Text: pull needle and thread through pants until there is only 2 inches of thread left .
tie a knot at the end of the remaining 2 inches .
it can be any measurement , but 2 inches makes it easier to tie a knot without wasting too much thread .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull needle and thread through pants  until there is only 2 inches of thread left. Tie a knot at the end of the remaining 2 inches. It can be any measurement, but 2 inches makes it easier to tie a knot without wasting too much thread.

Lines.Text: take the needle and pin it through right next to the previous spot .
pull all the way through until thread is tight .
repeat this process until you reach the end of the hole .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the needle and pin it through right next to the previous spot. Pull all the way through until thread is tight. Repeat this process until you reach the end of the hole.

Lines.Text: wrap the thread three times around the needle .
pull the needle until the thread is tight .
this will tie a knot at the end .

Steps.Text_raw: Wrap the thread three times around the needle. Pull the needle until the thread is tight. This will tie a knot at the end.

Lines.Text: take the scissors and cut the excess string remaining .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the scissors and cut the excess string remaining.

Lines.Text: now put your khaki pants on because they are now wearable again and practically new !

Steps.Text_raw: Now put your khaki pants on because they are now wearable again and practically new!

Lines.Text: locate the hole for the pin you would like to remove .
insert the sim card eject tool ( a safety pin may work as well ) inthe hole . make sure to insert in the hole on the back side of the arrow .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the hole for the pin you would like to remove. Insert the Sim Card Eject tool (a safety pin may work as well) inthe hole. Make sure to insert in the hole on the back side of the arrow.

Lines.Text: determine the desired amount of links you would like to add or remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Determine the desired amount of links you would like to add or remove.

Lines.Text: to remove links :
use the same process used in step 2 to remove the second link pin .
the two link pins and the links should now be detached .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove links: Use the same process used in Step 2 to remove the second link pin. The two link pins and the links should now be detached.

Lines.Text: to add links :
push both link pins back into the watch . make sure to insert the link pin on the front side of the arrow .
lightly tap a hammer until pins are flush against both sides of the watchband .
when adding links , be sure to insert the links at the same time as the link pins .

Steps.Text_raw: To add links: Push both link pins back into the watch. Make sure to insert the link pin on the front side of the arrow. Lightly tap a hammer until pins are flush against both sides of the watchband. When adding links, be sure to insert the links at the same time as the link pins.

Lines.Text: for micro adjustments , push the sim card eject tool into the adjustable side of the clasp . carefully move pins to the correct fitting holes .
do your best to not let the pins slip outside the metal clasp as they are difficult to get back in .

Steps.Text_raw: For micro adjustments, push the Sim Card Eject tool into the adjustable side of the clasp. Carefully move pins to the correct fitting holes. Do your best to not let the pins slip outside the metal clasp as they are difficult to get back in.

Lines.Text: insert spring into the spring bar .
insert the spring bar pin on both sides of the spring in the spring bar .
this is the spring bar pin .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert spring into the spring bar. Insert the spring bar pin on both sides of the spring in the spring bar. This is the spring bar pin.

Lines.Text: put the spring bar and spring bar pins through the end of the clasp .
guide one spring bar pin into the hole on the clasp shell . hold your finger on the other side of the spring bar to keep the parts together .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the spring bar and spring bar pins through the end of the clasp. Guide one spring bar pin into the hole on the clasp shell. Hold your finger on the other side of the spring bar to keep the parts together.

Lines.Text: squeeze the spring bar so it fits within the metal sides of the clasp .
guide the other side of the spring bar into the other hole .

Steps.Text_raw: Squeeze the spring bar so it fits within the metal sides of the clasp. Guide the other side of the spring bar into the other hole.

Lines.Text: remove the wrist strap by peeling back the rubber starting from one corner of the watch face . continue peeling the rubber away from the watch face until the strap is completely off .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the wrist strap by peeling back the rubber starting from one corner of the watch face. Continue peeling the rubber away from the watch face until the strap is completely off.

Lines.Text: starting from an edge , wedge a metal spudger in between the screen and the chrome trim ring and pry , lifting the screen outwards .
some force is needed due to adhesive seal .

Steps.Text_raw: Starting from an edge, wedge a metal spudger in between the screen and the chrome trim ring and pry, lifting the screen outwards. Some force is needed due to adhesive seal.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to gently pry upwards on the plastic motherboard assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to  gently pry upwards on the plastic motherboard assembly.

Lines.Text: locate the ribbon assembly attaching the display to the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the ribbon assembly attaching the display to the motherboard.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to detach the glass screen/ led display ribbon connector from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to detach the glass screen/ LED Display ribbon connector from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: now the watch should be in three separate pieces .

Steps.Text_raw: Now the watch should be in three separate pieces.

Lines.Text: locate the speaker in the upper left corner of the housing .
locate the speaker ribbon connector directly below the speaker .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the speaker in the upper left corner of the housing. Locate the speaker ribbon connector directly below the speaker.

Lines.Text: use the plastic opening tool to gently pry upwards on the speaker's ribbon connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the plastic opening tool to gently pry upwards on the speaker's ribbon connector.

Lines.Text: use the spudger to gently pry upwards on the speaker housing .
note : the speaker housing is attached with adhesive , therefore , some force is required .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the  spudger to gently pry upwards on the speaker housing. Note: The speaker housing is attached with adhesive, therefore, some force is required.

Lines.Text: remove the wrist strap by peeling back the rubber starting from one corner of the watch face . continue peeling the rubber away from the watch face until the strap is completely off .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the wrist strap by peeling back the rubber starting from one corner of the watch face. Continue peeling the rubber away from the watch face until the strap is completely off.

some force is needed due to adhesive seal .

Steps.Text_raw: Starting from an edge, wedge a metal spudger in between the screen and the chrome trim ring and pry, lifting the screen outwards. Some force is needed due to adhesive seal.

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to  gently pry upwards on the plastic motherboard assembly.

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the ribbon assembly attaching the display to the motherboard.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to detach the glass screen/ led display ribbon connector from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to detach the glass screen/ LED Display ribbon connector from the motherboard.

Title: How to Repair a Hole on the Shoe Sole

Lines.Text: scrape off any extra material near the area of the hole that is not part of the outsole of the shoe .
clean the outsole with a wet paper towel .
clean and dry the outsole with a paper towel before starting .

Steps.Text_raw: Scrape off any extra material near the area of the hole that is not part of the outsole of the shoe. Clean the outsole with a wet paper towel. Clean and dry the outsole with a paper towel before starting.

Lines.Text: use the 120 grit sandpaper to roughen the edges of the hole on the outsole .
this helps the shoe goo adhere more readily to the outsole .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the 120 grit sandpaper to roughen the edges of the hole on the outsole. This helps the shoe goo adhere more readily to the outsole.

Lines.Text: pull the insole out of the shoe .
apply duct tape inside the shoe ( on the other side of the hole ) .
make sure the duct tape covers up the entire hole , so there will be no shoe goo going through the sole into the shoe .
for holes that ripped through the shoe sole and to the inside of the shoe , this step is very important .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the insole out of the shoe. Apply duct tape inside the shoe (on the other side of the hole). Make sure the duct tape covers up the entire hole, so there will be no shoe goo going through the sole into the shoe. For holes that ripped through the shoe sole and to the inside of the shoe, this step is very important.

Lines.Text: apply the shoe goo to fill up the hole on the outsole .
apply enough shoe goo to cover up all of the areas of the hole .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply the shoe goo to fill up the hole on the outsole. Apply enough shoe goo to cover up all of the areas of the hole.

Lines.Text: spread the shoe goo evenly with an ice cube to cover up any uncovered area .
the shoe goo will not stick to the ice cube , and you will be able to easily spread the shoe goo . the coldness of the ice also helps the shoe goo set in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Spread the shoe goo evenly with an ice cube to cover up any uncovered area. The shoe goo will not stick to the ice cube, and you will be able to easily spread the shoe goo. The coldness of the ice also helps the shoe goo set in place.

Lines.Text: let the shoe sit for 24 hours for the shoe goo to dry .
in this period , do not let any objects come into contact with the glue .

Steps.Text_raw: Let the shoe sit for 24 hours for the shoe goo to dry. In this period, do not let any objects come into contact with the glue.

Lines.Text: after 24 hours , remove the duct tape from the shoe .
place the insole back into the shoe .

Steps.Text_raw: After 24 hours, remove the duct tape from the shoe. Place the insole back into the shoe.

Lines.Text: use the 120 grit sand paper to rub the surface of the outsole until the shoe goo portion is smooth .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the 120 grit sand paper to rub the surface of the outsole until the shoe goo portion is smooth.

Lines.Text: remove the wristband by sliding the metal pins located on both sides of the wrist band , and pulling the wristband off .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the wristband by sliding the metal pins located on both sides of the wrist band, and pulling the wristband off.

Lines.Text: use a t5 torx screwdriver to remove the 4 ( 0.4 mm ) screws located on the back of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a T5 Torx Screwdriver to remove the 4 (0.4 mm) screws located on the back of the watch.

Lines.Text: slide the opening tool in between the two halves of the case and slide along the edge of the watch while gently prying the back cover away from the face of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the opening tool in between the two halves of the case and slide along the edge of the watch while gently prying the back cover away from the face of the watch.

Lines.Text: use a pair of tweezers to peel the battery ribbon cable off of the back cover .
avoid damaging the gold terminals on the ribbon cable .
when reassembling , make sure that the yellow strip snaps back on to the black pin .
the pin is located , and marked on the picture .
pull up on the tab that says , pull , the battery will lift straight out .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a pair of tweezers to peel the battery ribbon cable off of the back cover. Avoid damaging the gold terminals on the ribbon cable. When reassembling, make sure that the yellow strip snaps back on to the black pin. The pin is located, and marked on the picture. Pull up on the tab that says, “Pull”, the battery will lift straight out.

Lines.Text: use a pair of tweezers to remove the rubber gasket . it should come off with ease .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a pair of tweezers to remove the rubber gasket. It should come off with ease.

Lines.Text: using the fine tweezers , pull up on the speaker ribbon cable until separated from the back cover . make sure to approach it like in the picture otherwise it may not come off cleanly .
to lift out the speaker , place the tweezers underneath the speaker at the top left corner of the speaker and pry it up .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the fine tweezers, pull up on the speaker ribbon cable until separated from the back cover. Make sure to approach it like in the picture otherwise it may not come off cleanly. To lift out the speaker, place the tweezers underneath the speaker at the top left corner of the speaker and pry it up.

Lines.Text: remove the wristband by sliding the metal pins located on both sides of the wrist band , and pulling the wristband off .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the wristband by sliding the metal pins located on both sides of the wrist band, and pulling the wristband off.

Lines.Text: use a t5 torx screwdriver to remove the 4 ( 0.4 mm ) screws located on the back of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a T5 Torx Screwdriver to remove the 4 (0.4 mm) screws located on the back of the watch.

Lines.Text: slide the opening tool in between the two halves of the case and slide along the edge of the watch while gently prying the back cover away from the face of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the opening tool in between the two halves of the case and slide along the edge of the watch while gently prying the back cover away from the face of the watch.

Lines.Text: use a pair of tweezers to peel the battery ribbon cable off of the back cover .
avoid damaging the gold terminals on the ribbon cable .
when reassembling , make sure that the yellow strip snaps back on to the black pin .
the pin is located , and marked on the picture .
pull up on the tab that says , pull , the battery will lift straight out .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a pair of tweezers to peel the battery ribbon cable off of the back cover. Avoid damaging the gold terminals on the ribbon cable. When reassembling, make sure that the yellow strip snaps back on to the black pin. The pin is located, and marked on the picture. Pull up on the tab that says, “Pull”, the battery will lift straight out.

Lines.Text: using the plastic opening tool , pull up on the flex connector . it will come off the motherboard , but will stay attached to the cover like a hinge .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the plastic opening tool, pull up on the flex connector.  It will come off the motherboard, but will stay attached to the cover like a hinge.

Lines.Text: it is recommended to use antistatic wrist wrap whenever removing the motherboard .
place the plastic opening tool underneath the motherboard at this location . gently pry the motherboard away from the front cover . it should pop off and be free from the cover .
attached to the motherboard is the infrared led light . to replace the ir led , you may need to replace the entire motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: It is recommended to use antistatic wrist wrap whenever removing the motherboard. Place the plastic opening tool underneath the motherboard at this location.  Gently pry the motherboard away from the front cover.  It should pop off and be free from the cover. Attached to the motherboard is the infrared LED Light. To replace the IR LED, you may need to replace the entire motherboard.

Lines.Text: remove the wristband by sliding the metal pins located on both sides of the wrist band , and pulling the wristband off .

Lines.Text: use a t5 torx screwdriver to remove the 4 ( 0.4 mm ) screws located on the back of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a T5 Torx Screwdriver to remove the 4 (0.4 mm) screws located on the back of the watch.

Lines.Text: slide the opening tool in between the two halves of the case and slide along the edge of the watch while gently prying the back cover away from the face of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the opening tool in between the two halves of the case and slide along the edge of the watch while gently prying the back cover away from the face of the watch.

Lines.Text: use a pair of tweezers to peel the battery ribbon cable off of the back cover .
avoid damaging the gold terminals on the ribbon cable .
when reassembling , make sure that the yellow strip snaps back on to the black pin .
the pin is located , and marked on the picture .
pull up on the tab that says , pull , the battery will lift straight out .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a pair of tweezers to peel the battery ribbon cable off of the back cover. Avoid damaging the gold terminals on the ribbon cable. When reassembling, make sure that the yellow strip snaps back on to the black pin. The pin is located, and marked on the picture. Pull up on the tab that says, “Pull”, the battery will lift straight out.

Lines.Text: using the plastic opening tool , pull up on the flex connector . it will come off the motherboard , but will stay attached to the cover like a hinge .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the plastic opening tool, pull up on the flex connector.  It will come off the motherboard, but will stay attached to the cover like a hinge.

Lines.Text: it is recommended to use antistatic wrist wrap whenever removing the motherboard .
place the plastic opening tool underneath the motherboard at this location . gently pry the motherboard away from the front cover . it should pop off and be free from the cover .
attached to the motherboard is the infrared led light . to replace the ir led , you may need to replace the entire motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: It is recommended to use antistatic wrist wrap whenever removing the motherboard. Place the plastic opening tool underneath the motherboard at this location.  Gently pry the motherboard away from the front cover.  It should pop off and be free from the cover. Attached to the motherboard is the infrared LED Light. To replace the IR LED, you may need to replace the entire motherboard.

Lines.Text: using fine tweezers , pull the home button ribbon cable up and away from the front cover .
like with the battery's ribbon cable , there is a pin that holds the pad in place . it is in the area marked . however , the models' pin had be broken .

Steps.Text_raw: Using fine tweezers, pull the home button ribbon cable up and away from the front cover. Like with the battery's ribbon cable, there is a pin that holds the pad in place.  It is in the area marked. However, the models' pin had be broken.

Lines.Text: using the plastic opening tool , pry the home button away from the front cover .
the whole home button mechanism should lift right out .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the plastic opening tool, pry the home button away from the front cover. The whole home button mechanism should lift right out.

Lines.Text: hold the the metal screwdriver , with a t5 torx bit , in your dominant hand .
hold the rubber screwdriver , with a hex t6 torx bit , in your other hand .
while holding the rubber screwdriver in place , simultaneously unscrew the pin ( counterclockwise ) with the metal screwdriver in your dominant hand .

Steps.Text_raw: Hold the the metal screwdriver, with a T5 Torx bit, in your dominant hand. Hold the rubber screwdriver, with a Hex T6 Torx bit, in your other hand. While holding the rubber screwdriver in place, simultaneously unscrew the pin (counterclockwise) with the metal screwdriver in your dominant hand.

Lines.Text: once the 1 mm screw is removed , reinsert the metal screwdriver in that same hole .
gently push the strap's pin out . it will begin to protrude from the other end .
use your fingers to grab the exposed pin and slide it free . the strap should now be disconnected from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the 1mm screw is removed, reinsert  the metal screwdriver in that same hole. Gently push the strap's pin out. It will begin to protrude from the other end. Use your fingers to grab the exposed pin and slide it free.  The strap should now be disconnected from the device.

Lines.Text: place a heated iopener over the display to loosen the adhesive .
after about a minute , the iopener may be removed .
for more in depth instructions on using the iopener , refer to the guide .

Lines.Text: place the blue plastic opening tool in-between the screen and plastic casing of the watch and slowly pry up one side of the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the blue plastic opening tool in-between the screen and plastic casing of the watch and slowly pry up one side of the screen.

Lines.Text: once the first side has come free , wedge the blue pick in between the screen and watch unit on that side .
complete one pass around the perimeter of the screen to break the adhesive bond on all four sides .
insert it a minimal distance to avoid damaging internal components .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the first side has come free, wedge the blue pick in between the screen and watch unit on that side. Complete one pass around the perimeter of the screen to break the adhesive bond on all four sides. Insert it a minimal distance to avoid damaging internal components.

Lines.Text: use the blue plastic opening tool to pry up the side of the glass . raise it to a point where your fingernail can fit in the gap .
do the same on the opposite side of the device until you have a good grip of the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the blue plastic opening tool to pry up the side of the glass. Raise it to a point where your fingernail can fit in the gap. Do the same on the opposite side of the device until you have a good grip of the screen.

Lines.Text: obtain a careful grip of the screen from two of its sides .
slowly lift the screen off of the case . separate it just enough so as not to damage the connection to the motherboard .

upon completing this step , the screen should be free from the rest of the device .

Lines.Text: follow previous guides until you've exposed the battery as shown .
begin by removing the battery connector tab .
be sure not to use a metal implement or your fingers to remove this tab . doing so may cause personal harm or damage to the electrical components .

Steps.Text_raw: Follow previous guides until you've exposed the battery as shown. Begin by removing the battery connector tab. Be sure not to use a metal implement or your fingers to remove this tab. Doing so may cause personal harm or damage to the electrical components.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening pick to gently pry out the battery as shown .
the battery is lithium polymer , follow safe handling procedures and do not deform it upon removal .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening pick to gently pry out the battery as shown. The battery is Lithium Polymer, follow safe handling procedures and DO NOT deform it upon removal.

Lines.Text: with the battery loose from the case , rotate it to expose the attached tab
gently pry up the attached tab with a fingernail .
keep the vibrator , circled in red , as you may need to solder it to the new battery upon re-installation later .

Steps.Text_raw: With the battery loose from the case, rotate it to expose the attached tab Gently pry up the attached tab with a fingernail. Keep the vibrator, circled in red, as you may need to solder it to the new battery upon re-installation later.

Lines.Text: remove the four 2.4 mm screws with a 00 phillips head screwdriver .
make an effort not to damage any nearby components of the motherboard with the screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 2.4 mm screws with a PH00 Phillips head screwdriver. Make an effort not to damage any nearby components of the motherboard with the screwdriver.

Lines.Text: use the spudger to pry up the board from the case .
insert the spudger a minimum distance beneath the board as there are components below .
wiggle the exposed side of the board from each end until it comes free .
use proper electrostatic discharge safety when removing and handling the board .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the spudger to pry up the board from the case. Insert the spudger a minimum distance beneath the board as there are components below. Wiggle the exposed side of the board from each end until it comes free. Use proper [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electrostatic_discharge| electrostatic discharge] safety when removing and handling the board.

Lines.Text: remove the gps antenna by sliding it away from the board .
keep track of the antenna and add it to the new board upon replacement .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the GPS antenna by sliding it away from the board. Keep track of the antenna and add it to the new board upon replacement.

Lines.Text: orient the crescent shaped retaining clip so the open section faces the bottom of the device .
remove the retaining clip by pulling up away from the device with the precision tweezers .
be careful , the tweezers are quite sharp !

Lines.Text: after the retaining clip is removed , the spring and button will pop out .
with these very small components free from your device , take care not to lose them .
the spring is slightly compressed , so the button may pop out once the clip is removed .

Steps.Text_raw: After the retaining clip is removed, the spring and button will pop out. With these very small components free from your device, take care not to lose them. The spring is slightly compressed, so the button may pop out once the clip is removed.

slowly lift the screen off of the case . separate it just enough so as not to damage the connection to the motherboard .

Lines.Text: detach the orange tab that connects the screen to the motherboard with a gentle uplift using a plastic opening tool .
upon completing this step , the screen should be free from the rest of the device .

Lines.Text: follow previous guides until you've exposed the battery as shown .
begin by removing the battery connector tab .
be sure not to use a metal implement or your fingers to remove this tab . doing so may cause personal harm or damage to the electrical components .

the battery is lithium polymer , follow safe handling procedures and do not deform it upon removal .

Lines.Text: hold the the metal screwdriver , with a t5 torx bit , in your dominant hand .
hold the rubber screwdriver , with a hex t6 torx bit , in your other hand .
while holding the rubber screwdriver in place , simultaneously unscrew the pin ( counterclockwise ) with the metal screwdriver in your dominant hand .

gently push the strap's pin out . it will begin to protrude from the other end .
use your fingers to grab the exposed pin and slide it free . the strap should now be disconnected from the device .

Lines.Text: the plastic frame is clipped inside the steel body with four clips , two each on the left and the right side of the watch , near the corners . you can stick a small screwdriver into the cutouts right above the clips and gently lever the plastic frame up , corner by corner .
once the clips are released , use a pair of tweezers to grab onto the black plastic frame and remove the internal hardware .
adhesive on the back side of the battery holds the internal components to the front case .
use tweezers or a plastic opening tool to disconnect the ribbon cable from the motherboard .

Title: How to repair a Snag in Knit Clothing

Lines.Text: pull a stringed needle through the loop of the snag .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull a stringed needle through the loop of the snag.

Lines.Text: tie a knot at the end of the snag loop .

Steps.Text_raw: Tie a knot at the end of the snag loop.

Lines.Text: put the needle at the base of the snag .
push the needle through the base to the other side .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the needle at the base of the snag. Push the needle through the base to the other side.

Lines.Text: flip your clothing item over or inside out to see where the needle was pushed through .
pull the needle all the way through . you want it tight enough that you have the whole snag through , but not tight enough to start pulling through more of the clothing item .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip your clothing item over or inside out to see where the needle was pushed through. Pull the needle all the way through. You want it tight enough that you have the whole snag through, but not tight enough to start pulling through more of the clothing item.

Lines.Text: tie a knot at the base of the snag .

remember : this is is after you pushed the thread to the inside of your clothing . this pushed the snag to the inside . on the inside snag is where you're tying the new knot where it is coming through .
double knot it for extra security .

Steps.Text_raw: Tie a knot at the base of the snag. Remember: This is is after you pushed the thread to the inside of your clothing.  This pushed the snag to the inside. On the inside snag is where you're tying the new knot where it is coming through. Double knot it for extra security.

Lines.Text: cut the extra snag and thread off , leaving a little string near the knot . this leaves a little tail . do not cut off the knot or tail .
the small knot and tail makes sure the snag doesn't pull through again . if cut , it could unravel the clothing item .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut the extra snag and thread off, leaving a little string near the knot. This leaves a little "tail". Do not cut off the knot or "tail". The small knot and "tail" makes sure the snag doesn't pull through again. If cut, it could unravel the clothing item.

Lines.Text: hold the ifit band in both hands , with your thumbs on either side of the tracker pod at the center of the wristband .

Steps.Text_raw: Hold the iFit band in both hands, with your thumbs on either side of the tracker pod at the center of the wristband.

Lines.Text: using your index finger , gently push the tracker pod out of the wristband . it may help to do this over a table or other surface so the tracker pod doesnt fall on the floor and break .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your index finger, gently push the tracker pod out of the wristband. It may help to do this over a table or other surface so the tracker pod doesn’t fall on the floor and break.

Lines.Text: once the tracker pod is freed from the wristband , remove the back of the tracker pod using the plastic opening tool . the tools curved edge should be pointed toward the back of the device to avoid scratching the front display .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the tracker pod is freed from the wristband, remove the back of the tracker pod using the plastic opening tool. The tool’s curved edge should be pointed toward the back of the device to avoid scratching the front display.

Lines.Text: using the curved metal precision tweezers , gently lift the battery out of the tracker pod .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the curved metal precision tweezers, gently lift the battery out of the tracker pod.

Lines.Text: place the new battery in the tracker pod . make sure the positive side of the battery is face down in the cavity of the tracker pod .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the new battery in the tracker pod. Make sure the positive side of the battery is face down in the cavity of the tracker pod.

Lines.Text: to close the tracker pod , place the top and bottom pieces between fingers as shown and snap them together .

Steps.Text_raw: To close the tracker pod, place the top and bottom pieces between fingers as shown and snap them together.

Toolbox.Name: scissors ballpoint needle no. 18 tapestry needle thread and fabric adhesive

Lines.Text: identify the snag that you would like to correct .

Steps.Text_raw: Identify the snag that you would like to correct.

Lines.Text: insert the sharp end of your ballpoint needle through the center of the snag .
carefully turn the jeans inside out , while maintaining the placement of the ballpoint needle .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the sharp end of your ballpoint needle through the center of the snag. Carefully turn the jeans inside out, while maintaining the placement of the ballpoint needle.
Tools_extracted: scissors ballpoint needle no. 18 tapestry needle thread and fabric adhesive

Lines.Text: allow the ballpoint needle to stand vertically . this will happen naturally .
take your no . 18 tapestry needle and gently maneuver all of the loose strings from the snagged denim to the inside of the jeans . you will position your needle to pull the loose strings upward .
caution : make sure there are no loose strings left outside of the jeans .

Steps.Text_raw: Allow the ballpoint needle to stand vertically. This will happen naturally. Take your No. 18 tapestry needle and gently maneuver all of the loose strings from the snagged denim to the inside of the jeans. You will position your needle to pull the loose strings upward. CAUTION: make sure there are no loose strings left outside of the jeans.
Tools_extracted: scissors ballpoint needle no. 18 tapestry needle thread and fabric adhesive

Lines.Text: string the no . 18 tapestry needle with your thread .

Steps.Text_raw: String the No. 18 tapestry needle with your thread.
Tools_extracted: scissors ballpoint needle no. 18 tapestry needle thread and fabric adhesive

Lines.Text: tie both ends of the thread that is threaded through the needle to form a knot .
the knot should be small and tight

Steps.Text_raw: Tie both ends of the thread that is threaded through the needle to form a knot. The knot should be small and tight
Tools_extracted: scissors ballpoint needle no. 18 tapestry needle thread and fabric adhesive

Lines.Text: make another knot , this time pull thread slowly and tightly around the snag .
get the knot as close as possible to the surface of the denim jean .
pull the knot as tight as possible .

Steps.Text_raw: Make another knot, this time pull thread slowly and tightly around the snag. Get the knot as close as possible to the surface of the denim jean. Pull the knot as tight as possible.

allow the adhesive at least 20 minutes to dry .

Title: ASUS ZenWatch Charging Cradle Circuit board Replacement

Lines.Text: using a metal spudger gently pry the plastic outer case apart
pry open a little bit on each side before trying to open fully

Steps.Text_raw: Using a metal spudger gently pry the plastic outer case apart Pry open a little bit on each side before trying to open fully

Lines.Text: use the ph0 sized phillips screwdriver to remove the three screws ( 2 mm ) holding the board to the cradle .
gently pry up with your hands to pull the board off .
don't grab directly on the usb port as you may loosen or bust the connections .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the PH0 sized Phillips screwdriver to remove the three screws (2mm) holding the board to the cradle. Gently pry up with your hands to pull the board off. Don't grab directly on the USB port as you may loosen or bust the connections.

Subject: Charging Cradle Circuit board

Lines.Text: use a torx t9 screwdriver to remove these four . 8 mm screws and seperate the housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a Torx T9 screwdriver to remove these four .8mm screws and seperate the housing.

Lines.Text: use a spudger tool to disengage the power ribbon from the main board . once the ribbon is disconnected you can separate the bottom piece of the housing that holds the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a spudger tool to disengage the power ribbon from the main board. Once the ribbon is disconnected you can separate the bottom piece of the housing that holds the battery.

Lines.Text: use the spudger tool again and wedge it in between the battery and the housing , pry until the battery starts to separate from the adhesive holding it in place . once you have the battery disconnected you are ready to replace it .

despite the fact that the metal spudger is shown being used in this step , make sure to use a plastic opening tool or nylon spudger to pry up the battery . the metal spudger has a much larger chance of puncturing the battery , and thus should not be used .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the spudger tool again and wedge it in between the battery and the housing, pry until the battery starts to separate from the adhesive holding it in place. The metal spudger has a much larger chance of puncturing the battery, and thus should not be used.

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the separated sole away from the bottom of the shoe. Clean the bottom surface of the shoe with a cleaning wipe.

Lines.Text: clean the top of the sole .
the shoe needs to be clean of all dirt and completely dry before continuing to the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: Clean the top of the sole. The shoe needs to be clean of all dirt and completely dry before continuing to the next step.

Lines.Text: apply a thin bead of glue along the top edge of the sole and across the interior surface of the sole .
immediately continue to the next step after applying glue .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply a thin bead of glue along the top edge of the sole and across the interior surface of the sole. Immediately continue to the next step after applying glue.

Lines.Text: push the sole back to its original position on the bottom of the shoe .
hold the shoe and sole together for 30 seconds .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the sole back to its original position on the bottom of the shoe. Hold the shoe and sole together for 30 seconds.

Title: Samsung Galaxy Gear Display Housing Replacement

Lines.Text: use a t5 torx screwdriver to remove the four 4.0 mm screws on the back of the device .
be sure your device is turned off .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a T5 Torx screwdriver to remove the four 4.0 mm screws on the back of the device. Be sure your device is turned off.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to separate the display housing from from the device .
to ensure you don't damage your device , insert the opening tool and slide it the entire length of the gap on both sides of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to separate the display housing from from the device. To ensure you don't damage your device, insert the opening tool and slide it the entire length of the gap on both sides of the device.

Lines.Text: gently pry back the metal flap on top of the connector .
locate the two 2.0 mm black screws and unscrew using a phillips 00 bit . the connector will detach from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pry back the metal flap on top of the connector. Locate the two 2.0 mm black screws and unscrew using a Phillips PH00 bit. The connector will detach from the device.

using a heat gun , heat up the display for 4 to 5 minutes , making sure the move the heat gun around to distribute the heat around the display . this heats up the adhesive making the motherboard easier to remove

slowly pry up the motherboard from the display .

do the same with the adjacent band , but there will be no camera ribbon to pass through the watch body .

you will only need the watch/strap component so you can set aside the lcd/motherboard component .

loosen the bracket by prying underneath the metal plating with the plastic opening tool . remove the bracket and set it to the side .
the battery should now be exposed .

slowly tug on the pull tag and remove the battery from the watch .

Title: How to Patch a Canvas Shoe

Lines.Text: use the scissors to make sure the specific place in which you are applying the shoe-goo is free of any long loose strings or excess fabric .
this will allow the goo to stick better and last longer on the shoe .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the scissors to make sure the specific place in which you are applying the shoe-goo is free of any long loose strings or excess fabric. This will allow the goo to stick better and last longer on the shoe.

Lines.Text: slightly wet the sponge to rub and clean the torn area of the shoe

Steps.Text_raw: Slightly wet the sponge to rub and clean the torn area of the shoe

Lines.Text: once the shoe is free of excess material , and clean as can be , you are ready to apply the goo onto the shoe . apply a medium amount along the rip or hole on the desired spot .
gloves are recommended for this , but are not required .
do not squeeze huge globs onto the shoe , in this case more is not always better .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the shoe is free of excess material, and clean as can be, you are ready to apply the goo onto the shoe. Apply a medium amount along the rip or hole on the desired spot. Gloves are recommended for this, but are not required. DO NOT squeeze huge globs onto the shoe, in this case more is not always better.

Lines.Text: spread the shoe goo across the rip in the fabric with the popsicle stick .
for the best appearance , make the goo as smooth as possible and try not to get the shoe goo any where else besides the rip

Steps.Text_raw: Spread the shoe goo across the rip in the fabric with the popsicle stick. For the best appearance, make the goo as smooth as possible and try not to get the shoe goo any where else besides the rip

Lines.Text: let shoe dry for at least 24 hours .
for maximum strength , let shoe sit for 2-3 days .

Steps.Text_raw: Let shoe dry for at least 24 hours. For maximum strength, let shoe sit for 2-3 days.

Lines.Text: once the shoe-goo is completely dry , your shoe is now ready to wear . go out , hit the town , show off your fresh kicks .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the shoe-goo is completely dry, your shoe is now ready to wear. Go out, hit the town, show off your fresh kicks.

Lines.Text: open the umbrella into its proper position .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the umbrella into its proper position.

Lines.Text: identify the broken stretcher that needs to be repaired .

Steps.Text_raw: Identify the broken stretcher that needs to be repaired.

Lines.Text: close the umbrella halfway to release the tension in the stretchers .
this makes it easier to line up the holes in the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: Close the umbrella halfway to release the tension in the stretchers. This makes it easier to line up the holes in the next step.

Lines.Text: take the two pieces of the broken stretcher and line up the rivet holes .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the two pieces of the broken stretcher and line up the rivet holes.

Lines.Text: pass the 6 piece of wire through the rivet holes .

Steps.Text_raw: Pass the 6" piece of wire through the rivet holes.

Lines.Text: wrap the wire around the stretcher and thread it through the holes again .
repeat until there is no more room to pass the wire through .
may need to use the pliers to get a better grip on the wire so it can be pulled tight .

Steps.Text_raw: Wrap the wire around the stretcher and thread it through the holes again. Repeat until there is no more room to pass the wire through. May need to use the pliers to get a better grip on the wire so it can be pulled tight.

Lines.Text: tie two half-hitch knots with the wire .
if you do not know how to tie a half-hitch knot , follow the link provided at the beginning of the guide .

Steps.Text_raw: Tie two half-hitch knots with the wire. If you do not know how to tie a half-hitch knot, follow the link provided at the beginning of the guide.

Lines.Text: use the scissors to trim the two ends of the wire to about half an inch in length .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the scissors to trim the two ends of the wire to about half an inch in length.

Lines.Text: using the pliers , twist the ends of the wire together .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the pliers, twist the ends of the wire together.

Lines.Text: tuck the wires down and clamp with the pliers so the ends are not poking out .

Steps.Text_raw: Tuck the wires down and clamp with the pliers so the ends are not poking out.

Lines.Text: this is a guide to fix the e-paper tearing in pebble 301 bl devices .

Steps.Text_raw: This is a guide to fix the E-Paper tearing in Pebble 301BL devices.

Lines.Text: using a t5 torx screwdriver , remove the 4 screws on the back .
when removing the back cover be very gentle ! the rumble motor may be adhered to the cover so you must pry it away .
t5 torx screwdriver

Steps.Text_raw: Using a T5 Torx screwdriver, remove the 4 screws on the back. When removing the back cover be very gentle!  The rumble motor may be adhered to the cover so you must pry it away. [https://www.ifixit.com/Store/Parts/T5-Torx-Screwdriver/IF145-039-3|iFixit T5 Torx screwdriver]

Lines.Text: locate the video connector near the bottom , right next to the device that vibrates when you get a notification .
during normal use , this cable becomes loose and creates the tearing effect .
in the next step , you will be shown a way to apply pressure to this and keep it constantly connected .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the video connector near the bottom, right next to the device that vibrates when you get a notification. During normal use, this cable becomes loose and creates the tearing effect. In the next step, you will be shown a way to apply pressure to this and keep it constantly connected.

Lines.Text: what worked for me is taking a little toilet tissue or paper towel and placing it over the video connector .
one way to test that this will help is by holding a finger on it and cycling through the menus .
nothing inside the device will catch the paper on fire , so there is nothing to worry about .

Steps.Text_raw: What worked for me is taking a little toilet tissue or paper towel and placing it over the video connector. One way to test that this will help is by holding a finger on it and cycling through the menus. Nothing inside the device will catch the paper on fire, so there is nothing to worry about.

Lines.Text: once you have confirmed that the paper will apply the necessary pressure , you can then put the screws back in .
if the case doesn't seem to close properly as it did before , do not keep on trying to tighten the screw down ; you will strip the screw .
if the case doesn't close properly , you will need to open the device back up and remove a tiny bit of the paper until it does close , that way it will retain its water resistance .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have confirmed that the paper will apply the necessary pressure, you can then put the screws back in. If the case doesn't seem to close properly as it did before, do not keep on trying to tighten the screw down; you will strip the screw. If the case doesn't close properly, you will need to open the device back up and remove a tiny bit of the paper until it does close, that way it will retain its water resistance.

Steps.Text_raw: Here is an example of the final result.

Title: How do I repair taped seams on my Vaude jacket?

Lines.Text: set the iron at 150 c maximum . lay the dish towel on the affected area .

Steps.Text_raw: Set the iron at 150 °C maximum. Lay the dish towel on the affected area.

Lines.Text: press the iron down firmly on the affected area . wait 10 seconds . repeat if necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the iron down firmly on the affected area. Wait 10 seconds. Repeat if necessary.

Title: How do I replace a broken zip slider on my Vaude clothing?

Lines.Text: select a replacement slider and zip stop .

Steps.Text_raw: Select a replacement slider and zip stop.

Lines.Text: remove the zip stop at the end of the zip by prying it open with a wire cutter and pulling it away .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the zip stop at the end of the zip by prying it open with a wire cutter and pulling it away.

Lines.Text: remove the broken slider .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the broken slider.

Lines.Text: insert the new slider onto the zip and use the wire cutter to press the zip stop into the position where the old stop had been .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the new slider onto the zip and use the wire cutter to press the zip stop into the position where the old stop had been.

Lines.Text: positon the zip stop together with the help of the tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Positon the zip stop together with the help of the tweezers.

Lines.Text: pinch the zip stop together with the help of the tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Pinch the zip stop together with the help of the tweezers.

Lines.Text: remove the zip puller ( black ) from the slider and thread it onto the new slider .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the zip puller (black) from the slider and thread it onto the new slider.

Subject: zip slider

Title: How do I replace a broken zip on my Vaude jacket?

Lines.Text: separate the seams of the broken zip using the seam ripper . its best to begin on the outside of the jacket .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the seams of the broken zip using the seam ripper. It’s best to begin on the outside of the jacket.

Lines.Text: next , separate the seam between the jacket and the front flap .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, separate the seam between the jacket and the front flap.

Lines.Text: after youve separated the seam between the jacket and the front flap , youll see the lining of your jacket .

Steps.Text_raw: After you´ve separated the seam between the jacket and the front flap,  you’ll see the lining of your jacket.

Lines.Text: then you can separate the zip from the jacket .

Steps.Text_raw: Then you can separate the zip from the jacket.

Lines.Text: after youve separated the zip and front flap from the jacket , youll need to separate the zip from the front flap . you should then have both sides of the zip and the front flap laying before you .

Steps.Text_raw: After you’ve separated the zip and front flap from the jacket, you’ll need to separate the zip from the front flap. You should then have both sides of the zip and the front flap laying before you.

Lines.Text: measure the length of the zip that youve removed and mark the length on the new zip . use the tweezers to crimp the zip stop onto the new zip in the correct position .

Steps.Text_raw: Measure the length of the zip that you’ve removed and mark the length on the new zip. Use the tweezers to crimp the zip stop onto the new zip in the correct position.

Lines.Text: cut off any excess zip approx . 2 cm beyond the zip stop .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut off any excess zip approx. 2 cm beyond the zip stop.

Lines.Text: use the wire cutters to pry off the zip teeth after the stopper .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the wire cutters to pry off the zip teeth after the stopper.

Lines.Text: then remove any leftover pieces with the seam ripper .

Steps.Text_raw: Then remove any leftover pieces with the seam ripper.

Lines.Text: fold over the seam allowance of the zip and sew it down with the sewing machine .

Steps.Text_raw: Fold over the seam allowance of the zip and sew it down with the sewing machine.

Lines.Text: put the inlay aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the inlay aside.

Lines.Text: position the pocket attachment correctly and sew it on to the closure edge .

Steps.Text_raw: Position the pocket attachment correctly and sew it on to the closure edge.

Lines.Text: sew the zip onto the front flap using the zip foot .

Steps.Text_raw: Sew the zip onto the front flap using the zip foot.

Lines.Text: sew the front flap with the zip attached onto the jacket lining .

Steps.Text_raw: Sew the front flap with the zip attached onto the jacket lining.

Lines.Text: sew the remaining zip half ( without flap ) onto the other side of the open jacket .

Steps.Text_raw: Sew the remaining zip half (without flap) onto the other side of the open jacket.

Lines.Text: sew along the zip again on the outer fabric .

Steps.Text_raw: Sew along the zip again on the outer fabric.

Lines.Text: smooth out the other half of the jacket , aligning the two sides together using a seam that comes together or other design element . this is important so that the zip is correctly aligned at the end .

Steps.Text_raw: Smooth out the other half of the jacket, aligning the two sides together using a seam that comes together or other design element. This is important so that the zip is correctly aligned at the end.

Lines.Text: then sew the second side of the zip on . move the slider as you sew to keep it out of the way .

Steps.Text_raw: Then sew the second side of the zip on. Move the slider as you sew to keep it out of the way.

Lines.Text: the last step is to re-sew the hem seam . if any sewing holes are still visible in the jacket , you can close them using the steam setting on an iron . be sure that the iron does not touch the jacket !

Steps.Text_raw: The last step is to re-sew the hem seam. If any sewing holes are still visible in the jacket, you can close them using the steam setting on an iron. Be sure that the iron does not touch the jacket!

Subject: A zip on a jacket

Title: How can I resew a loose Velcro on a Vaude jacket?

Lines.Text: if the velcro comes loose on the outer flap of your jacket , you can easily sew it back on using matching thread . if the loop side of the velcro comes loose , its a little harder to fix . well show you in detail how to accomplish this .

Steps.Text_raw: If the Velcro comes loose on the outer flap of your jacket, you can easily sew it back on using matching thread. If the loop side of the Velcro comes loose, it’s a little harder to fix. We’ll show you in detail how to accomplish this.

Lines.Text: using the seam ripper , completely take out the seam of the jacket flap for about 10 cm where the velcro is loose .
the more of the seam you take out , the better the new sewing on the velcro will be .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the seam ripper, completely take out the seam of the jacket flap for about 10 cm where the Velcro is loose. The more of the seam you take out, the better the new sewing on the Velcro will be.

Lines.Text: thread the sewing machine with matching thread and place the sewing machine foot as near to the edge of the velcro as possible . sew until you get to the corner .

Steps.Text_raw: Thread the sewing machine with matching thread and place the sewing machine foot as near to the edge of the Velcro as possible. Sew until you get to the corner.

Lines.Text: stop at the first corner and lift the sewing machine foot , leaving the needle in the velcro . turn the jacket , put down the foot and continue to stitch .
when you get back to where you started , lock down the thread by making a few stitches back and forth .

Steps.Text_raw: Stop at the first corner and lift the sewing machine foot, leaving the needle in the Velcro. Turn the jacket, put down the foot and continue to stitch. When you get back to where you started, lock down the thread by making a few stitches back and forth.

Lines.Text: to finish the repair , resew the opened flap .

Steps.Text_raw: To finish the repair, resew the opened flap.

Title: How do I sew a button onto my Vaude shirt?

Lines.Text: cut approx . 80 cm of thread from the spool .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut approx. 80 cm of thread from the spool.

Lines.Text: double the thread .

Steps.Text_raw: Double the thread.

Lines.Text: take the looped end of the thread and thread it through the eye of the needle .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the looped end of the thread and thread it through the eye of the needle.

Lines.Text: pull the loop through about 20 cm .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the loop through about 20 cm.

Lines.Text: if any thread remains from the lost button , cut it off with scissors .

Steps.Text_raw: if any thread remains from the lost button, cut it off with scissors.

Lines.Text: anchor the thread : starting from the backside of the fabric , poke the needle through the previous needle hole from the original button . then push the needle back through the fabric , right next to where it came out . slide the needle through the looped end of the thread and pull taught .

Steps.Text_raw: Anchor the thread: starting from the backside of the fabric, poke the needle through the previous needle hole from the original button. Then push the needle back through the fabric, right next to where it came out. Slide the needle through the looped end of the thread and pull taught.

Lines.Text: sew on the button : push the needle back through to the outside of the garment , again right next to the original stitch . slide the button onto the thread and continue to sew the button on in a cross-stitch pattern entering the fabric just next to the point where the needle came out . repeat two times .

Steps.Text_raw: Sew on the button: push the needle back through to the outside of the garment, again right next to the original stitch. Slide the button onto the thread and continue to sew the button on in a cross-stitch pattern entering the fabric just next to the point where the needle came out. Repeat two times.

Lines.Text: bring the needle back to the outside of the fabric and wrap the thread around the button several times to create a button stem that will create some distance between the button and the fabric .

Steps.Text_raw: Bring the needle back to the outside of the fabric and wrap the thread around the button several times to create a “button stem” that will create some distance between the button and the fabric.

Lines.Text: tie off the thread : push the needle through the button stem two times , sew through the fabric to the back and then cut the thread off at the back .

Steps.Text_raw: Tie off the thread: push the needle through the button stem two times, sew through the fabric to the back and then cut the thread off at the back.

Subject: Sew-on Button

Title: Michael Kors Watch Link Band Replacement

Lines.Text: place the watch on your wrist and determine whether links should be added or removed .
if watchband needs to be expanded , approximate the number of links required .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the watch on your wrist  and determine whether links should be added or removed. If watchband needs to be expanded, approximate the number of links required.

Lines.Text: set the watch on the block holder .
ensure the arrows located on the links are pointing downward .

Steps.Text_raw: Set the watch on the block holder. Ensure the arrows located on the links are pointing downward.

Lines.Text: when removing damaged or extra links , hold one end of the pin pusher against the pin to be removed .
strike the other end of the pin pusher with the metal side of the watch hammer until the pin slides out .
two pins hold each link to the band , so two pins must be removed per link .

Steps.Text_raw: When removing damaged or extra links, hold one end of the pin pusher against the pin to be removed. Strike the other end of the pin pusher with the metal side of the watch hammer until the pin slides out. Two pins hold each link to the band, so two pins must be removed per link.

Lines.Text: discard the broken links or save any extra links that you remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Discard the broken links or save any extra links that you remove.

Lines.Text: to add links to the watchband , position the watch on the block holder with the arrows facing upward .
insert pins into the holes that connect the new link to the rest of the watchband .
use the soft side of the hammer to strike the pin down .

Steps.Text_raw: To add links to the watchband, position the watch on the block holder with the arrows facing upward. Insert pins into the holes that connect the new link to the rest of the watchband. Use the soft side of the hammer to strike the pin down.

Lines.Text: start by '''carefully''' ripping the seam of the pants with a seam ripper . make sure not to leave holes in the fabric or it will show in the finished product .

Steps.Text_raw: Start by '''carefully''' ripping the seam of the pants with a seam ripper. Make sure not to leave holes in the fabric or it will show in the finished product.

Lines.Text: next , iron the crease left previously by the seam .
some fabrics cannot take high heat . consult the tag of the garment for ironing instructions . consider placing layers of fabric between the iron and garment to reduce heat .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, iron the crease left previously by the seam. Some fabrics cannot take high heat. Consult the tag of the garment for ironing instructions. Consider placing layers of fabric between the iron and garment to reduce heat.

Lines.Text: try on the pants . have a partner pin the pants to the desired length .
if you do not have someone to help , measure the inseam of the pants and pin to the desired length .

Steps.Text_raw: Try on the pants. Have a partner pin the pants to the desired length. If you do not have someone to help, measure the inseam of the pants and pin to the desired length.

Lines.Text: measure the width of the pant leg , double that measurement , and add 1.5 inches for seam allowance . cut the bias tape to match this width .

Steps.Text_raw: Measure the width of the pant leg, double that measurement, and add 1.5 inches for seam allowance. Cut the bias tape to match this width.

Lines.Text: sew the bottom of the pant to the edge of the bias tape .
make sure to remove pins while sewing as you move the work closer to the needle to avoid damaging the machine .

Steps.Text_raw: Sew the bottom of the pant to the edge of the bias tape. Make sure to remove pins while sewing as you move the work closer to the needle to avoid damaging the machine.

Lines.Text: fold the bias tape underneath ( about 3 /4 -1 ) and iron flat . make sure that the bias tape is not visible . pin the two layers together .

Steps.Text_raw: Fold the bias tape underneath (about 3/4" -1") and iron flat. Make sure that the bias tape is not visible. Pin the two layers together.

Lines.Text: sew the new seam of the pants .

if sewing with a machine , consult the machine's manual on how to do a blind stitch . if sewing by hand , use a tacking stitch . make sure to only sew the two layers of fabric and not the entire pant-- this will cause the leg of your pants to not have an opening .

Steps.Text_raw: Sew the new seam of the pants. If sewing with a machine, consult the machine's manual on how to do a blind stitch.  If sewing by hand, use a tacking stitch. Make sure to only sew the two layers of fabric and not the entire pant-- this will cause the leg of your pants to not have an opening.

Lines.Text: repeat steps 1-7 for the other pant leg and iron flat .

Steps.Text_raw: Repeat steps 1-7 for the other pant leg and iron flat.

Title: How do I attach a new snap?

Lines.Text: in our example , the snap stud is missing . the snap post can be removed with the pliers .

Steps.Text_raw: In our example, the snap stud is missing. The snap post can be removed with the pliers.

Lines.Text: lay out the two pieces for the lower flap .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay out the two pieces for the lower flap.

Lines.Text: place the stud component on the lower flap where the previous stud was positioned and hold it there with a plastic snap holder if necessary . rivet the two parts together with a few strong blows of the hammer .
alternatively , you can purchase a hand press for snaps at a sewing supplies store .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the stud component on the lower flap where the previous stud was positioned and hold it there with a plastic snap holder if necessary. Rivet the two parts together with a few strong blows of the hammer. Alternatively, you can purchase a hand press for snaps at a sewing supplies store.

Lines.Text: lay out the other two pieces for the top flap .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay out the other two pieces for the top flap.

Lines.Text: place the post part of the snap on the top flap where the previous post was positioned and attach it with a plastic holder if necessary . rivet the two parts together with a few strong blows of the hammer .
alternatively , you can purchase a hand press for snaps at a sewing supplies store .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the post part of the snap on the top flap where the previous post was positioned and attach it with a plastic holder if necessary. Rivet the two parts together with a few strong blows of the hammer. Alternatively, you can purchase a hand press for snaps at a sewing supplies store.

Title: How do I patch a garment?

Lines.Text: using a piece of tailors chalk , outline the size of the patch youll need to fully cover the area .
in order to ensure that the patch looks good and fits the garment , take note of any seams or design elements you can use to design your patch .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a piece of tailor’s chalk, outline the size of the patch you’ll need to fully cover the area. In order to ensure that the patch looks good and fits the garment, take note of any seams or design elements you can use to design your patch.

Lines.Text: transfer the size and shape of the patch to an appropriate piece of fabric for the patch .
add 1 cm for a seam allowance along the entire patch .

Steps.Text_raw: Transfer the size and shape of the patch to an appropriate piece of fabric for the patch. Add 1 cm for a seam allowance along the entire patch.

Lines.Text: cut along the outer line of the patch .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut along the outer line of the patch.

Lines.Text: fold over the seam allowance on the patch and iron it down this will help with sewing the patch on .

Steps.Text_raw: Fold over the seam allowance on the patch and iron it down – this will help with sewing the patch on.

Lines.Text: lay the patch on the marked line and top stitch it to the fabric close to the edge of the patch .
you can use pins to attach the patch to the jacket so it wont slide around while youre sewing it on .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the patch on the marked line and top stitch it to the fabric close to the edge of the patch. You can use pins to attach the patch to the jacket so it won’t slide around while you’re sewing it on.

Lines.Text: use a top stitch to sew around the patch , locking off the first and last stitches by stitching back and forth a few times .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a top stitch to sew around the patch, locking off the first and last stitches by stitching back and forth a few times.

Lines.Text: cut away the torn area inside the jacket along the new seam .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut away the torn area inside the jacket along the new seam.

Lines.Text: unscrew all four black 3 mm phillips screws on the underside of the watch using a t5 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew all four black 3 mm Phillips screws on the underside of the watch using a T5 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: use an x-acto knife to cut the band above , on either side , and in between the 2 screws .
'''note''' : part of the band is hard plastic .
'''caution''' : once the band is cut it cannot be reattached .

Steps.Text_raw: Use an X-Acto knife to cut the band above, on either side, and in between the 2 screws. '''Note''': Part of the band is hard plastic. '''Caution''': Once the band is cut it cannot be reattached.

Lines.Text: scrape away the glue beneath the hard shell portion of the band to reveal the gps .

Steps.Text_raw: Scrape away the glue beneath the hard shell portion of the band to reveal the GPS.

Lines.Text: use a 000 screw head to undo the newly revealed silver 4 mm phillips screws that were hidden beneath the glue .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a PH000 screw head to undo the newly revealed silver 4 mm Phillips screws that were hidden beneath the glue.

Lines.Text: using a metal spudger , push down on the plastic gray square clamps on the underside of the device to dislodge the whole silver backing .
note : the buttons will also come off .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a metal spudger, push down on the plastic gray square clamps on the underside of the device  to dislodge the whole silver backing. Note: the buttons will also come off.

Lines.Text: use a thin tool to pry the the device apart by lodging it between the clock face and back side of the device .
'''note''' : a spudger may not be thin enough to fit in the seam of the device . we used the 6 inch metal ruler from the pro tech toolkit .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a thin tool to pry the the device apart by lodging it between the clock face and back side of the device. '''Note''': A spudger may not be thin enough to fit in the seam of the device. We used the 6 inch metal ruler from the Pro Tech Toolkit.

Lines.Text: remove the protective cover underneath the clock face , by unscrewing the three 2 mm phillips screws using a 000 screwdriver .
lift the protective cover to remove it and reveal the device's screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the protective cover underneath the clock face, by unscrewing the three 2 mm Phillips screws using a PH000 screwdriver. Lift the protective cover to remove it and reveal the device's screen.
