Title: How do I stuff a hole on my Vaude knit sweater?

Lines.Text: cut a length of thread about 40 cm long .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut a length of thread about 40 cm long.

Lines.Text: insert one end of the thread through the eye of the needle .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert one end of the thread through the eye of the needle.

Lines.Text: turn the sweater inside out . insert the needle through the garment at your starting point at the top of the hole . pull the thread through until only about 5 cm of thread is overlapping . before inserting the thread on the other side of the hole , pick up any open stitches so that no other stitches come loose .
cut away any overlapping threads from the hole so that the loose stitches are more visible .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the sweater inside out. Insert the needle through the garment at your starting point at the top of the hole. Pull the thread through until only about 5 cm of thread is overlapping. Before inserting the thread on the other side of the hole, pick up any open stitches so that no other stitches come loose. Cut away any overlapping threads from the hole so that the loose stitches are more visible.

Lines.Text: continue to pick up any stitches that still exist . repeat this procedure as long as it takes to pick up all stitches around the hole .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue to pick up any stitches that still exist. Repeat this procedure as long as it takes to pick up all stitches around the hole.

Lines.Text: then stitch across a row of stitches weaving in and out of the stitches you just made .

Steps.Text_raw: Then stitch across a row of stitches weaving in and out of the stitches you just made.

Lines.Text: when the hole is closed sufficiently , you can tie off your thread . to do this , insert the needle several times through the same point in your fabric . then cut off the thread .

Steps.Text_raw: When the hole is closed sufficiently, you can tie off your thread. To do this, insert the needle several times through the same point in your fabric. Then cut off the thread.

Lines.Text: gently remove the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently remove the battery.

Lines.Text: unscrew all four black 3 mm screws on the underside of the watch using a t5 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew all four black 3 mm screws on the underside of the watch using a T5 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: use an x-acto knife to cut the band above , on either side , and in between the 2 screws .
'''note''' : part of the band is hard plastic .
'''caution''' : once the band is cut it cannot be reattached .

Steps.Text_raw: Use an X-Acto knife to cut the band above, on either side, and in between the 2 screws. '''Note''': Part of the band is hard plastic. '''Caution''': Once the band is cut it cannot be reattached.

Lines.Text: scrape away the glue beneath the hard shell portion of the band to reveal the gps .

Steps.Text_raw: Scrape away the glue beneath the hard shell portion of the band to reveal the GPS.

Lines.Text: use a 000 screw head to undo the newly revealed silver 4 mm phillips screws that were hidden beneath the glue .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a PH000 screw head to undo the newly revealed silver 4 mm Phillips screws that were hidden beneath the glue.

Lines.Text: using a metal spudger , push down on the plastic gray square clamps on the underside of the device to dislodge the whole silver backing .
'''note''' : the buttons will also come off .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a metal spudger, push down on the plastic gray square clamps on the underside of the device to dislodge the whole silver backing. '''Note''': the buttons will also come off.

Lines.Text: use a thin tool to pry the the device apart by lodging it between the clock face and back side of the device .
'''note''' : a spudger may not be thin enough to fit in the seam of the device . we used the 6 inch metal ruler from the pro tech toolkit .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a thin tool to pry the the device apart by lodging it between the clock face and back side of the device. '''Note''': A spudger may not be thin enough to fit in the seam of the device. We used the 6 inch metal ruler from the Pro Tech Toolkit.

Lines.Text: remove the touchscreen sensor using a spudger or your fingers .
'''note''' : in this photo we removed the metal cover on the main pcb , but you do not need to remove it for this guide .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the touchscreen sensor using a spudger or your fingers. '''Note''': In this photo we removed the metal cover on the main PCB, but you do not need to remove it for this guide.

Lines.Text: measure the new rubber band to the appropriate length . to do this , put the rubber band around the waist or waist and stretch slightly .
the rubber band must be adjusted so that the garment later has enough tension to not slip .
then add 1-5 cm seam allowance and cut .

Steps.Text_raw: Measure the new rubber band to the appropriate length. To do this, put the rubber band around the waist or waist and stretch slightly. The rubber band must be adjusted so that the garment later has enough tension to not slip. Then add 1-5 cm seam allowance and cut.

Lines.Text: uncover the old rubber band . to do this , carefully cut the seam in an inconspicuous area on the inside of the waistband with the scissors or the seam splitter so that the fabric is not damaged .
for some garments , there is already an opening for an additional cord , then you can simply use the existing opening .
grasp the old rubber band with the point of the scissors or with your fingers and pull it out a little bit .
now cut the old rubber band .

Steps.Text_raw: Uncover the old rubber band. To do this, carefully cut the seam in an inconspicuous area on the inside of the waistband with the scissors or the seam splitter so that the fabric is not damaged. For some garments, there is already an opening for an additional cord, then you can simply use the existing opening. Grasp the old rubber band with the point of the scissors or with your fingers and pull it out a little bit. Now cut the old rubber band.

Lines.Text: tie the new rubber band to the old rubber band .
only knot so tightly that the knot can be loosened again later .

Steps.Text_raw: Tie the new rubber band to the old rubber band. Only knot so tightly that the knot can be loosened again later.

Lines.Text: now pull on the other end of the old rubber band , so that the new rubber band is pulled in piece by piece .

do not pull so far that the end of the new rubber band is pulled through ! the best way to secure the end of the new rubber band with the darning needle for safety is to prevent the rubber band from twisting during retraction .

Steps.Text_raw: Now pull on the other end of the old rubber band, so that the new rubber band is pulled in piece by piece. Do not pull so far that the end of the new rubber band is pulled through! The best way to secure the end of the new rubber band with the darning needle for safety is to prevent the rubber band from twisting during retraction.

Lines.Text: as soon as the knot becomes visible at the beginning of the new rubber band , the knot can be loosened and the old rubber band can be used for textile recycling or for tying tomatoes : - )
now put the two ends of the new elastic band together so that they overlap 1-5 centimeters according to the seam allowance .

Steps.Text_raw: As soon as the knot becomes visible at the beginning of the new rubber band, the knot can be loosened and the old rubber band can be used for textile recycling or for tying tomatoes :-) Now put the two ends of the new elastic band together so that they overlap 1-5 centimeters according to the seam allowance.

Lines.Text: cut off a piece of thread .
the color of the thread can be chosen freely , as you will not see this seam later .
thread one end of the thread through the suture needle tube .
make a simple knot at the longer end .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut off a piece of thread. The color of the thread can be chosen freely, as you will not see this seam later. Thread one end of the thread through the suture needle tube. Make a simple knot at the longer end.

Lines.Text: pierce the needle from the back about 2 mm from the top edge through both ends of the rubber band .
pull through the needle until the thread is tight and the knot is caught at the back of the rubber band . sew along the edge until the end of the seam allowance is reached .

Steps.Text_raw: Pierce the needle from the back about 2mm from the top edge through both ends of the rubber band. Pull through the needle until the thread is tight and the knot is caught at the back of the rubber band. Sew along the edge until the end of the seam allowance is reached.

Lines.Text: pierce the thread on the other edge and do the same here

Steps.Text_raw: Pierce the thread on the other edge and do the same here

Lines.Text: if both edges are sewn together , do not completely pull through the thread at the last stitch , but catch the forming loop with your finger .
do not pull the thread tight yet .
insert the needle into the loop and pull it through .
now pull the thread tight so that the loop closes and a knot is formed .
cut off the protruding thread and stow the needle and the remaining thread safely for the next time ; - )

Steps.Text_raw: If both edges are sewn together, do not completely pull through the thread at the last stitch, but catch the forming loop with your finger. Do not pull the thread tight yet. Insert the needle into the loop and pull it through. Now pull the thread tight so that the loop closes and a knot is formed. Cut off the protruding thread and stow the needle and the remaining thread safely for the next time ;-)

Lines.Text: now stretch the waistband so far that the elastic band gradually disappears into the waistband due to the tension .

if you like , you can now sew up the opening that you might have had to tie in the beginning with a few stitches , we leave this unobtrusive opening open for a possible later replacement of the rubber band .

Steps.Text_raw: Now stretch the waistband so far that the elastic band gradually disappears into the waistband due to the tension. If you like, you can now sew up the opening that you might have had to tie in the beginning with a few stitches, we leave this unobtrusive opening open for a possible later replacement of the rubber band.

Title: Motorola Moto 360 Case Locking Fastener Replacement

Toolbox.Name: straight pin with point bent into a hook.

Lines.Text: locate the spring-loaded pin that attaches the wrist strap to the watch .
there is a tiny groove on the end of the pin . this is where you will place the tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the spring-loaded pin that attaches the wrist strap to the watch. There is a tiny groove on the end of the pin. This is where you will place the tweezers.
Tools_extracted: straight pin with point bent into a hook.

Lines.Text: take care not to lose the spring-loaded pin when removing the strap .
use the tweezers to compress the spring-loaded pin so the strap can be removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Take care not to lose the spring-loaded pin when removing the strap. Use the tweezers to compress the spring-loaded pin so the strap can be removed.
Tools_extracted: straight pin with point bent into a hook.

Lines.Text: pull the wristband away from the watch face .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the wristband away from the watch face.

Lines.Text: locate the rectangular end of the fastener inside the wrist strap mounting pocket .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the rectangular end of the fastener inside the wrist strap mounting pocket.

Lines.Text: push the point of the pin in behind the fastener and pry it out . there is a notch near the end of the fastener which will engage the pin . once the end pops out , the fastener will slide out of the slot easliy . repeat to remove all four of them .
that's it . now the two halves of the watch can be easily separated by just pulling gently with your fingers .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the point of the pin in behind the fastener and pry it out. There is a notch near the end of the fastener which will engage the pin. Once the end pops out, the fastener will slide out of the slot easliy. Repeat to remove all four of them. That's it. Now the two halves of the watch can be easily separated by just pulling gently with your fingers.
Tools_extracted: straight pin with point bent into a hook.

Subject: Case Locking Fasteners

Lines.Text: measure the size of your heel tips to know what size to purchase .
most sizes are in the range of 8-13 mm . the variety packs are handy , especially if you have a few pairs to fix .
the size pictured in this fix is a 12 mm heel tip on a size 9 heel .

Steps.Text_raw: Measure the size of your heel tips to know what size to purchase. Most sizes are in the range of 8-13 mm. The variety packs are handy, especially if you have a few pairs to fix. The size pictured in this fix is a 12mm heel tip on a size 9 heel.

Lines.Text: wedge a dull picket knife or jimmy between the top of the heel tip to help loosen and separate the tip .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge a dull picket knife or jimmy between the top of the heel tip to help loosen and separate the tip.

Lines.Text: carefully remove the heel tip with the pliers by twisting and pulling it out . most can be turned counter clockwise to remove . be careful not to pull only the rubber off .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully remove the heel tip with the pliers by twisting and pulling it out. Most can be turned counter clockwise to remove. Be careful not to pull only the rubber off.

Lines.Text: clean the newly exposed tip of any debris .

Steps.Text_raw: Clean the newly exposed tip of any debris.

Lines.Text: place the pin end of the new tip into the heels opening .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the pin end of the new tip into the heels opening.

Lines.Text: gently tap the new tip in with the hammer . careful not to damage the shoes material .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently tap the new tip in with the hammer. Careful not to damage the shoes material.

Lines.Text: adjust the tip with the pliers to align the heel tip .

Steps.Text_raw: Adjust the tip with the pliers to align the heel tip.

Lines.Text: locate the end of the elastic that is stuck within the ballet casing

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the end of the elastic that is stuck within the ballet casing

Lines.Text: use a fine needle to rip a few of the stitches in order to open the exact area where the elastic is stuck to release it
you may also use a stitch opener in replacement of the fine needle if preferred
fine needle can be found at walmart in the sewing aisle . the one used is the brand dritz and included 6 different sized needles . the one used is the smallest needle in the kit .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a fine needle to rip a few of the stitches in order to open the exact area where the elastic is stuck to release it You may also use a stitch opener in replacement of the fine needle if preferred Fine needle can be found at Walmart in the sewing aisle. The one used is the brand "Dritz" and included 6 different sized needles. The one used is the smallest needle in the kit.

Lines.Text: remove all of the elastic out of the shoe completely by gently pulling one end

Steps.Text_raw: Remove all of the elastic out of the shoe completely by gently pulling one end

Lines.Text: put one end of the elastic through the thin needle . leave enough of a tail on the thread in order to ensure it does not come unthreaded

Steps.Text_raw: Put one end of the elastic through the thin needle. Leave enough of a tail on the thread in order to ensure it does not come unthreaded

Lines.Text: rethread the shoe by putting the needle through one end and pushing it through to the other opening

this may be a bit tricky since the needle is super straight and the ballet shoe is curved . use force to push the needle all the way through but be cautious not to stick yourself with the sharp end when doing so
keep in mind that this may be the most difficult or time consuming part of the repair depending on the specific slipper and/or strength used

Steps.Text_raw: Rethread the shoe by putting the needle through one end and pushing it through to the other opening This may be a bit tricky since the needle is super straight and the ballet shoe is curved. Use force to push the needle all the way through but be cautious not to stick yourself with the sharp end when doing so Keep in mind that this may be the most difficult or time consuming part of the repair depending on the specific slipper and/or strength used

Lines.Text: once elastic is evenly pulled through the ballet casing , secure the knot and cut the leftover elastic , if necessary
it may help to fit the ballet slipper to the ballerina's foot prior to securing the knot to ensure the elastic is adjusted specifically their size

you may also use fabric glue to seal the spot where youve broken the stitches , or if it appears in good condition , leave stitching broken and cut down any excess hanging thread . the few broken stitches do not affect the ballerinas performance in the shoe . it will still be in perfect working/wearing condition

Steps.Text_raw: Once elastic is evenly pulled through the ballet casing, secure the knot and cut the leftover elastic, if necessary It may help to fit the ballet slipper to the ballerina's foot prior to securing the knot to ensure the elastic is adjusted specifically their size You  may also use fabric glue to seal the spot where you’ve broken the stitches, or if it appears in good condition, leave stitching broken and cut down any excess hanging thread. The few broken stitches do not affect the ballerina’s performance in the shoe. It will still be in perfect working/wearing condition

Title: Luxury Fashion Quality Military Quartz Watch Link Replacement

Lines.Text: measure the watch band to decide how many links to remove .
it is better to remove an even number of links to keep the clasp centered and symmetrical .

Steps.Text_raw: Measure the watch band to decide how many links to remove. It is better to remove an even number of links to keep the clasp centered and symmetrical.

Lines.Text: separate the clasp by pushing in the spring pin .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the clasp by pushing in the spring pin.

Lines.Text: remove the clasp from the lug by pushing in on the spring pin .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the clasp from the lug by pushing in on the spring  pin.

Lines.Text: to remove the first link and lug , push in on the link pin to raise it up .
grasp the link pin and pull it out from the link .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the first link and lug, push in on the link pin to raise it up. Grasp the link pin and pull it out from the link.

Lines.Text: push in on the second link pin .
grasp the link pin and pull it up and out .

Steps.Text_raw: Push in on the second link pin. Grasp the link pin and pull it up and out.

Lines.Text: pull the link apart to remove it from the band .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the link apart to remove it from the band.

Subject: Watch Link

Lines.Text: remove pin from watch band link to obtain easier access to the back of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove pin from watch band link to obtain easier access to the back of the watch.

Lines.Text: using the adjustable wrench , unscrew the back face of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the adjustable wrench, unscrew the back face of the watch.

Lines.Text: using the sim removal tool , carefully pry the capacitor from its current location .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the sim removal tool, carefully pry the capacitor from its current location.

Lines.Text: replace the capacitor with the new lithium capacitor .
make sure the positive side is facing upward .
when reinserting capacitor , make sure the brass connector is inserted into the inlet of the battery slot .

Steps.Text_raw: Replace the capacitor with the new lithium capacitor. Make sure the positive side is facing upward. When reinserting capacitor, make sure the brass connector is inserted into the inlet of the battery slot.

Lines.Text: pull the knob out for thirty seconds to place the watch in its all reset mode .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the knob out for thirty seconds to place the watch in its "all reset" mode.

Title: Citizen Men's Watch 1102 Series Hands Replacement

Lines.Text: locate the notch under the back cap of the watch . wedge the jimmy into the notch , and pry off the back .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the notch under the back cap of the watch. Wedge the jimmy into the notch, and pry off the back.

Lines.Text: remove the circular plastic cover from inside the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the circular plastic cover from inside the watch.

Lines.Text: remove the crown stalk by placing the needle in the release notch . this will release stalk and allow it to slide out .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the crown stalk by placing the needle in the release notch. This will release stalk and allow it to slide out.

Lines.Text: turn watch on its side and let the watch face fall out .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn watch on its side and let the watch face fall out.

Lines.Text: gently pry the watch hands off of the face of the watch with the jimmy and tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pry the watch hands off of the face of the watch with the jimmy and tweezers.

Lines.Text: use the tweezers to replace the hands of the watch .
first , place the hour hand on the watch face stem , followed by the minute hand , and the second hand .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the tweezers to replace the hands of the watch. First, place the hour hand on the watch face stem, followed by the minute hand, and the second hand.

Lines.Text: place the watch face downwards in its case .
make sure the crown stalk holes are aligned .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the watch face downwards in its case. Make sure the crown stalk holes are aligned.

Lines.Text: insert the crown stalk into the crown stalk holes .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the crown stalk into the crown stalk holes.

Lines.Text: place the plastic cover back in its original place .
use the crown notch for guidance in alignment .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the plastic cover back in its original place. Use the crown notch for guidance in alignment.

Lines.Text: press the back cover on the watch using hands or clamp , until it pops into place .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the back cover on the watch using hands or clamp, until it pops into place.

Subject: Watch Face Hands

Lines.Text: flip the watch over and orient it such that the buckle is away from you and the back panel is revealed .
maintain this orientation to follow the guide .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the watch over and orient it such that the buckle is away from you and the back panel is revealed. Maintain this orientation to follow the guide.

Lines.Text: remove the four base screws using a size 2 torx screwdriver to separate the back plate from the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four base screws using a size 2 TORX screwdriver to separate the back plate from the frame.

Lines.Text: disconnect the ribbon cable on the left side of the motherboard by using a spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the ribbon cable on the left side of the motherboard by using a spudger.

Lines.Text: use a spudger and apply pressure to the white plastic wall to the right of the motherboard . use this to lever the electronics out of the frame .
the clips have small lips that you can put the spudger under to get more leverage .
using any of the metal to pry out the electronics may damage some of the wiring . it is crucial to only press on the plastic .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a spudger and apply pressure to the white plastic wall to the right of the motherboard. Use this to lever the electronics out of the frame. The clips have small lips that you can put the spudger under to get more leverage. Using any of the metal to pry out the electronics may damage some of the wiring. It is crucial to only press on the plastic.

Lines.Text: remove the four 3.5 mm screws to detach the case using the t5 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 3.5mm screws to detach the case using the T5 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: slide the spudger under the battery and lift to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the spudger under the battery and lift to remove.

Lines.Text: remove the four 3.5 mm screws using a t5 screwdriver to open the faceplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 3.5mm screws using a T5 screwdriver to open the faceplate.

Lines.Text: remove the two 1.8 mm silver screws using the 00 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 1.8mm silver screws using the PH00 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: slide the spudger under the gold-plated connection ribbon and lift to disconnect from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the spudger under the gold-plated connection ribbon and lift to disconnect from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: pull up on the motherboard using tweezers to detach it from the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull up on the motherboard using tweezers to detach it from the watch.

Lines.Text: remove the watch strap by sliding the knob inward to detach from the face plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the watch strap by sliding the knob inward to detach from the face plate.

Lines.Text: open the watch by removing the four 3.5 mm screws using the t5 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the watch by removing the four 3.5mm screws using the T5 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: place the spudger under the vibration motor and lift up to remove it from the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the spudger under the vibration motor and lift up to remove it from the watch.

Lines.Text: begin by laying the watch on a flat , smooth surface .
this will prevent the watch screen from suffering damage .
obtain a flex extension with a size 1.0 mm flat-head . in the case of not having said tool , for this model of watch one can use the hands to replace the strap .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by laying the watch on a flat, smooth surface. This will prevent the watch screen from suffering damage. Obtain a Flex Extension with a Size 1.0 mm flat-head. In the case of not having said tool, for this model of watch one can use the hands to replace the strap.

Lines.Text: locate the two springs on the back of your watch .
the watch comes with two of these springs on each side of the back-face . these are used to release the straps from the body of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two springs on the back of your watch. The watch comes with two of these springs on each side of the back-face. These are used to release the straps from the body of the watch.

Lines.Text: use the flex extension to push the spring to the right . this will release the strap from the watch head .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Flex Extension to push the spring to the right. This will release the strap from the watch head.

Lines.Text: carefully pull the strap away from the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pull the strap away from the watch.

Lines.Text: repeat step 3 , this time using the other strap .

Steps.Text_raw: Repeat step 3, this time using the other strap.

Lines.Text: locate the 4 t3 screws in the back of your watch , and use the t3 torx screwdriver to unscrew them .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the 4 T3 screws in the back of your watch, and use the T3 Torx Screwdriver to unscrew them.

Lines.Text: use the metal spudger to pry open the back of your watch .
make sure the watch is off and not plugged in when prying into the case with the metal spudger to avoid the risk of electric shock .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Metal Spudger to pry open the back of your watch. Make sure the watch is off and not plugged in when prying into the case with the Metal Spudger to avoid the risk of electric shock.

Lines.Text: remove the back case .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the back case.

Lines.Text: use tweezers or a nylon spudger to pry up the four press-fit connectors .
the glued-down connector in the middle is harder to remove than the rest . that is perfectly fine .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers or a nylon spudger to pry up the four press-fit connectors. The glued-down connector in the middle is harder to remove than the rest. That is perfectly fine.

Lines.Text: locate the two phillips 00 screws holding down the motherboard , and use the phillips 00 screwdriver to remove them .
ensure to place these screws separately from the torx screws , as they can easily be mixed up .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two Phillips #00 screws holding down the motherboard, and use the Phillips #00 screwdriver to remove them. Ensure to place these screws separately from the Torx screws, as they can easily be mixed up.

Lines.Text: use the metal spudger to lift the mother board from the watch .
the metal spudger may cause damage to the device , use a nylon spudger when possible .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Metal Spudger to lift the mother board from the watch. The metal spudger may cause damage to the device, use a [https://www.ifixit.com/Store/Parts/Spudger/IF145-002-2|black nylon spudger] when possible.

Lines.Text: remove the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the motherboard.

Title: Samsung Gear S2 Watch Strap Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the watch over so that the face is down .
using a y0 screwdriver , unscrew the four 3.5 millimeter tri-head screws .
remember to turn off the watch to avoid being shocked .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the watch over so that the face is down. Using a Y#0 screwdriver, unscrew the four 3.5 millimeter tri-head screws. Remember to turn off the watch to avoid being shocked.

Lines.Text: using your finger , push forward on the release while pulling up on the strap .
you may find it helpful to use the flat end of a spudger to push on the release instead of your finger .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your finger, push forward on the release while pulling up on the strap. You may find it helpful to use the flat end of a spudger to push on the release instead of your finger.

Lines.Text: repeat the procedure from step 2 for the other strap .

Steps.Text_raw: Repeat the procedure from step 2 for the other strap.

Subject: Watch Strap

Lines.Text: locate the front lcd screen on your device .
fitbit logo should appear in the bottom center of the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the front LCD screen on your device. Fitbit logo should appear in the bottom center of the screen.

Lines.Text: push the screen out through the back of the metal ring enclosure .
use a small amount of force on screen to prevent damage . use other hand to catch screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the screen out through the back of the metal ring enclosure. Use a small amount of force on screen to prevent damage. Use other hand to catch screen.

Lines.Text: locate the metal pin behind the wristband located on the edge of metal ring .
insert the pointed end of the metal spudger into the pin hold and push it into the blue rectangle enclosure .
use a small amount of force to avoid damaging the pins .
remove wristband .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the metal pin behind the wristband located on the edge of metal ring. Insert the pointed end of the metal spudger into the pin hold and push it into the blue rectangle enclosure. Use a small amount of force to avoid damaging the pins. Remove wristband.

Lines.Text: locate the pin behind the second wristband located on the edge of metal ring .
insert the pointed end of the metal spudger into the pin hold and push it into opposite direction .
use a small amount of force to avoid damaging the pins .
remove wristband .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the pin behind the second wristband located on the edge of metal ring. Insert the pointed end of the metal spudger into the pin hold and push it into opposite direction. Use a small amount of force to avoid damaging the pins. Remove wristband.

Lines.Text: place device screen face down and locate the four screws attaching the back cover .
use a t3 torx head or t3 torx screwdriver to remove the four screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Place device screen face down and locate the four screws attaching the back cover. Use a T3 torx head or T3 torx screwdriver to remove the four screws.

Lines.Text: grab the back , lift and open like a book to expose the motherboard . locate the ribbon connector on the left .
use a plastic spudger tool on the ribbon connected from the heart rate monitor to the motherboard .
insert and lift the plastic connector to release the ribbon .
only a small force when lifting the plastic connector is needed to avoid damage .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the back, lift and open like a book to expose the motherboard. Locate the ribbon connector on the left. Use a plastic spudger tool on the ribbon connected from the heart rate monitor to the motherboard. Insert and lift the plastic connector to release the ribbon. Only a small force when lifting the plastic connector is needed to avoid damage.

Lines.Text: separate the back and set aside , locate the three screws attaching the motherboard .
use a 000 head or a 000 screwdriver to remove the three screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the back and set aside, locate the three screws attaching the motherboard. Use a PH000 head or a PH000 screwdriver to remove the three screws.

Lines.Text: use a plastic spudger tool on the ribbons connected to the motherboard .
insert the tool under the ribbon and lift to release the connection .
only a small force when lifting the plastic connector is needed to avoid damage .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic spudger tool on the ribbons connected to the motherboard. Insert the tool under the ribbon and lift to release the connection. Only a small force when lifting the plastic connector is needed to avoid damage.

Lines.Text: lift and push the motherboard to the side to uncover the 167 mah battery .
use a plastic spudger tool to pry out the battery from its adhesive plastic underneath .
lift up and pull downward to remove battery . switch to the top portion of the battery and push downward to pry out battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift and push the motherboard to the side to uncover the 167mAh battery. Use a plastic spudger tool to pry out the battery from its adhesive plastic underneath. Lift up and pull downward to remove battery. Switch to the top portion of the battery and push downward to pry out battery.

Lines.Text: flip the motherboard to located the metal pins from the battery soldered to the board .
desolder the connection to remove the battery component .
follow this guide on how to solder and desolder connectors guide

use a small amount of force to avoid damaging the pins .

Lines.Text: grab the back , lift and open like a book to expose the motherboard . locate the ribbon connector on the left .

remember to turn off the watch to avoid being shocked .

heating the lcd screen may damage it . avoid this procedure unless you intend to replace the screen .

Title: TomTom Runner Back Panel Replacement Guide

Lines.Text: first , lift the bottom part of the band to start removing the wristband from the button area of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: First,  lift the bottom part of the band to start removing the wristband from the button area of the watch.

Lines.Text: continue to lift up on the band until the screen of the watch becomes loose from the band .
you may need to apply a small amount of force downward on the face of the screen .
continue to pull up on the wristband until it is completely off the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue to lift up on the band until  the screen of the watch becomes loose from the band. You may need to apply a small amount of force downward on the face of the screen. Continue to pull up on the wristband until  it is completely off the watch.

Lines.Text: grab the watch once it is separated from the wristband .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the watch once it is separated from the wristband.

Lines.Text: flip over the watch and remove the four 3.0 mm torx head screws with a t4 torx head screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip over the watch and remove the four 3.0 mm Torx head screws with a T4 Torx head screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the two 3.0 mm torx screws from the front . use a t4 torx screwdriver to remove the screws .
the two 3.0 mm torx screws are painted blue at the end . these screws have screw holders around them that will also need to be removed .
unscrew the screws from the front of the watch casing and the screw holders fall out from the back of the watch casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 3.0 mm Torx screws from the front.  Use a T4 Torx screwdriver to remove the screws. The two 3.0 mm Torx screws are painted blue at the end. These screws  have screw holders around them that will also need to be removed. Unscrew the screws from the front of the watch casing and the screw holders fall out from the back of the watch casing.

Lines.Text: gently pull the back panel away from the front panel .
do not to pull too fast or too hard . there are red and black wires connected to the vibrator component that should not be ripped .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull the back panel away from the front panel. Do not to pull too fast or too hard. There are red and black wires connected to the vibrator component that should not be ripped.

Lines.Text: gently wiggle the black box vibrator component away from the back panel with your fingers or a spudger tool .
be gentle with the red and black wires . you do not want them to rip or pop out .
the vibrator component is the small black box with the silver metal part at end . the black box is glued down , so it will take a little force to free it and it will be sticky .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently wiggle the black box vibrator component away from the back panel with your fingers or a Spudger tool. Be gentle with the red and black wires. You do not want them to rip or pop out. The vibrator component is the small black box with the silver metal part at end. The black box is glued down, so it will take a little force to free it and it will be sticky.

Subject: Back Panel

Lines.Text: begin by laying the watch on a flat , smooth surface .
this will prevent the watch screen from suffering damage .
obtain a flex extension with a size 1.0 mm flat-head . in the case of not having said tool , for this model of watch one can use the hands to replace the strap .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by laying the watch on a flat, smooth surface. This will prevent the watch screen from suffering damage. Obtain a Flex Extension with a Size 1.0 mm flat-head. In the case of not having said tool, for this model of watch one can use the hands to replace the strap.

Lines.Text: locate the two springs on the back of your watch .
the watch comes with two of these springs on each side of the back-face . these are used to release the straps from the body of the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two springs on the back of your watch. The watch comes with two of these springs on each side of the back-face. These are used to release the straps from the body of the watch.

Lines.Text: use the flex extension to push the spring to the right . this will release the strap from the watch head .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Flex Extension to push the spring to the right. This will release the strap from the watch head.

Lines.Text: carefully pull the strap away from the watch .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pull the strap away from the watch.

Lines.Text: repeat step 3 , this time using the other strap .

Steps.Text_raw: Repeat step 3, this time using the other strap.

Lines.Text: locate the 4 t3 screws in the back of your watch , and use the t3 torx screwdriver to unscrew them .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the 4 T3 screws in the back of your watch, and use the T3 Torx Screwdriver to unscrew them.

Lines.Text: use the metal spudger to pry open the back of your watch .
make sure the watch is off and not plugged in when prying into the case with the metal spudger to avoid the risk of electric shock .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Metal Spudger to pry open the back of your watch. Make sure the watch is off and not plugged in when prying into the case with the Metal Spudger to avoid the risk of electric shock.

Lines.Text: remove the back case .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the back case.

Lines.Text: use tweezers or a nylon spudger to pry up the four press-fit connectors .
the glued-down connector in the middle is harder to remove than the rest . that is perfectly fine .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers or a nylon spudger to pry up the four press-fit connectors. The glued-down connector in the middle is harder to remove than the rest. That is perfectly fine.

Lines.Text: locate the two phillips 00 screws holding down the motherboard , and use the phillips 00 screwdriver to remove them .
ensure to place these screws separately from the torx screws , as they can easily be mixed up .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two Phillips #00 screws holding down the motherboard, and use the Phillips #00 screwdriver to remove them. Ensure to place these screws separately from the Torx screws, as they can easily be mixed up.

Lines.Text: use the metal spudger to lift the mother board from the watch .
the metal spudger may cause damage to the device , use a nylon spudger when possible .

Lines.Text: remove the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the motherboard.

Lines.Text: use the metal spudger to carefully lift the battery from the watch .
ensure that the polarity ( +/- signs ) of the new battery match that of the old battery when inserting new battery into device .
a metal spudger may cause damage to the battery or device . use an pick when possible .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Metal Spudger to carefully lift the battery from the watch. Ensure that the polarity (+/- signs) of the new battery match that of the old battery when inserting new battery into device. A metal spudger may cause damage to the battery or device. Use an [https://www.ifixit.com/Store/Tools/iFixit-Opening-Picks-set-of-6/IF145-123-2|opening pick] when possible.

maintain this orientation to follow the guide .

The clips have small lips that you can put the spudger under to get more leverage. Using any of the metal to pry out the electronics may damage some of the wiring. It is crucial to only press on the plastic.

Lines.Text: insert a plastic opening tool under the bezel , and then pry the bezel up .

Lines.Text: when prying the bezel off , ensure that you don't apply too much force and lose the 3 components needed for reassembly . doing this over a container to catch the parts is a useful safety measure .
1 : metal bezel ring
2 : plastic retainer
3 : the watch itself

Steps.Text_raw: When prying the bezel off, ensure that you don't apply too much force and lose the 3 components needed for reassembly. Doing this over a container to catch the parts is a useful safety measure. 1: Metal Bezel Ring 2: Plastic Retainer 3: The Watch Itself

Lines.Text: cleaning the metal bezel can be done using the tool previously used to pry the bezel off . there is a small ridge along the inside that will collect gunk . running the edge of your pry tool through this ridge will clean out anything stuck in there , and make step 5 much easier .

Steps.Text_raw: Cleaning the metal bezel can be done using the tool previously used to pry the bezel off. There is a small ridge along the inside that will collect gunk. Running the edge of your pry tool through this ridge will clean out anything stuck in there, and make step 5 much easier.

Lines.Text: cleaning the plastic retainer will require much more care than the bezel , due to how fragile it is . holding it carefully in between two fingers , gently rub a cotton swab against the part that is supported by your finger holding the retainer . rotate the retainer as you clean the surface to ensure full coverage .

Steps.Text_raw: Cleaning the plastic retainer will require much more care than the bezel, due to how fragile it is. Holding it carefully in between two fingers, gently rub a cotton swab against the part that is supported by your finger holding the retainer. Rotate the retainer as you clean the surface to ensure full coverage.

Lines.Text: the side of the retainer that has a ridged surface needs to face down in the watch .

the retainer sits in the groove around the inside of the metal bezel as shown in the image . take notice of the orientation of the retainer in the image . the retainer should seat in the groove on the bezel without applying force .

Steps.Text_raw: The side of the retainer that has a ridged surface needs to face down in the watch. The retainer sits in the groove around the inside of the metal bezel as shown in the image. Take notice of the orientation of the retainer in the image. The retainer should seat in the groove on the bezel without applying force.

Lines.Text: once you have the retainer seated in the bezel , place the bezel face down on your watch face placing the side with the in the retainer down first . if you do not do this , the retainer may not seat properly , as shown in the first photo .
if that happens , gently pry the bezel and retainer up by hand , re-seat the retainer in the bezel , and try again .
once you have successfully replaced your bezel on the watch , it should feel like new and rotate freely again .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have the retainer seated in the bezel, place the bezel face down on your watch face placing the side with the [https://d3nevzfk7ii3be.cloudfront.net/igi/V5WpCtdt5KFUuqXH|split|new_window=true] in the retainer down first. If you do not do this, the retainer may not seat properly, as shown in the first photo. If that happens, gently pry the bezel and retainer up by hand, re-seat the retainer in the bezel, and try again. Once you have successfully replaced your bezel on the watch, it should feel like new and rotate freely again.

Steps.Text_raw: Keep the watch flat on your workstation.

Lines.Text: locate the three screws on the circuit board .
remove using the j000 phillips head screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the three screws on the circuit board. Remove using the J000 Philips head screwdriver.

Lines.Text: carefully disconnect the connector wire on the bottom left edge of the circuit board using a plastic opener tool .
move apart the connector to expose the fourth screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully disconnect the connector wire on the bottom left edge of the circuit board using a plastic opener tool. Move apart the connector to expose the fourth screw.

Lines.Text: remove the final screw from the circuit board with a j000 phillips head screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the final screw from the circuit board with a J000 Philips head screwdriver.

Lines.Text: turn the watch to the side and use the plastic opening tool to lift up the circuit board .
remove the circuit board from the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the watch to the side and use the plastic opening tool to lift up the circuit board. Remove the circuit board from the case.

Lines.Text: after removing the circuit board , the battery is located in the middle of the case .

Steps.Text_raw: After removing the circuit board, the battery is located in the middle of the case.

Lines.Text: locate the battery connector on the left side of the case .
carefully disconnect the wire using a metal spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the battery connector on the left side of the case. Carefully disconnect the wire using a metal spudger.

Lines.Text: after disconnecting the battery use the plastic opening tool to lift the battery off of the case .
there battery might be glued to the case .

Steps.Text_raw: After disconnecting the battery use the plastic opening tool to lift the battery off of the case. There battery might be glued to the case.

Lines.Text: wear proper gloves when using a heatgun .
use a heatgun to melt the adhesive beneath the screen . heat the metal around edges of the screen .
avoid heating the rubber watch band as it will quickly melt .
heating the lcd screen may damage it . avoid this procedure unless you intend to replace the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Wear proper gloves when using a heatgun. Use a heatgun to melt the adhesive beneath the screen. Heat the metal around edges of the screen. Avoid heating the rubber watch band as it will quickly melt. Heating the LCD screen may damage it. Avoid this procedure unless you intend to replace the screen.

Lines.Text: use a and plastic picks to pry the screen away from the band 2.

Steps.Text_raw: Use a  [https://www.ifixit.com/Store/Tools/Spudger/IF145-002-2|spudger]  and plastic [https://www.ifixit.com/Store/Tools/iFixit-Opening-Picks-set-of-6/IF145-123-2|opening picks] to pry the screen away from the Band 2.

Lines.Text: use metal tweezers to gently detach the orange press-fit ( or pop ) connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Use metal tweezers to gently detach the orange press-fit (or "pop") connector.

Lines.Text: use the t3 torx screwdriver to remove the two 2.7 mm screws

Steps.Text_raw: Use the T3 Torx Screwdriver to remove the two 2.7 mm screws

Lines.Text: lift the logic board and locate the two circular clips securing the buttons from inside the wall of the band 2. remove them by sliding the clips sideways .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the logic board and locate the two circular clips securing the buttons from inside the wall of the Band 2. Remove them by sliding the clips sideways.

Lines.Text: remove the buttons , being careful not to lose the springs .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the buttons, being careful not to lose the springs.

Lines.Text: assess the eyewear for nose pad damage or cracks .

Steps.Text_raw: Assess the eyewear for nose pad damage or cracks.

Lines.Text: place a 3-inch strip of tape on the lenses to protect them from being scratched .

Steps.Text_raw: Place a 3-inch strip of  tape on the lenses to protect them from being scratched.

Lines.Text: unscrew the nose pad screw using a phillips-head screwdriver . turn the screw counter-clockwise until the screw can be removed

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the nose pad screw using a Phillips-head screw driver.  Turn the screw counter-clockwise until the screw can be removed

Lines.Text: remove the old nose pad and replace with a new one .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the old nose pad and replace with a new one.

Lines.Text: place the screw back inside of the nose pad and turn clockwise until the screw is tight . do not overtighten .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the screw back inside of the nose pad and turn clockwise until the screw is tight. Do not overtighten.

Lines.Text: repeat steps on other side .

Steps.Text_raw: Repeat steps on other side.

Lines.Text: remove the screw from the pad arm .
if the screw is missing , get a backup screw , and proceed to step 2.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the screw from the pad arm. If the screw  is missing, get a backup screw, and proceed to step 2.

Lines.Text: insert the nose pad into the mount on the frame .
make sure the nose pad lines up with the screw hole .
while holding the nose pad in place , use the magnet to attract the screw head .
make sure the screw is vertical to the magnet and the screw head is above .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the nose pad into the mount on the frame. Make sure the nose pad lines up with the screw hole. While holding the nose pad in place, use the magnet to attract the screw head. Make sure the screw is vertical to the magnet and the screw head is above.

Lines.Text: place the screw into the screw hole .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the screw into the screw hole.

Lines.Text: using a horizontal motion , remove the magnet .
don't use a vertical motion to remove the magnet , otherwise the screw will come out .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a horizontal motion, remove the magnet. Don't use a  vertical motion to remove the magnet,  otherwise the screw will come out.

Lines.Text: holding the glasses with the screw head pointing up , tight the screw with the screwdriver .
make sure the screw is tightened enough .

Steps.Text_raw: Holding the glasses with the screw head pointing up, tight the screw  with the screwdriver. Make sure  the screw is tightened enough.

Lines.Text: prepare sewing machine with its compatible invisible zipper foot .
thread the needle thread through the invisible zipper foot hole .
pull the needle thread through the zipper foot hole .

Steps.Text_raw: Prepare sewing machine with its compatible invisible zipper foot. Thread the needle thread through the invisible zipper foot hole. Pull the needle thread through the zipper foot hole.

Lines.Text: locate the stitch lines of where the broken zipper was sewn on both sides of your garment .
use a seam ripper to carefully rip out both of the stitching lines .
make sure to '''''++not ++'''''cut through the fabric .
remove old invisible zipper .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the stitch lines of where the broken zipper was sewn on both sides of your garment. Use a seam ripper to carefully rip out both of the stitching lines. https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+to+Rip+a+Seam/19500 Make sure to '''''++not ++'''''cut through the fabric. Remove old invisible zipper.

Lines.Text: turn the skirt inside out .
place the replacement invisible zipper on the table , with the teeth side pointing up and the zipper pull facing down .
unzip the invisible zipper . line up the left side of the tape of the invisible zipper with the left side of your fabric .
the zipper teeth should 1 /8 away from the edge of the fabric .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the skirt inside out. Place the replacement invisible zipper on the table, with the teeth side pointing up and the zipper pull facing down. Unzip the invisible zipper. Line up the left side of the tape of the invisible zipper with the left side of your fabric. The zipper teeth should 1/8" away from the edge of the fabric.

Lines.Text: pin the tape of the zipper to your garment's fabric perpendicular to the invisible zipper .

Steps.Text_raw: Pin the tape of the zipper to your garment's fabric perpendicular to the invisible zipper.

Lines.Text: place the teeth of the left side of the zipper into the right side of the invisible zipper foot .
when repeating on the opposite side of the zipper , place the teeth of the right side of the zipper on the left side of the invisible zipper foot .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the teeth of the left side of the zipper into the right side of the invisible zipper foot. When repeating on the opposite side of the zipper, place the teeth of the right side of the zipper on the left side of the invisible zipper foot.

Lines.Text: sew a straight line carefully , removing pins as you go .
repeat steps 5-8 on the right side of your garment .

Steps.Text_raw: Sew a straight line carefully, removing pins as you go. Repeat Steps 5-8 on the right side of your garment.

Lines.Text: turn the skirt right-side out again , so you don't see the zipper teeth .
rotate the fabric so the zipper foot is perpendicular to the zipper tape .
position the zipper foot on top of the fabric 1 /8th of an inch from where the zipper tape meets the garment .
sew back and forth at least 6 times to seal the end .
this ensures that the zipper tab does not come off when you zip it up .
flip garment over to see the stitch line you just made . cut off excess zipper tape .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the skirt right-side out again, so you don't see the zipper teeth. Rotate the fabric so the zipper foot is perpendicular to the zipper tape. Position the zipper foot on top of the fabric 1/8th of an inch from where the zipper tape meets the garment. Sew back and forth at least 6 times to seal the end. This ensures that the zipper tab does not come off when you zip it up. Flip garment over to see the stitch line you just made. Cut off excess zipper tape.

Lines.Text: pull up your newly replaced zipper .
be proud of yourself ! you've just replaced an invisible zipper !

Steps.Text_raw: Pull up your newly replaced zipper. Be proud of yourself! You've just replaced an invisible zipper!

Title: Taking in the Waistband of a Skirt

Lines.Text: try on the skirt to see how big it is .

Steps.Text_raw: Try on the skirt to see how big it is.

Lines.Text: measure the amount to take in .
using a pin , mark the length of your measurement on either side of the side ''seam'' .

Steps.Text_raw: Measure the amount to take in. Using a pin, mark the length of your measurement on either side of the side ''seam''.

Lines.Text: ''seam rip'' the waistband from the lining , about an inch past the pins on either side .
if you've never used a seam ripper before , check out this handy guide on to use a seam ripper .
red arrows indicate the length of the measurement . orange arrows indicate the length of seam ripped .

Steps.Text_raw: ''Seam rip'' the waistband from the lining, about an inch past the pins on either side. If you've never used a seam ripper before, check out this handy guide on [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+to+Rip+a+Seam/19500|how to use a seam ripper]. Red arrows indicate the length of the measurement. Orange arrows indicate the length of seam ripped.

Lines.Text: seam rip the waistband from the skirt .
seam rip past the first pleat on either side of the side seam .

Steps.Text_raw: Seam rip the waistband from the skirt. Seam rip past the first pleat on either side of the side seam.

Lines.Text: seam rip the top of the waistband , about an inch past your measurement on either side .

Steps.Text_raw: Seam rip the top of the waistband, about an inch past your measurement on either side.

Lines.Text: flip the outer waistband inside out .
pinch the waistband together at the side seam .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the outer waistband inside out. Pinch the waistband together at the side seam.

Lines.Text: on the waistband , pin the distance of your measurement from the side seam .
sew across the waistband at the location you pinned .
make sure to remove the pin before sewing and back stitch at the beginning and end so the stitches don't unravel .
trim off the excess fabric .

Steps.Text_raw: On the waistband, pin the distance of your measurement from the side seam. Sew across the waistband at the location you pinned. Make sure to remove the pin before sewing and back stitch at the beginning and end so the stitches don't unravel. Trim off the excess fabric.

Lines.Text: repeat steps 6 and 7 on the inner waistband .
make sure the two waistbands are the same length before you sew the inner one shorter .

Steps.Text_raw: Repeat steps 6 and 7 on the inner waistband. Make sure the two waistbands are the same length before you sew the inner one shorter.

Lines.Text: press the ''seam allowance'' on the new side seam flat and fold the top and bottom down .
align the top edges , with the seam allowance turned to the inside .
stitch across the top of the waistband , right next to the edge .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the ''seam allowance'' on the new side seam flat and fold the top and bottom down. Align the top edges, with the seam allowance turned to the inside. Stitch across the top of the waistband, right next to the edge.

Lines.Text: turn the skirt inside out .
pin the pleats of the skirt to the waistband , so the skirt and the waistband are the same length .
try to follow the location of the original pleats , but make them deeper to account for the excess fabric .
stitch the skirt and waistband together .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the skirt inside out. Pin the pleats of the skirt to the waistband, so the skirt and the waistband are the same length. Try to follow the location of the original pleats, but make them deeper to account for the excess fabric. Stitch the skirt and waistband together.

Lines.Text: mark where the seam line on the waistband matches up with the lining .
stitch from that point to the seam line on the lining , forming a slight curve .
trim the excess fabric off .

Steps.Text_raw: Mark where the seam line on the waistband matches up with the lining. Stitch from that point to the seam line on the lining, forming a slight curve. Trim the excess fabric off.

Lines.Text: stitch the lining to inner waistband .
turn the skirt right side out .
top stitch the inner and outer waistband , catching the seam allowance from the other side .
make sure the seam allowance is on the waistband side of the seam so the top stitching will secure it .

Steps.Text_raw: Stitch the lining to inner waistband. Turn the skirt right side out. Top stitch the inner and outer waistband, catching the seam allowance from the other side. Make sure the seam allowance is on  the waistband side of the seam so the top stitching will secure it.

Lines.Text: stitch both waistbands together , following the side seam from the outside .

Steps.Text_raw: Stitch both waistbands together, following the side seam from the outside.

Subject: Waistband

Title: How to Repair a Rectangle Closure Hook Clasp on Clothing

Lines.Text: collect the article of clothing that requires a clasp repair .
locate the clasp and identify the area that needs the sewing repair .
if your clasp is completely removed from the garment , be sure to place it in the original store bought position .

Steps.Text_raw: Collect the article of clothing that requires a clasp repair. Locate the clasp and identify the area that needs the sewing repair. If your clasp is completely removed from the garment, be sure to place it in the original store bought position.

Lines.Text: choose some thread in a matching or similar color to the garment .
ensure that the type of thread is appropriate for the repair . avoid using embroidery floss , dental floss , or rope .
choose a needle , preferably one that is small and thin .
smaller needles leave smaller holes in the garment and are less likely to cause issues while sewing .

Steps.Text_raw: Choose some thread in a matching or similar color to the garment. Ensure that the type of thread is appropriate for the repair.  Avoid using embroidery floss, dental floss, or rope. Choose a needle, preferably one that is small and thin. Smaller needles leave smaller holes in the garment and are less likely to cause issues while sewing.

Lines.Text: cut an arm's length of the thread .
shorter lengths of thread are easier to manage while sewing . longer pieces will tangle and knot .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut an arm's length of the thread. Shorter lengths of thread are easier to manage while sewing.  Longer pieces will tangle and knot.

Lines.Text: take the cut length of thread and poke it through the eye ( hole ) of the needle .
take your time ! this step requires concentration and patience .
pull the thread through the eye of the needle until it is about a hand's length .
you should now be looking at a threaded needle with thread long on one side and short on the other .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the cut length of thread and poke it through the eye (hole) of the needle. Take your time!  This step requires concentration and patience. Pull the thread through the eye of the needle until it is about a hand's length. You should now be looking at a threaded needle with thread long on one side and short on the other.

Lines.Text: take the threaded needle and make a simple double knot on the long end of the thread .
snip off the extra thread near the knot .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the threaded needle and make a simple double knot on the long end of the thread. Snip off the extra thread near the knot.

Lines.Text: check the garment and cut off any old pieces of thread from the clasp area .
keep in mind that this step is only necessary if the old thread from the previous sewn binding is in the way of your repair .

Steps.Text_raw: Check the garment and cut off any old pieces of thread from the clasp area. Keep in mind that this step is only necessary if the old thread from the previous sewn binding is in the way of your repair.

Lines.Text: hold the clasp firmly in its desired place .
poke the needle through the inside of the garment , aiming for the inside of the clasp .
remember to always check whether or not your fingers are in the way while sewing . otherwise you will poke your fingers !

the end knot on the thread should always be hidden on the inside of the garment . in this example , the knot was hidden beneath the extra material on the inside of the garment . this is known as the seam allowance .
pull the needle through until the knot catches and you are unable to pull anymore .

Steps.Text_raw: Hold the clasp firmly in its desired place. Poke the needle through the inside of the garment, aiming for the inside of the clasp. Remember to always check whether or not your fingers are in the way while sewing.  Otherwise you will poke your fingers! The end knot on the thread should always be hidden on the inside of the garment.  In this example, the knot was hidden beneath the extra material on the inside of the garment.  This is known as the seam allowance. Pull the needle through until the knot catches and you are unable to pull anymore.

Lines.Text: flip to the outside of the garment .
check to ensure that the needle is placed on the outside of the clasp before continuing .
poke the needle through the fabric . aim for a spot in the garment's seam to hide your new stitches .
pull the needle all the way through until the thread has snugly pushed the clasp close to the garment's fabric .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip to the outside of the garment. Check to ensure that the needle is placed on the outside of the clasp before continuing. Poke the needle through the fabric.  Aim for a spot in the garment's seam to hide your new stitches. Pull the needle all the way through until the thread has snugly pushed the clasp close to the garment's fabric.

Lines.Text: turn the garment to the inside again .
poke the needle through the fabric , aiming for the inside of the clasp .
tug the needle all the way through until it catches .
repeat steps 7-9 as many times as necessary . this action creates a group of stitches that hold the clasp in place .
more repetitions of the stitches will create a sturdier binding for the clasp .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the garment to the inside again. Poke the needle through the fabric, aiming for the inside of the clasp. Tug the needle all the way through until it catches. Repeat Steps 7-9 as many times as necessary.  This action creates a group of stitches that hold the clasp in place. More repetitions of the stitches will create a sturdier binding for the clasp.

Lines.Text: make sure to end your last stitch on the inside of the garment .
poke the needle through the stitches you made and tug until there is a loop .
make sure that the loop is big enough to maneuver the needle through , but not so big that it tangles .
take the needle and pull it through the center of the loop .
pull the needle through the center of the loop again .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure to end your last stitch on the inside of the garment. Poke the needle through the stitches you made and tug until there is a loop. Make sure that the loop is big enough to maneuver the needle through, but not so big that it tangles. Take the needle and pull it through the center of the loop. Pull the needle through the center of the loop again.

Lines.Text: pull on the needle until a knot is formed on top of your stitches .
straighten the threaded needle and hold it firmly .
take a pair of scissors and snip off the extra thread .
check to make sure you do not accidentally cut off the knot too !

Steps.Text_raw: Pull on the needle until a knot is formed on top of your stitches. Straighten the threaded needle and hold it firmly. Take a pair of scissors and snip off the extra thread. Check to make sure you do not accidentally cut off the knot too!

Lines.Text: examine the finished repair in good light .
test the clasp to ensure that it works properly .
check the garment and make sure that the repair stitches are not too noticeable from the outside .

Steps.Text_raw: Examine the finished repair in good light. Test the clasp to ensure that it works properly. Check the garment and make sure that the repair stitches are not too noticeable from the outside.

Lines.Text: begin by placing the watch on its backside .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by placing the watch on its backside.

Lines.Text: gently pull the top of the watch's back until the cap detaches , in a peeling motion .
pull out the white cap and green chip once it is free .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull the top of the watch's back until the cap detaches, in a peeling motion. Pull out the white cap and green chip once it is free.

Lines.Text: carefully puncture the plastic casing next to the battery on top of the green chip with the x-acto knife and stop .
be careful not to insert the x-acto knife too downward into the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully puncture the plastic casing next to the battery on top of the green chip with the X-Acto knife and stop. Be careful not to insert the X-Acto knife too downward into the battery.

Lines.Text: flip the chip around to the front .
in a chiseling motion , make an incision on the front side above the battery to cut out a plastic casing .
make sure to hold the knife away from the hands in a safe , stable grip .
remove the cut plastic casing over the battery .
the plastic casing should come off like a cap .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the chip around to the front. In a chiseling motion, make an incision on the front side above the battery to cut out a plastic casing. Make sure to hold the knife away from the hands in a safe, stable grip. Remove the cut plastic casing over the battery. The plastic casing should come off like a cap.

Lines.Text: gently remove the battery with a spudger or a wooden coffee stick .
using too much force may detach the tab holding the battery and break the watch .
once free , remove the dead battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently remove the battery with a spudger or a wooden coffee stick. Using too much force may detach the tab holding the battery and break the watch. Once free, remove the dead battery.

Lines.Text: insert the new battery .
place the cut plastic cap casing over the chip and battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the new battery. Place the cut plastic cap casing over the chip and battery.

Lines.Text: place the white cap over the green chip .
insert the white cap and green chip into the back of the watch with the spudger or wooden coffee stick .
turn over the watch and check the power .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the white cap over the green chip. Insert the white cap and green chip into the back of the watch with the spudger or wooden coffee stick. Turn over the watch and check the power.

Title: How to Repair a Bra Underwire

Lines.Text: push the underwire into the hole until it is no longer visible .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the underwire into the hole until it is no longer visible.

Lines.Text: thread the needle .
pull the thread to a length of about 8 inches .
match the length of the thread on each side of the loop and cut with the scissors .
doubling up the thread in this way allows for stronger and longer-lasting stitches .

Steps.Text_raw: Thread the needle. Pull the thread to a length of about 8 inches. Match the length of the thread on each side of the loop and cut with the scissors. Doubling up the thread in this way allows for stronger and longer-lasting stitches.

Lines.Text: loop both ends of the thread around your index finger .
pinch the ends of the thread between your index finger and thumb and roll your index finger downwards until the loop slips off .
carefully take hold of the loop and pull to create a knot .
sometimes the knot created the first time may not be large enough . repeat the last three instructions a second time to make a larger knot .

Steps.Text_raw: Loop both ends of the thread around your index finger. Pinch the ends of the thread between your index finger and thumb and roll your index finger downwards until the loop slips off. Carefully take hold of the loop and pull to create a knot. Sometimes the knot created the first time may not be large enough. Repeat the last three instructions a second time to make a larger knot.

Lines.Text: insert the needle just above the tear in the bra where the underwire came out .
this ensures that the hole will not expand any further and provides extra stability in the stitches .
handle the needle with care to not accidentally injure yourself !

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the needle just above the tear in the bra where the underwire came out. This ensures that the hole will not expand any further and provides extra stability in the stitches. Handle the needle with care to not accidentally injure yourself!

Lines.Text: use a whip stitch to mend the tear .
pull the needle through the fabric until the knot at the end of the thread approaches the incision .
on the opposite side , insert the needle again at a point just after the first incision and pull it through the fabric .
continue this pattern two or three stitches below the tear .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a whip stitch to mend the tear. Pull the needle through the fabric until the knot at the end of the thread approaches the incision. On the opposite side,  insert the needle again at a point just after the first incision and pull it through the fabric. Continue this pattern two or three stitches below the tear.

Lines.Text: repeat the process from step 4 going back upwards towards the tear , over your current stitching .
this gives your stitches extra reinforcement to make sure the tear is not reopened or pushes through the stitches .

Steps.Text_raw: Repeat the process from Step 4 going back upwards towards the tear, over your current stitching. This gives your stitches extra reinforcement to make sure the tear is not reopened or pushes through the stitches.

Lines.Text: close the stitch .
near your first incision , where the knot is , insert the needle into the fabric halfway through .
wind the leftover thread around the sharp end of the needle 3-4 times , then pull the needle through completely .
tug on the needle upwards to tighten the knot created .

Steps.Text_raw: Close the stitch. Near your first incision,  where the knot is, insert the needle into the fabric halfway through. Wind the leftover thread around the  sharp end of the needle 3-4 times, then pull the needle through completely. Tug on the needle upwards to tighten the knot created.

Lines.Text: trim the thread with scissors . leave a few millimeters of thread leftover to ensure that the knot does not come loose .
optional : use a small amount of fabric adhesive over the stitching to fully reinforce it and seal the tear .
leave it without glue and you are done .

Steps.Text_raw: Trim the thread with scissors. Leave a few millimeters of thread leftover to ensure that the knot does not come loose. Optional: use a small amount of fabric adhesive over the stitching to fully reinforce it and seal the tear. Leave it without glue and you are done.

Lines.Text: inspect frame to make certain the monofilament lens retainer is broken . if the wire is not broken , your lens has fallen out and can easily be re-inserted . if the wire is broken refer to the following steps .

Steps.Text_raw: Inspect frame to make certain the Monofilament Lens Retainer is broken. If the wire is not broken, your lens has fallen out and can easily be re-inserted. If the wire is broken refer to the following steps.

Lines.Text: remove the old wire/string from the spectacles using the tweezers as shown in the pictures to the right .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the old wire/string from the spectacles using the tweezers as shown in the pictures to the right.

Lines.Text: cut the new fishing wire between 7 and 9 inches .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut the new fishing wire between 7 and 9 inches.

Lines.Text: hold the glasses in the position shown in the image . there will be a hole near the nose pad , shown by the arrow in the second photo , you will use this to insert the new wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Hold the glasses in the position shown in the image. There will be a hole near the nose pad, shown by the arrow in the second photo, you will use this to insert the new wire.

Lines.Text: insert one end of the wire into the hole near the pad arm and insert the other end to the opposite side of the glasses , then tie the knot as shown in the images .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert one end of the wire into the hole near the pad arm and insert the other end to the opposite side of the glasses, then tie the knot as shown in the images.

Lines.Text: you will see a thin groove along the edge of the glasses . carefully fix the wire around the groove as shown in the pictures .

Steps.Text_raw: You will see a thin groove along the edge of the glasses. Carefully fix the wire around the groove as shown in the pictures.

Lines.Text: after placing the wire around the glasses , stretch the wire , tie it , and make a knot by holding the glasses tightly .
do not tie a knot at the end of wire , but at the location where the wire is holding the glasses tightly .

Steps.Text_raw: After placing the wire around the glasses, stretch the wire, tie it, and make a knot by holding the glasses tightly. Do not tie a knot at the end of wire, but at the location where the wire is holding the glasses tightly.

Lines.Text: now , cut the extra wire from both sides of the glasses using the nail cutter .
use of scissors might make it difficult to cut extra wire . so , we suggest you use nail cutter to cut extra wire .
pay extra attention while cutting a wire , as you might cut more than needed and loosen it , which could lead you to start over .

Steps.Text_raw: Now, cut the extra wire from both sides of the glasses using the nail cutter. Use of scissors might make it difficult to cut extra wire. So, we suggest you use nail cutter to cut extra wire. Pay extra attention while cutting a wire, as you might cut more than needed and loosen it, which could lead you to start over.

Lines.Text: in the end , check if your glasses are tight enough to wear . if the glasses are tight , they are ready to wear .

Steps.Text_raw: In the end, check if your glasses are tight enough to wear. If the glasses are tight, they are ready to wear.

Title: Microsoft Band 2 defective battery connection/ribbon Replacement

Toolbox.Name: short copper wire awg30 1 at most

Lines.Text: carve away almost all of the rubber of the straps . ( leave the rubber surrounding the battery/heart rate clasp end . )

Steps.Text_raw: Carve away *almost* all of the rubber of the straps.  (Leave the rubber surrounding the battery/heart rate clasp end.)
